story:
(photo of Poondev, Seetaram's father, and his two little boys in front of the hospital)

Stretch Goal! Sitaram's Upcoming Surgery

The family is doing better, mom Rani is in remission and is getting treated for her CML, and Sitaram's next reconstructive surgery is scheduled for this month. The two younger boys are in school and thriving, and they are all beginning to lead normal lives. 

Please continue to support the family as Sitaram goes through his next three or four reconstructive surgeries to restore his mouth area. He still can't eat normally or close his mouth properly, and has no tongue and teeth. But he's living as normal a teenager life as possible, thanks to you! 

Stretch Goal! Help Mom Rani with Medical Expenses 

We are so grateful for your support, which has helped us hit our initial goal to assist Seetaram's family with food and housing for their stay in Mysore. 

Now, let's keep it going and help their mom Rani with her medical emergency. 

Soon after moving to their house, Rani experienced severe stomach pain. She went to the hospital but they were unable to help her (government hospital facilities are a challenge for many reasons). We transferred her to a quality medical facility, where the doctors diagnosed CML leukemia -- devastating news, especially after all that has happened to the family. 

Poondev, Rani's husband, was told of the news by the doctor, and it was almost too much for him to bear. First, his son. Then, his mother in Bihar died. Now his wife.

Poondev after hearing the news.

Rani is in ICU for three days, where they are monitoring her blood pressure and other vitals. They have started medication to help reduce her white cell count but she still has spontaneous bleeding in her abdomen (the cause of her pain).

The initial estimation for the hospital stay is $1,500. Please consider making a donation to cover this additional expense.

On a good note, we took Poondev to see his younger sons (age 5 and 6), who are staying temporarily at our children's home. The boys were overjoyed to see dad! "Papa papa!" And then they told him everything they've been up to -- mostly playing like fiends -- and the hot meals they get (!) because they experienced several mealtimes with no food to eat.

On July 30, Rani was discharged from the hospital, and we moved the entire family to our home, so they could be together -- for the first time since February they were not in a hospital! -- and we could better manage their situation. 
On August 3, little Bharath and Lakshman, Sitaram's brothers, started school! They were really excited and looked very cute in their school uniforms.
Sitaram is well -- he is eating a lot so that he can gain weight for his next surgery at the end of September -- he won't be able to eat for a while after the surgery so is trying to eat a lot now. He has started tutoring at our home with our teachers.

Thank you again for your generous support.

Operation Shanti is a U.S. 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization with charitable activities in Mysore, India (www.operation-shanti.org). Your donation is tax deductible to the extent allowed by U.S. tax laws.

FUNDED: $1,800! Seetaram's Story

Seetaram, a teenager from Bihar who came to work in Mysore with his father, is the victim of a mobile phone that exploded in his face in February, severely injuring his mouth and jaw area. 

Seetaram's parents -- manual laborers -- spent what money they had on his initial treatment at a private hospital. After they ran out of funds, the hospital discharged the boy and the family found themselves on the streets of Mysore. 

The media got wind of the family's situation and the Mysore District Legal Services Authority stepped in to provide legal assistance to the family, and got Seetaram admitted to the local government hospital in June to continue his treatment.

http://www.deccanherald.com/content/482573/legal-services-authority-rescue-mobile.html

The family has no money for daily meals and had no place to live, so they (father, mother, and two little brothers) slept on the hospital grounds. They sold just about everything they owned and beg for daily meals. Sometimes people help them with clothing, a few rupees, and other incidentals. But there are five mouths to feed, including Seetaram's two very cute little brothers. 


The DCPU (District Child Protection Unit) of Mysore contacted us in mid-June for assistance, which is how we heard about the family's situation.

We've begun to provide the family with money for food and have found temporary housing for them. One of our street moms, Kumari, generously offered a small room in her small house in the slum to them. 

Rani (Seetaram's mom) and little Bharat at Kumari's house

Seetaram's dad plans to search for more permanent housing but now Rani, the boys' mother, has been admitted to the hospital with a mass in her pelvic area. The two little boys are now with us at our children's home, and dad spends his days at the hospital with Seetaram and his wife. 

Seetaram has three more reconstructive surgeries to undergo in Mysore (covered by the government hospital), expected to take another 8 to 9 months. We will post updates on Rani's condition as we learn more.

Please consider making a donation to help us continue to help Seetaram and his family. 

Thanks so much for your care and concern. No family should be forced to live on the streets.

Operation Shanti is a U.S. 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization with charitable activities in Mysore, India (www.operation-shanti.org). Your donation is tax deductible to the extent allowed by U.S. tax laws.

photo from the Hindu, June 28, 2015; Seetaram and mom at the hospital

(the initial incident is described here: https://in.news.yahoo.com/exploding-mobile-phone-rips-bihar-man-s-face-open-045032189.html)
story_txt:
(photo of Poondev, Seetaram's father, and his two little boys in front of the hospital)Stretch Goal! Sitaram's Upcoming SurgeryThe family is doing better, mom Rani is in remission and is getting treated for her CML, and Sitaram's next reconstructive surgery is scheduled for this month. The two younger boys are in school and thriving, and they are all beginning to lead normal lives. Please continue to support the family as Sitaram goes through his next three or four reconstructive surgeries to restore his mouth area. He still can't eat normally or close his mouth properly, and has no tongue and teeth. But he's living as normal a teenager life as possible, thanks to you! Stretch Goal! Help Mom Rani with Medical Expenses We are so grateful for your support, which has helped us hit our initial goal to assist Seetaram's family with food and housing for their stay in Mysore. Now, let's keep it going and help their mom Rani with her medical emergency. Soon after moving to their house, Rani experienced severe stomach pain. She went to the hospital but they were unable to help her (government hospital facilities are a challenge for many reasons). We transferred her to a quality medical facility, where the doctors diagnosed CML leukemia -- devastating news, especially after all that has happened to the family. Poondev, Rani's husband, was told of the news by the doctor, and it was almost too much for him to bear. First, his son. Then, his mother in Bihar died. Now his wife.Poondev after hearing the news.Rani is in ICU for three days, where they are monitoring her blood pressure and other vitals. They have started medication to help reduce her white cell count but she still has spontaneous bleeding in her abdomen (the cause of her pain).The initial estimation for the hospital stay is $1,500. Please consider making a donation to cover this additional expense.On a good note, we took Poondev to see his younger sons (age 5 and 6), who are staying temporarily at our children's home. The boys were overjoyed to see dad! "Papa papa!" And then they told him everything they've been up to -- mostly playing like fiends -- and the hot meals they get (!) because they experienced several mealtimes with no food to eat.On July 30, Rani was discharged from the hospital, and we moved the entire family to our home, so they could be together -- for the first time since February they were not in a hospital! -- and we could better manage their situation. 
On August 3, little Bharath and Lakshman, Sitaram's brothers, started school! They were really excited and looked very cute in their school uniforms.
Sitaram is well -- he is eating a lot so that he can gain weight for his next surgery at the end of September -- he won't be able to eat for a while after the surgery so is trying to eat a lot now. He has started tutoring at our home with our teachers.Thank you again for your generous support.
Operation Shanti is a U.S. 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization with charitable activities in Mysore, India (www.operation-shanti.org). Your donation is tax deductible to the extent allowed by U.S. tax laws.
FUNDED: $1,800! Seetaram's Story
Seetaram, a teenager from Bihar who came to work in Mysore with his father, is the victim of a mobile phone that exploded in his face in February, severely injuring his mouth and jaw area. 
Seetaram's parents -- manual laborers -- spent what money they had on his initial treatment at a private hospital. After they ran out of funds, the hospital discharged the boy and the family found themselves on the streets of Mysore. 
The media got wind of the family's situation and the Mysore District Legal Services Authority stepped in to provide legal assistance to the family, and got Seetaram admitted to the local government hospital in June to continue his treatment.
http://www.deccanherald.com/content/482573/legal-services-authority-rescue-mobile.html

They sold just about everything they owned and beg for daily meals. Sometimes people help them with clothing, a few rupees, and other incidentals. But there are five mouths to feed, including Seetaram's two very cute little brothers. 

The DCPU (District Child Protection Unit) of Mysore contacted us in mid-June for assistance, which is how we heard about the family's situation.
We've begun to provide the family with money for food and have found temporary housing for them. One of our street moms, Kumari, generously offered a small room in her small house in the slum to them. 



Rani (Seetaram's mom) and little Bharat at Kumari's house
Seetaram's dad plans to search for more permanent housing but now Rani, the boys' mother, has been admitted to the hospital with a mass in her pelvic area. The two little boys are now with us at our children's home, and dad spends his days at the hospital with Seetaram and his wife. 
Seetaram has three more reconstructive surgeries to undergo in Mysore (covered by the government hospital), expected to take another 8 to 9 months. We will post updates on Rani's condition as we learn more.
Please consider making a donation to help us continue to help Seetaram and his family. 

Thanks so much for your care and concern. No family should be forced to live on the streets.

story:
T.J Lang has rightfully been outspoken about the robbery of our beloved game by the NFL and the replacement refs.

T.J. is going to be fined by the NFL and the GREAT ROGER GOODELL.

I am an NFL fan like every one of you and have grown up playing football and sports and believe the Integrity of the game, which we teach to our children, has been unequivocally called into question by the actions of the NFL to break the referees union.

We want to help T.J. by raising funds to pay for the NFL fines he will incur for saying what every NFL fan is thinking. I believe every NFL fan wants to voice their opinion about the loss of integrity these replacements are enacting each week.

Roger Goodell sent a letter this year talking about "The Integrity of the Game" in reference to the Bounty scandal in New Orleans (Inserted Below). However, the NFL’s actions allowing the replacement refs to continue and not settling the 3.3 million dollar dispute with the union is ridiculous and unequivocally affecting the integrity of the game.

T.J. Lang took to twitter to voice his unhappiness with the Replacement Refs and the NFL and will now be fined.

Here is T.J.’s Tweets he will be fined for

 

TJ Lang ‏@TJLang70

Got “expletive” by the refs.. Embarrassing. Thanks nfl

 

TJ Lang ‏@TJLang70

“Expletive” it NFL.. Fine me and use the money to pay the regular refs.

 

TJ Lang ‏@TJLang70

Any player/coach in Seattle that really thinks they won that game has zero integrity as a man and should be embarrassed.

 

TJ Lang ‏@TJLang70

Only thing I regret from my tweets are the F bombs.. Sorry bout that.

 

Let's support T.J. and the integrity of the NFL by helping pay for his fines.

This fundraiser gives the fans of the NFL a voice through action!

We will present T.J. Lang a check for the money raised on a nationally broadcast show. Some funds will be used to purchase the "PERKS."

 

Whatever we raise will specifically go to helping T.J.

But more importantly the gear and donations will be the loudest voice you can have. Turn your contempt into a positive by donating to help T.J.’s fines and getting some cool one of a kind PERKS.

I will be turning this campaign into a short film for the fun of it as I do documentary films in both the sports and feature world. Let's get the word out that we, as a fan community, hold highly the integrity of professional sports and should be given the professional quality we deserve in all aspects of the game.

Please take to Twitter, Facebook & all other social media to exploit this cause. Follow T.J Lang on twitter @TJLang70.



(Roger's Letter)
To NFL Fans:

The 2012 NFL regular season is about to begin, and it promises to be another exciting, competitive, and unpredictable year of football which NFL fans have come to expect every season.

Part of our responsibility in helping teams and players prepare for each NFL season is to make sure they understand and respect league policies and rules. As always, we hold everyone, including ourselves, strictly accountable for protecting the integrity of the game, starting with the health and safety of our players. This year is no exception - bringing with it a clear, consistent, and renewed emphasis on enforcing our longstanding “bounty” prohibition.

Let me be clear: there is no place for bounties in football. No exceptions. No excuses. Bounties are an affront to everything that competitive sports should represent. Everyone in the NFL is responsible for adhering to these rules and we are all accountable for protecting the safety of our players - present and future.

The bounty prohibition forbids offering or accepting any reward - cash or otherwise - for on-field misconduct, plays that incentivize or result in injury to opposing players, or for performance against an opposing player, group of players, or team. The bounty prohibition not only preserves the competitive integrity of our game, but also protects player safety by removing incentives that could lead to dangerous play or unnecessary and/or intentional injury. As a league, we will ensure that the prohibition against bounties is clearly understood and consistently enforced. Period.

We will aggressively protect the health, safety and long-term livelihood of our players, both on the field and off. We can preserve the fierce competition that makes football great, while simultaneously committing to the relentless pursuit of safer play. Our players do not make excuses on the field; we will not make them off the field.

It is our job to protect, preserve, and promote the game of football that we all love. We want an exciting game featuring the worlds most talented football players enjoying long and successful careers. The bounty prohibition plays an instrumental role in achieving that. And we are committed to holding every team, player and owner accountable.

We appreciate your interest and hope you enjoy the 2012 NFL season.
Roger Goodell

story:
Our goal was to develop a simple and reliable water treatment system that provides a permanent source of high-purity, sterile water from any source of water, even ocean water, that can be easily deployed anywhere in the world. We succeeded! Now we need your help to raise $1 million so we can fine-tune the design and create the infrastructure to bring it to market.

Thank you for checking out my project. I have been developing and fine-tuning the Survival Still over the past decade, but a wise man* wrote a book that kicked me in the pants and made me realize that itâ€™s now time to make it public and solicit support so we can start saving lives.

The Problem
The global water crisis is devastating! Every few seconds a parent watches helplessly as their child dies from diarrhea because of unclean water. Thousands of children die every day! Right now, over ONE BILLION people donâ€™t have access to clean drinking water.

Everybody wants to protect their loved ones, but itâ€™s hard to lift your family out of poverty when you are constantly sick or dying from dysentery, arsenic poisoning or parasites. The global water crisis is one of the most serious problems facing this planet.

How can this be? We are wealthy, incredibly generous and we have the will, but something is missing...

The problem is that we have been trying to use the wrong technologies to fix the problem. Filters work fairly well in the US, but not so well in 2nd and 3rd world countries. In poor countries, people have to deal with extremely contaminated water that is often full of sand, mud, toxic metals, mining chemicals, petrochemicals and deadly microbes.

The main reason that filters donâ€™t and CANâ€™T solve the water crisis is something that you already know; all filters eventually fail, which is why you have to keep changing your filters every few months. In the USA, if the filter on your faucet fails your water may not taste as good as it did yesterday, but when your filter fails in a 2nd or 3rd world country deadly parasites or bacteria (such as cholera) could pass through without you even knowing it!

Filters simply canâ€™t solve the water crisis. Neither can ozone, UV Lights, or chemicals, like chlorine.

We Need A Better Solutionâ€¦
Pure Water Revolution is taking a different approach to solving the water crisis. Our goal was to develop a simple and  reliable water treatment system that provides a permanent source of high-purity, sterile water from any source of water, including ocean water, that can be easily deployed anywhere in the world. We succeeded! The result; the Survival Still.

The Survival StillÂ®
The Survival Still produces high-purity, sterile drinking water from any source water, even ocean water. Itâ€™s extremely effective on all types of contaminants, and unlike filters, itâ€™s a permanent solution.
â€¢    The Survival Still permanently supplies high-purity, sterile water.
â€¢    Is extremely effective against all types of contaminants.
â€¢    Kills and removes bacteria, viruses and parasites.
â€¢    Is a permanent solution for purifying sea water.
â€¢    Does not need filters, electricity, infrastructure or a supply chain.
â€¢    Is a single, global solution.
 


The Survival Still will change the worldâ€¦
We can give a Survival Still to a family anywhere in the world and from that point on, and for the rest of their lives they wonâ€™t have to worry about water purity again. Their families will be protected from biological contaminants, toxic metals, petrochemicals and even radioactive contaminants. They will lead healthier lives. They will be better able to educate themselves and give back to their communities. Fewer children will die.

In addition to improved water purity, families in 3rd world countries will have greater access to water, because they can use the ocean or other previously off-limit water supply as their source water.

The Proof
Recently, we ran ocean water through the Survival Still. The ocean water had over 30,000 parts per million (ppm) of contaminants in the water, which is highly contaminated. After running the water through the Survival Still, it had only 6 ppm! This is a 99.98% reduction, and since it uses the process of distillation, these results will remain consistent for the life of the machine. In addition, the water was contaminated with bacteria. The Survival Still has NEVER had anything less than 100% removal of bacteria.

What We Need the Money Forâ€¦
The proof of concept is done. The Survival Still is extremely effective. Now we need to take the R&D to the next level by recruiting the best minds in the water distiller industry and other industries to create the ultimate unit for families in 3rd world countries.

We want to make it even more effective, suitable for as many locations as possible, easier to use, lower cost and possibly reduced energy requirements. Our goal is to optimize the design so we can mass produce it and get the lowest costs possible.

We will need tooling, product coatings, testing, prototypes, extensive third-party testing and certifications. We will develop manufacturing infrastructure, and relationships with businesses that will be able to handle the production requirements. In addition to making the unit better, we will be developing graphic instructions as well as researching different technologies for audible instructions in many languages for people who canâ€™t read.  We will finish forming our charity, create our website, fine-tune the branding and marketing, and team up with non-profit charities and churches all across the world.

In addition to this, as part of our effort to raise awareness and to educate people about Pure Water Revolution and the importance of this project, we will be creating a short documentary film about the creation of the Survival Still and all the thought that goes into creating the best possible solution.

We are asking for contributions of $1 million (from IndieGoGo and elsewhere) for this development work. Our goal is to raise this money before July 4th, and then have all of the development work done by November 1st, 2012, at which point we will start a massive effort to start saving lives.

We Need Your Help
The Survival Still is an amazing solution, but for it to make a difference we have to bring it to market. We ask for help in 3 waysâ€¦
  1. CONTRIBUTE WHAT YOU CAN. $10 would be great, $1,000 or more would be awesome!
  2. SHARE, SHARE, SHARE! Get the word out to everyone you can. Like us on Facebook and sign up for our blogs and then repost and comment!
  3. GET YOUR CHURCH INVOLVED. Churches are going to be the most important vehicle we have to take the next step.

Check out our website at www.PureWaterRevolution.org.

* The wise man who wrote the book that kicked me in the pants was Seth Godin, and the book was Poke the Box.

story:
Hello, my name is Sherrie. I am starting this campaign to get my fiancee home for ememrgency leave from the military. His father has been diagnosed with a terminal form of cancer, and he hasn't seen him in seven years. I don't want my love to not be with his father before he passes. For me to get him home, the military makes you pay for all charges accured with the leave. Please help me get the love of my life home, so that he can be with his father.

We need $4000 to get him home. There is Adminstration Charges, Processing charges, and the cost of the returning home ticket. The Admin charges are 1200. The Processing charges are 900, and the ticket home is 1900. As a waitress I just can't afford this, so please help me.

Thank you for all your help, you will be making my fiancee and I both very happy in this very difficult time.

story:
uvSABA (Ultra-Violet Safe Air Breathing Apparatus)

 

Meet uvSABA™

uvSABA (Safe Air Breathing Apparatus) is perfect for anyone who wants the ability to live their lives with the peace of mind that they are breathing healthy air.  From travelers and technicians who need to maximize their clean air environment while working or traveling, to urban and suburban residents running everyday errands, uvSABA was designed for you.


Unlike masks or respirators, uvSABA does more than filter the air; it neutralizes it with UVC.  uvSABA alleviates fear and allows you to safely visit:

  • Airports/Planes
  • Crowded public spaces
  • Classrooms
  • Work meetings and the office
  • Social gatherings
  • Events and Conferences

Easy to carry in a backpack.  Strap/handle option in progress.

Travel with peace of mind

Safely visit family and friends in their homes

How Does uvSABA Work?

uvSABA is a lightweight solution that pushes safe, UVC treated air at a comfortable pressure to the nose and face via the following steps:

1.  UVC light exposes the air within concealed chambers

2.  Exposed air is pushed to the face through the apparatus

3.  Safe exposed air is available to breathe

 

 

Key Features

  • UVC neutralization chamber
  • Positive pressure
  • Makes masks more comfortable with safe fresh air 
  • Safe for travel
  • Battery operated, optional wall power option
  • Protects you from leaks in PPE
  • Does not require disposable filters

UVC-LED tunnel 

uvSABA effectively integrates UV-C technology to safely expose the air you breathe in real-time.

 

Production version is an improvement over the prototypes shown here.  For example, the clear window is not part of the production version. 

What Separates Us From the Competition

  • Easily can function while eating and drinking
  • Can be stored inside a bag or backpack
  • No human exposure to UVC light
  • Long battery life and the ability to safely charge or exchange batteries without removing your PPE

 

Safety Comparison Chart

Intended UVC light Wavelength Range

The wavelength is centered around 272 nm making it very effective UV-C light, but not in the range that creates Ozone.  

About Us

We are an entrepreneurial team of experienced innovators.  We were recently asked to be part of a project at Stanford entitled Rebuild: Innovating for a Post-[pandemic] Future and are launching uvSABA for early adopters and those who need it most.   Along with electrical engineers and developers, we have 2 Ph.D. scientists on the team and 3 MDs advising this development.  With sufficient funding, we can scale manufacturing, add tech hires, launch pilots with testing agencies and technical support companies, and start partnering with airlines, restaurants, churches, schools, and entertainment such as the NFL, AMC, Disney, and Universal.  Your feedback is valuable to us and in turn we are ramping up manufacturing for you to have safe air as early as feasible.

We realize the urgency of this time and want you to have access again.  Your backing and donations show demand to justify further investment and  help us bring you access quickly.  You can also visit uvsaba.com to learn more.


What We Need & What You Get

  • The funding is going towards development and manufacturing.  We are using it to provide early adopters products and to scale the development so that we can meet future demand.  The greater the demand over a short amount of time, the more funding we need. But, we can also benefit from scale, so please back one for every member of your team or family.  Perks will be filled on first come, first served basis.  
  • Early backers will have the device first and have a chance to interact with the development team to help us improve any features. 

We are considering multiple options for your face interface.   Different users have comfort and fit preferences, so we want you to have the one that fits your needs.  It is intended that a surplus of air is provided so that a cloud of treated air is available for you wherever you go.

The Impact

This personal clean air purifying device provides you clean air to breathe on the go.  Consumers and business leaders praise the patent pending concept as valuable and innovative.  They want a solution now.  Alleviating fear is a big benefit for everyone worldwide.  Traveling helps bring us back to efficiently doing what needs to be completed to bring the economy back again.

The device is patent pending.  The team has members who have developed and patented more than 100 new products for big businesses and industry (NASA, NIH, NSF, and many well known brands), some products you use everyday.      

uvSABA will help create or save jobs in the US.

uvSABA easily passed through airport security check.

 

uvSABA is starting to show up in the Media

 

Risks & Challenges

uvSABA is a first in its category.  It’s also the byproduct of a new and uncertain time and there are many unknowns ahead.  We know from experience it takes planning, hard work, and perseverance to successfully launch a new product.

The team has taken steps to mitigate risks such as shipment delays, product defects, or supplier reliability.  Over the past months, we have been prototyping, testing, and refining to make sure the perk we deliver to our backers exceeds expectations.  What you’re seeing on this page are prototypes, so expect the final product to look and perform even better. 

The team will update you regularly on progress.  Our manufacturing partners are on board and they assure us they have the materials and manpower to get everything produced on time and to our exacting standards.   In fact, many manufactures are thankful for the extra demand we are creating for them during the pandemic. 

The final risk is any disruption in the transport of goods globally.  We’re monitoring volatility in the airline and shipping industries closely and we’re committed to doing our best to make sure you get your uvSABA in a timely manner.  All uvSABAs are made in the USA, which helps with our domestic shipping.

We still recommend following the CDC guidelines such as not touching your face or keeping your distance.  This Ultra-Violet Safe Air Breathing Apparatus (uvSABA) is also compatible with masks.  While masks may not do everything you want, they do slow down droplets and are complementary to the functionality of uvSABA.

Image showing base of uvSABA

Manufacturing lineup.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out to anyone who you think could benefit from uvSABA.

Be sure to follow us on social media:

Facebook: https://bit.ly/3mEzbRu

Twitter: @uv_saba
story_txt:
uvSABA (Ultra-Violet Safe Air Breathing Apparatus)
 

Meet uvSABA™
uvSABA (Safe Air Breathing Apparatus) is perfect for anyone who wants the ability to live their lives with the peace of mind that they are breathing healthy air.  From travelers and technicians who need to maximize their clean air environment while working or traveling, to urban and suburban residents running everyday errands, uvSABA was designed for you.
Unlike masks or respirators, uvSABA does more than filter the air; it neutralizes it with UVC.  uvSABA alleviates fear and allows you to safely visit:

Airports/Planes
Crowded public spaces
Classrooms
Work meetings and the office
Social gatherings
Events and Conferences

Easy to carry in a backpack.  Strap/handle option in progress.

Travel with peace of mind 

Safely visit family and friends in their homes 

How Does uvSABA Work?
uvSABA is a lightweight solution that pushes safe, UVC treated air at a comfortable pressure to the nose and face via the following steps:
1.  UVC light exposes the air within concealed chambers
2.  Exposed air is pushed to the face through the apparatus
3.  Safe exposed air is available to breathe
 
 

Key Features 

UVC neutralization chamber
Positive pressure
Makes masks more comfortable with safe fresh air 
Safe for travel
Battery operated, optional wall power option
Protects you from leaks in PPE
Does not require disposable filters

UVC-LED tunnel 

uvSABA effectively integrates UV-C technology to safely expose the air you breathe in real-time.

story:
Lagos Air Disaster Appeal

A commercial airplane on its way to Lagos from Abuja crashed on Sunday 3rd June, causing Nigeria’s worst air disaster in nearly 20 years. All 153 people on board were killed as the jet crashed into buildings in the Agege neighbourhood. Please help OK! Nigeria raise money to support the families of the victims by donating just a few Naira, Pounds or Dollars.  These funds will go to the families and to help regenerate the neighbourhood affected.

Businessman, entrepreneur and Founder of OK! Nigeria, Alexander Amosu feels compelled to help the families involved in this terrible tragedy. Members of his staff have lost friends on this flight so this issue is close to our hearts.

The OK! Nigeria team felt that we needed to do something, however small to help the families and victims of the disaster. Every penny counts at this particular moment. Please help by donating any amount, all proceeds will go directly to the families who have lost loved ones and also those families who have lost their homes and possessions as a result of the accident.

We urge you to share and pass on this information, we have an ambitious challenge of raising as much money as possible, please help. Together we can show that Nigerians love each other and can stand together in times of crisis.

 

www.oknigeria.com/lagosairdisasterappeal

story:
Who is Dawn?

Dawn is only 39 years old.  Dawn and I got married in April of 2010.  She and I both had travelled a long road to find each other.  She even sang to me a rendition of "God Blessed the Broken Road" at our wedding.  Not a dry eye in the place, including mine!  Before we found each other, Dawn had four beautiful and wonderful girls.  I had two handsome sons.  We were living our own lives, but knew life would not be complete without each other. 

A little after we got married, Dawn developed a "turning" in her left hand.  She had already been diagnosed with Graves' Disease, but once that was brought under control, her symptoms progressed into tremors in her left hand, and eventually her left arm.  She has been to several doctors: neurologists, movement specialists, endocrinologists, you name it.  All signs have pointed to early-onset Parkinson's Disease.

Unfortunately not much data or research is available for PD, much less people in their 30's that develop it.  It is very unusual for people under 50 to develop PD, and most of the new diagnoses are for people 65 or older.  Her symptoms most closely resemble PD, but again with so little data available to support a diagnosis, her doctors have recommended a DaTscan.  This procedure is a new development, having been approved for use on the public just in 2011.  It is so new that insurance will not cover it.  We do, and are very grateful to have health insurance, but unfortunately a DaTscan is not in their menu of coverage,

Why We Need Help

Through the myriad doctor's appointments, copayments, deductibles, and other out-of-pocket expenses, simply getting to this point has been a challenge for our family.  We fear it will only be a further challenge as long as we do not know if we are dealing with Parkinson's.  Granted a DaTscan, much like a doctor's diagnosis, cannot be expected to be 100% reliable, but the DaTscan could at the very least rule out other conditions that resemble PD, or to that end, rule out PD altogether.
 
But we may never be able to rule anything out until whatever it is has progressed to a point beyond doctors' abilities to provide effective treatment.

What We Will Do With Funding

The doctors estimate the DaTscan can cost $2,500+ itself, but Dawn may also need to spend a night or two in the hospital, again with no insurance coverage.  We are therefore asking for your help to pay for the DaTscan and immediate associated costs...no more.  We are not looking to get rich or to make spending money.
 
We are setting the initial goal at $5,000.  Anything we get above $5,000 will go to charity - 100% of it.  If the hospital says the cost will be less than $5,000, the difference will go to charity.  Simply put, if we raise more than the actual cost of the DaTscan and hospital stay, 100% of the difference will go to charity.
 
Our chosen charity for any excess funding in this campaign is the Parkinson's Disease Foundation.
 
Check out the perks section, too!
 
Thank you very much for your interest, and even if you can't contribute, thank you from the bottom of our hearts for reading about us!

If You Can't Contribute

All is not lost!  Dawn has become active in raising awareness for Parkinson's Disease.  PD affects about 1,000,000 pepole in the U.S., a very small proportion of who develop PD before the age of 40.  Though PD is a known condition, it is not as well-documented as other disorders.  PD is not a deadly disease, at least directly.  It can however leave sufferers completely disabled, requiring assistance to do even simple things like brushing teeth, tying shoes, or bathing.  If you can't contibute to our campaign, please visit the Parkinson's Disease Foundation's web site at www.pdf.org, and talk to your friends and family about Parkinson's Disease.  Dawn and I, and all those whose lives are touched by Parkinson's Disease will be eternally grateful.

story:
My name is Kim and I am Josh's girlfriend of 7 years.

On January 28, 2012, our family dog, Porkchop, got into a fight with another pit bull. As Josh & our roommate got the dogs separated and Josh was leading Porkchop to his room, Porkchop was able to turn his head and latch onto his right arm. It was in the heat of the moment and Porkchop was pretty angry. He had been an extremely loving dog and a big baby up until this incident. He loved Josh more than anyone else in the house. 

Porkchop had a hold of Josh's arm for only 10-15 minutes but did extensive damage. Police responded within minutes of me calling 911 and had to taze the dog in order to get him off of Josh's arm. When EMS responded, Josh had managed to crawl out into our dining room floor and collapsed, going into shock. While at the hospital, Josh ended up in surgery because as doctors looked at his arm, they realized he had no feeling in his hand. Two muscles had been severed, there was tendon damage and the nerve had luckily only been chewed up. From the photos, you'll see how doctors were able to put his arm back together. Unfortunately, Josh lost all use of his right hand (and yes, this is his dominant hand). Initial doctors said that he would probably not regain use of it. Over the last couple of months, Josh's wrist has contractured badly, meaning that it has bent down and will not raise back up.

Josh's aunt has a neighbor who is a hand specialist and when she told him of Josh's story, he wanted to see him right away. Now, this doctor is hopeful that Josh can regain the use of his hand back through surgery and intense physical therapy. Josh has been out of work since the incident and the company he worked with did not offer any kind of insurance when he was working. I had been out of work for 2 and a half years before this incident and have only been working for 1 month. So right now, we do not have the funds to make this happen. The doctor is trying to work with us to figure out how to pay for the surgery and everything else so that Josh can regain the use of his right hand.

This money will go towards Josh's surgery and physical therapy after the surgery. Josh wants to be able to return to work. We've struggled over the last few months financially. We almost lost our house until I got a job. I'm only working for minimum wage and we have to rent one of our bedrooms out in order to make ends meet. We are extremely grateful for anything that anyone can help with.

story:
Every day in the UK, around seven young people aged between 13 and 24 are diagnosed with cancer. Think how many young peoples life's are ruined each day. Its time to cheer them up and take there mind off the negatives and focus on the positives.

The Body shop Braehead team are raising money for Teenage cancer trust.The vision of teenage cancer trust is a future where young people’s lives don’t stop because they have cancer. They make sure they’re treated as young people first, cancer patients second and everything they do aims to improve their quality of life and chances of survival. The body shop has already raised £500,000 for the charity and aims for a further £500,000 to make it up to £1,000,000 by the end of the year. 

The Body Shop Braehead are very passionate about the charity and we want to do our bit to raise money to help others in need and make the quality of there life better for them. We are going up Conic hill in Balmaha on the 16th of march so from now until then we hope to raise money to make our goal of helping teenagers transform there lives and to defeat cancer.

story:
Short Summary

Those of you who attended the last party bus may be aware of what happened. One of our friends was hospitalized, and while it was as a result of personal decisions, judgments won't help. But if you want to help, you can take a chip out of some sizable medical bills.

What We Need 

Christina needs anything. Even one dollar helps, and shows we care. Every single cent goes directly to paying off her ambulance, hospital, and doctor's bills. Her total is well over $1,000, so anything we can do to mitigate would be a tremendous help.

The Impact

I would create this kind of thing for any of you that either had an accident or made a poor decision while at one of my events. So while it's nobody else's responsibility, I thought it would be sweet to at least ask.

story:
Promoting a Healthy Body Image for Young Girls - Emily, Lisa, and Grace are three friends with different body types. Together they learn some great lessons. The comic is geared towards making young girls feel good about themselves and not relying too much on what others think about their bodies. A good story and a great message.

The book will be available interntionally online, and in print in the United States and Canada. Our hope is to make it into a series.

We are a group who are passionate about promoting healthy body images for young women to feel good about themselves. The book we are working on will be a positive message that will make kids feel good about themselves regardless of their weight, while maintaining a healthy lifestyle. (please note the images are in character developement and may look slightly different than images posted)

We are hoping to make it into a series that will also introduce other young girls of different backgrounds and diversity. This first book deals with 3 good friends who learn some positive lessons about their bodies.

All the money donated will be put towards designing and drawing of the book which will then be available for free download and also available in a print format.  So donate what you can but if not please share with others who may be interested. Thanks!

What We Need & What You Get

Depending on the level of donation you will get everything from our heartfelt thanks, to items such as the book itself and swag such as t-shirts and other cool stuff.

    The Impact

    Media is still portraying woman as stick thin waifs and packaging it up as glamorous and the look to be. Girls should be brought up knowing that as long as they are healthy they are fine being thin, 'normal' or what some in society may call overweight. It's about accepting yourself and making positive changes.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you can contribute to the book but would like to help please use the tools provided to spread the word and help us reach our goal. It's so very appreciated. Look for the helpful links under the main image for ways to help spread the word.

        Cool Beans.

The Impact Media is still portraying woman as stick thin waifs and packaging it up as glamorous and the look to be. Girls should be brought up knowing that as long as they are healthy they are fine being thin, 'normal' or what some in society may call overweight. It's about accepting yourself and making positive changes.  Other Ways You Can Help If you can contribute to the book but would like to help please use the tools provided to spread the word and help us reach our goal. It's so very appreciated. Look for the helpful links under the main image for ways to help spread the word. Cool Beans.

story:
Can you image being singled out for extermination because of your race and or your religion, a trained army committing War crimes against innocence villagers? YES this still happens today.    Can you image after surviving this still standing tall and declaring your race and religion no matter what the consequence. The bravery and determination of the South Sudanese people to be free of oppression is something to see. I have been there delivering shelter and clean water on the border. When they asked me with joyful tears in their eyes "will you return to help the others" I said YES without hesitation. This campaign is a part of an overall campaign to go back.

Disaster Aid USA responds to disasters, humanitarian crises, and war torn regions to build transitional communities.

PLEASE SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN WITH YOUR FRIENDS, LET US BE A VOICE FOR THE VOICELESS.

STATEMENT OF NEED

 

The invasions of Abyei in 2008 and in May 2011 resulted in utter disaster, involving loss of lives and property, and displacement of150,000 Ngok Dinka residents.  The deployment of the UN Interim Security Force in Abyei (UNISFA), the Ethiopian Peacekeepers, has improved the security in the area.  The Ngok Dinka of Abyei are now seeking to return, but all of their possessions were burned and or looted.

 

The people of Abyei are in need of disaster assistance to overcome the life safety challenges upon returning to an area devoid of basic shelter and clean water, with fatal health risks such as water borne illnesses and malaria.  The schools, health facilities, and churches were also devastated during the invasions of Abyei.  There is an overall need for transitional shelters that can serve as temporary facilities for the resumption of life in Abyei.

SCOPE OF WORK

 

 Disaster Aid USA (DAUSA), and Disaster Aid International (DAI) offer to implement the Shelter, Clean Water, and Disease Reduction Initiative, which is an integrated service delivery program for Family Survival Kits, which contain transitional shelter facilities combined with health risk reduction, and solar lighting. As a solution for rebuilding communities, the Initiative empowers the returning Ngok Dinka of Abyei with essential household and community assets as a direct response to the humanitarian crisis brought about by the forced displacement.

 

This kit is specifically designed for the South Sudan situation after 2-previous deployments, the advice of the local officials and our local NGO partner KUSH.  It is designed to provide the protection and benefit across several different risk factors for the least cost.  The families will need the above as they move back and start rebuilding.  As the villages were entirely burnt to the ground, returnees are in desperate need of protection and aid .. 

 

Furthermore, if needed, Disaster Aid and KUSH can convert transitional shelter facilities into temporary schools and clinics.  

 

PLEASE TAKE A LOOK A THE VIDEO OF OUR PAST DEPLOYMENTS WHICH INCLUDES SOUTH SUDAN.  YOU CAN SEE THE IMPACT OUR AID , RESPONSE TEAMS AND COMPASSION MAKE.  YOUR DONATION WILL BE USED TO PURCHASE THE AID AND DELIVERY TO THOSE MOST IN NEED.

PLEASE SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN WITH YOUR FRIENDS

YOU CAN FOLLOW TH DEPLOYMENT ON DISASTER AID USA FACEBOOK PAGE.  IT WILL BE UPDATED REGUARLY FROM THE FIELD.

WE DONT HAVE ANY PERKS FOR THE DONOR SO AS MUCH OF THE DONATION AS POSSIBLE CAN GOES TO THOSE IN NEED.

story:
My friend Amy is only 48 ...

... but she is likely going to die if she can’t continue to get treatment for a heart disease that has already killed several members of her family – and that’s if the bills don’t kill her first. That may sound like an exaggeration, but when your house is close to foreclosure (we narrowly avoided a foreclosure sale in September) and you can’t afford food, electricity and gas most months, let alone the hundreds of thousands of dollars in medical bills owed and an ongoing need for health insurance premium funds and medicine, well, you can imagine the stress. And stress like that is bad news for Amy’s heart. Which is in bad enough shape of its own.    

Amy has familial hypertrophic cardiomyopathy ...

... which is genetic (it killed her dad when he was 46 and at least one teenage cousin; another cousin survived thanks to a heart transplant). It causes her heart to go out of normal rhythm and into a racing rhythm. This makes her body think she’s running a marathon, which would be good, except she’s not and it doesn’t stop, which is bad. It exhausts her, leads to heart failure and makes even the slightest exertion overwhelming.

But first let me introduce you to Amy ...

For more than 20 years, she was a respected journalist in Georgia – in Valdosta, Augusta, Savannah, Hinesville and back to Augusta again. She’s reported on everything, from city government to crime to the military to the death of legendary soul singer (and Augustan) James Brown one Christmas Day. But she hasn’t just reported. She also helped those she wrote about too. Here are two examples: Once, during floods in Savannah, she and another reporter walked back to the newsroom (her truck was stuck on a flooded street), wrote their stories and then went back out in the rain and bought food, drinks and diapers to give to the people they’d met at a shelter. Another time, an elderly woman called the newsroom in Augusta because her Meals on Wheels hadn’t been delivered in days, and she was diabetic, in a wheelchair and almost out of food. Amy gave her own debit card to a friend (Amy couldn’t leave work) and asked her to buy groceries and deliver them to this woman.

Amy’s also helped her friends over the years too. I met her when she helped me with one of my first stories as a reporter and I had no idea who the subject was or what I was doing really. She also invited me to her home for food before I received my first paycheck, and later, she organized a surprise party for me because she saw I was down in the dumps and missing home on my first birthday away. And all this was before she threw me a bridal shower a few years later and single-handedly rescued my son’s first birthday party (let’s just say planning is not my thing, and my guests would have starved except for birthday cake).

Amy left journalism a few years ago to continue to help, this time her mother, Miss Annette, who was suffering from Alzheimer’s disease. Like any mother-daughter, Amy and Annette had their differences over the years, but there was no way that Amy was going to send her mother off to be cared for by somebody else. Amy has no siblings, and her dad died in 1976. For years, Amy rarely left Annette’s side, even if that meant being homebound for the most part when it became too difficult to take Annette out to visit friends. Amy used up her 401K so they could live on that and Miss Annette’s retirement pay as a teacher just to get by in those years.

Miss Annette died last year, and soon after, Amy knew the exhaustion she was feeling was more than grief.  She’d been to various doctors over the years and received various diagnoses, none correct. Her condition has deteriorated rapidly, from just getting winded easily to barely being able to move and having fainting spells. She’s had a pacemaker and a defibrillator implanted, and those have helped keep her alive (people with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy are at great risk for sudden death – in fact it is a well-known cause of sudden death in seemingly healthy athletes), but she will likely need a heart transplant in the near future.

Even so, Amy works a part-time writing job from home. She doesn’t want to have to beg for money. She wants to be the one TO help people, not receive help. But her part-time work barely pays for her utilities and this is where she is in life now. Her friends have helped and continue to help, but the need goes beyond us. Meanwhile, Amy has applied for Social Security disability, but her case hasn’t been approved yet. And the bills keep pouring in.

I can’t promise a fantastic reward for helping Amy ...

... I can promise you my (and her) personal thanks and a lifetime of gratitude to you. $5, $10, $1,000 (hey, it COULD happen!) – every bit will help my friend survive a bit longer. Thank you from the bottom of my heart.

 

Melissa Cummings

story:
Executive Summary

The RED RAIN uses a social model of health, using harm minimization; health promotion, social inclusion; and community participation approaches to promote physical, emotional and social health and wellbeing for its client groups

Run by ex sex workers , the project will thrive to achive the following objectives:

  • To provide relevant health promotion and support services to improve the health and wellbeing and minimize risk to sex workers.
  • To use community participation model to ensure the responsiveness of THE RED RAIN to the needs of sex workers.
  • To advocate for systemic and legal changes to improve the health and wellbeing of sex workers including reducing discrimination and violence against sex workers; increasing the social inclusion of sex workers and promoting equitable access to health and other relevant services for sex workers.
  • To develop and strengthen key partnerships that support THE RED RAIN to achieve positive health and wellbeing outcomes for sex workers

My name is Thandiwe Nonceba Austin,and I am based in Johannesburg, South Africa(http://www.rooftops.ca/english/newsResources/index.asp?page=186). I am an ex sex worker, living positively with AIDS, and an activist for sex workers who want to exit due to illness. We are starting around the streets of Johannesburg, and we beliive that with contributions from funders like you, we can make a huge impact.

We have  special responsibilities and exist under special constraints that make implementing, measuring and improving performance more difficult. Our decision making strategy is based upon the “good news” that non-profit community grassroots organizations can use the a systematic five-step process for maximizing performance that has worked so well for organizations in the private sector.

We have developed  a  five-step process systematically that helps us to pinpoint the tasks that are most critical for organizational success, and to motivate people toward achieving maximum long-term performance on our  core tasks. The approach is applicable at a variety of levels, including individual performers, teams, units, and the organization as a whole.

Through case studies and simulations, the we use the process to address the issues  that may be helpful in getting the best results  in strategic decision making proccess  about our direction and future. As a grassroots process, this has seemed to work so far.

The RED RAIN is a case management service for street sex workers (female, male & transgender), over 18yrs, who are not currently being case-managed, are HIV positive, or suffering from AIDS and related illness and are wanting to reduce the hours they work in the sex industry. In a country with high HIV prevalence, just like in the mainstream employment, many sex workers are not prepared to deal with the reality that one day they will not be able to work due to illness, and hence the need to prepare them for exit situations that are beyond their control. While we believe that it’s an individual choice to exit, we have to look at the realities that at one point some sex workers will be forced to retire due to matters beyond their control.

We have been going into the dangerous streets of Johannesburg since 2010, and we offer advice, education and sexually transmitted infection (STI) prevention tips to the street sex workers but we must admit the program does not generally help them to get out. It’s very difficult for street sex workers to adhere to the strict requirements of their medical obligations, i.e. taking medication regularly, going to healthy checkups, and they usually work in harsh weather conditions, which even makes their conditions worse, and sticking to diet requirements is also difficult as they work long hours.

It’s easy for people to say that if sex workers wanted to get out of the industry they could just walk away. They simply don't appreciate how hard it is. Sex workers live in a climate where extortion, blackmail and fear of physical abuse from former or current partners are an everyday reality; they are often socially isolated, and are terrified that family members will learn of their involvement in prostitution; on top of this, their mental health issues include depression, anxiety and self-harm.

We have been fortunate to witness a few sex workers exit street prostitution over the last two years, to live more healthy and fulfilling lives – but each time it was a gradual and long-term process, with high levels of support required. While it has taken much effort, not least from the sex workers themselves, we would say these outcomes have come about because their health and other associated issues were being properly addressed.

Our targets are street sex workers (female, male & transgender), over 18yrs, who are not currently being case-managed, are HIV positive, or suffering from AIDS and related illness and are wanting to reduce the hours they work in the sex industry.

We have established that mostly sex workers in our target areas of Johannesburg enter  sex work for vast and varied reasons. Poverty, child abuse, living in state care, drug use and the influence of pimps and peer groups are definitely common themes. In most cases, economic necessity is by far the primary reason why a significantly large percentage of individuals began sex work. The majority of survival or, street-based sex workers have had negative experiences with mainstream social services and they feel judged and stigmatized when asking for aid.

If poverty or substance abuse remains as standing issues in their lives, the feeling of being “trapped” keeps them from making alternative choices. Sex workers who would not be classified as impoverished may benefit from the income, the relative independence, and the lifestyle but again may also be trapped due to the disassociation from the mainstream world.

It must be understood that exiting is a process, not an event. It is a culmination of experiences in a person’s life that contribute to their decision to exit. Therefore it will take a number of new experiences to help successfully facilitate it. Many sex workers leave the industry due to violence, reduced earning potential, drug dependence, or a desire for a better life. Many leave because they have had access to structured exiting supports and jobs that pay livable wages.

Exiting programs are aimed at expanding structural and relational supports and building capacities for change through the identification and mobilization of available assets and resources. Unfortunately, a successful exit from the sex trade is not solely dependent on individual traits such as a deep desire to leave. There are many “trapping” factors such as criminal records, the lack of resources for transition or the lack of available employment that undeniably plays a large role in sex worker exiting decisions and possibilities.

The process of exiting is typically fraught with starts and stops. On average, it can take 4-5 attempts before a sex worker feels sustainable in the mainstream world. This “yo-yoing” once again supports the need for strong relational factors and supports to encourage individual capacities and abilities for a successful exit. There may be an occurrence of a negative or a positive event that results in a sex worker desiring to exit such as a bad date or a potential healthy relationship. This reactionary mode may help the worker take steps in finding supports and reducing isolation. Some sex workers explore and weigh out alternatives to their current circumstance, an action that greatly contributes to accomplishing their goals in the “straight” world while others simply age-out where involvement in sex work comes to a natural end.

The stigma of the sex trade can brand the psyche of those in it and counseling, non-judgmental and experiential support are vital in helping former sex workers reclaim their lives.

Sex workers should be supported through the entire process of exiting, including instances where they have re-entered due to a lack of viable employment options. A holistic approach to programming is critical as it takes into account the interpersonal, social and structural factors that come onto play during transitioning. Much work is required with individuals and existing resources to create a continuum of services that support lasting change.

First and foremost, the stabilization of sex workers desiring to leave the trade is critical, especially in the area of HIV/AIDS illness. Without HIV/AIDS treatment, it is futile to strategize a long-term personal development plan for access into the mainstream world.

We are looking for US$10 000.

The money will be used to formalize our organisation to be a fully fledged legal entity, secure office space, and launch our first phase of our compaign.s

Should you donate US$5000 or, the campaign will be named in your honour. Otherwise any donor will be acknowledged on our wall of donors, and will be made honourary members of the organisation.

This funding will enable us to be able to have a large impact, and collaborate with government agencies such as hospitals and social development.  We will be able to ensure and monitor infected and sick sex workers stick to their treatment regimes. We will have a dedicated group of volunteers, receiving a stipend, who will execute their duties, and therefore make a large impact.

Many sex workers who want to exit because of their health situations, we will be able to assist them receive medical care they deserve, as well as their families, if they need home based care. We have seen a large number of sex workers who are abandoned by brothels and their pimps because they can’t work due to their ill health.

At the moment, there is insufficient funding available – with existing services being provided by dedicated people operating 'on a shoe string'. More services – and more effective ones – rely on more generous funding from organizations such as yours.

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

Other Ways You Can Help

We need your help, please share the word around. Your assistance is greatly appreciated

Many sex workers who want to exit because of their health situations, we will be able to assist them receive medical care they deserve, as well as their families, if they need home based care. We have seen a large number of sex workers who are abandoned by brothels and their pimps because they can’t work due to their ill health.
At the moment, there is insufficient funding available – with existing services being provided by dedicated people operating 'on a shoe string'. More services – and more effective ones – rely on more generous funding from organizations such as yours.
Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:


Other Ways You Can Help
We need your help, please share the word around. Your assistance is greatly appreciated

story:
Meet Emily.  Emily has Multiple Sclerosis

Emily's Mom -

"The hardest part of being a caregiver is not really knowing what our loved one is experiencing. We depend on them to tell us what they are going through and how they need our help. We learn what they need without them asking, but we can not really know what is going on in their bodies."  Read more

What is Multiple Sclerosis?

Multiple sclerosis (MS) is a disease in which your immune system attacks the protective sheath (myelin) that covers your nerves. Myelin damage disrupts communication between your brain and the rest of your body.

Depending on the amount of damage and which nerves are affected, some people with severe MS may lose the ability to walk independently or at all, and in some cases loss of vision or their words.  While others experience long periods of remission during which they develop no new symptoms.


Now, meet This MS Life. 

This MS Life provides unique 1-on-1 support connections for those living with MS and their caregivers. We make mentor matches based on more than the fact that you, or someone you love has MS, we make matches based on the person, what they are interested in, religion, sexual preference; and many other things .  When you talk with one of our mentors you’re talking with a friend, who just happens to have MS. 

MS SUCKS. We help it suck a little less.

thismslife.org / 855 MS SUCKS


Testimonials

"Thanks somehow I've finally gotten calmer and am coping better just still adjusting and I'm sure it will be a process. I appreciate having the check-ins and coaching!!!!"

"We had so much in common from how we were diagnosed, things we like; it's like we are kindred spirits!"
"I just spoke with my mentee for about an hour. it was a good conversation. i think she felt we had a lot in common and that was helpful to her. I told her she could call me any time she wants she seems to have the hardest time when her daughter is having a relapse, and I think (hope) she feels she can call me if things get difficult for her.
Thanks for connecting us, and for all you are doing for MS’ers and families!"

MS is worldwide. We want to make sure we are too.

Why are we asking for your help?  Simple.

1.  To continue our mission of unique 1-on-1 support connections and education to the general public about what MS is, and what it can be like for those living with the disease.

2.  Launch of our MS Awareness campaign, which includes TV, print, and digital.  This campaign was generously donated to us by two Executive Creative Directors who between the two, have won numerous industry awards for brands such as Chili's, PGA Tour and AT&T.  

Campaign is ready to launch, we just need your help to do it! 

How much do we need and what is it for?

We are asking for $25,000

70% of funds raised will go towards our MS awareness campaign that will launch later this year, and includes - TV, print and digital.  

30% will cover operating costs (website, phone, printing, LemonHeads, etc).

Other Ways You Can Help

No money, no problem!  You can still help spread the word about us, just click 

This MS Life/Get Involved

story:
Short Summary

Dear all,

This is Dimitris from Vapeteam introducing Dr Konstantinos Farsalinos, a well-known and respected researcher on electronic cigarettes safety/risk profile. For those not knowing him, he has been involved in electronic cigarette research since late 2011 and has published several studies in peer-reviewed medical journals as well as made several presentations of his work in international medical conferences. He strongly believes that electronic cigarettes are a revolution in tobacco harm reduction and supports that with further ressearch we can develop better quality products. 

A recent study performed by Dr Farsalinos revealed the presence of some potentially harmful-to-inhale ingredients in electronic cigarette liquids. In order to define the magnitude of the problem and provide the solution for the safety of all vapers, we decided to organize this fund-raising campaign and obtain as many e-liquid samples as possible that will be tested in an experienced and highly-specialized laboratory.


What We Need & What You Get

  • Our goal is to test more than 100 e-cigarette liquids from manufacturers all over the world. Funds are needed for the cost of obtaining all e-liquids that need to be tested and (mostly) for covering the costs of the specialized laboratory which will perform the analysis. 
  • The liquids and flavorings tested are extremely popular, therefore this research concerns all the vaping community as well as the industry.
  • THE MORE FUNDS WE RAISE, THE MORE LIQUIDS WILL BE TESTED. This will allow us to define the extent of the problem as accurately as possible and will provide a definite solution.
  • We believe this research will provide crucial information and will induce necessary changes in the electronic cigarette market to make the products as safe as they can possibly be.
  • The issue that will be studied is absolutely AVOIDABLE. These are ingredients that should definitely be avoided and can be easily removed. There is a method to make sure that they will not ever be present in e-cigarette liquids.
  • This research will be the perfect opportunity for the INDUSTRY to show its responsibility towards health-related issues. They should also SUPPORT this research project. 
  • Vapers will be reassured about the quality and safety of e-cigarette liquids available in the market.
  • Unfortunately there are no gifts that we can give. Detailed information and proper scientific research is all we can offer.
  • The study and all details will be published in an international medical journal.


The Impact

  • THIS IS A HEALTH-RELATED ISSUE.
  • The problem is complex, because the vast majority of e-liquid manufacturers and suppliers are NOT aware that these chemicals are present in their liquids (or, even worse, they have been falsely informed that they are not present).
  • This research will contribute to making e-cigarette liquids safer.
  • Dr Farsalinos and his research team are renowned for their efforts and contributions to electronic cigarette research.
  • E-cigarette liquids will only become BETTER and SAFER after this research project is concluded.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people may not be able to contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • We encourage you to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Please use social media and Indiegogo sharing tools.

Thank you.

story:
Our Story

July of 2011 I went to the clinic because my left foot was swollen and very sore. They didnt have time to see me and wanted me to come back for an appointment 3 days later. A doctor walked by and checked real quick and said take 1000mg of tylenol and 20 minutes later take 600 mg advil and keep your foot elevated until you get back for your appointment. Two days later I went to the emergency room in terrible pain and was admitted to the hospital. After a few hours I found myself surrouned by 4-5 Dr's and they rushed me to surgery. I had what they call Necrotizing Faciitis (flesh eating bacteria). This is fairly rare and can be fatal. Over the next ten days I went thru three surgeries and had my toes on my left foot removed. I spent thirty days in the hospital. Two months later my left foot was hurting really bad once again. I went to the Dr. that cut my toes off and they sent me directly to surgey once again fearing for my life. They amputated my left leg below the knee. Once again Necrotizing Faciitis had threatened my life. Ten days later I went home. There is no assistance out there for people in my position. Social security is trying to determine if I am disabled. I just want to walk again so I can start helping people.


The Impact

I have learned so much about our system and the political BS that goes on. How hard is it to see that I am disabled? Two years is how long they say it will take to get SSD. Why we have people that need help our government is wasting and throwing away money everyday. I am going to make it my task to fight and expose this to the people and in the mean time help as many others that I can.(What is the impact your campaign may have on others? What if your campaign doesn't happen, what are the consequences? Make it real for people.)


What We Need & What You Get

Prosthetic's are very expensive. Medicaid would pay  for this if I would get approved for disability. I will use the money I raise to get my leg. I am then going to pay this forward and help others. I may do more campaigns to help them. I am going to become a motivational speaker and encourage those with disabilities to fight for themselves and do not wait on the system. Believe that you can do whatever you want. This summer I am going to climb a 14er. This has given me new life and I am going to start living it, and sharing it with others.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this with others. Please know that your help is giving others the oppurtunity to live as normal a life that is possible. Share this site with your friends and famil, your co workers.. Help others achieve their dreams thru your donation. If you go thru anything similar please go back and thank those that took care of you. I have made new friends for life. The nurses, Drs, techs and other staff that took care of me. I owe my life to them. I will be forever indebted to them. They gave me the gift of living.   THANK YOU!!!

story:
Who We Are: 

Members of the Baltimore Student Harm Reduction Coalition (BSHRC) are a diverse network of students, health professionals, and community members who are committed to practicing and spreading harm reduction principles. 

To expand our work, we need $5000 to fund our exciting projects. Your contributions will support our diverse roles, from providing overdose prevention kits to engaging in state-level advocacy.

Harm Reduction is a way of thinking about drug use, sex work, and other conditions that may lead to harmful health consequences that accepts those things as fact and works with people to reduce their harm and celebrate their victories towards self defined goals. 

Since 2011, we have provided education, advocacy and service in the Baltimore area and beyond. Our vision is a world where harm reduction is a fundamental principle in improving health.

BSHRC is a program of local 501(c)3 fiscal sponsorship agency Fusion Partnerships, Inc.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $5000 to sustain our initiatives this year. Here is how your donations help what we do:


All funds raised will go support our projects, even if we do not reach our funding goal.

The Impact

Baltimore, like much of the United States, is experiencing an opioid overdose epidemic. Last year, almost two people a day died of an overdose in Baltimore. 
To help people save the lives of their loved ones, we have given out over 260 overdose rescue kits at 15 trainings throughout Central Maryland, and want to get even more into the hands of our community members. 

Our city has many world class health institutions, and we are one of the only groups supporting Baltimore's most marginalized citizens in achieving their self-identified health goals.  We are also provided harm reduction-related training to students and staff at universities and organizations throughout the area to increase the level of care for all patients.


Other Ways You Can Help

After you donate tell your friends about how awesome we are on Facebook, Twitter, or in an email. 


If you live in the Baltimore area, come to one of our Harm Reduction or Overdose Prevention Trainings. You can find more details on our website!

story:
Randy Reisbord AZA is having its annual dodgeball tournament fundraiser again on Sunday, November 24! The fundraiser will take place in the gym of the ERJCC from 1:00pm to 6:00pm. The tournament is open to anyone aged 12-18. If you would like to play, please create and register (or join) a team of 6-8 players. The price is $20 per player, and the that includes an awesome shirt! It will be tons of fun, and the winning players will get awesome prizes! Come out and support Randy Reisbord AZA and the Houston Hotwheels! Click the link to register your team for the event!
http://reisbord.eventbrite.com/

Snacks and drinks will be provided for all participants free of charge.
Only team captains (or one member per team) will need to register online.
Registration for teams are due no later than November 20th.
Questions? Email Sebastian Kopinsky at sebasko@yahoo.com or Justin Silver at jsilver33@gmail.com

story:
Hi Everyone, this campaign has been created to promote my body butter through Cha-smetic Products an environmentally friendly company. As a first generation Hmong American woman I struggled with many misconceptions about who I was as a Hmong person and with the struggles of achieving because of the great challenges we had as a People.  Coming to America and readjusting to a whole new world for my parents and most Hmong People was difficult and even more so for the first generation children.  As a Hmong Woman there were even more challenges because of the expectations placed by our parents.  However, through the hardship I was determined and self motivated and was able to create something that belongs to me that I can be proud of and in return help those who are not as fortunate as we are here in the United States. 

Just a little more information about the company: We do not test our products on animals. We keep the environment in mind when manufacturing products. The skin is the protector of the body and needs the right nourishment to look its best. Cha-smetic Products is an effortless skincare system containing natural ingredients used by many cultures over thousands of years. Our focus is promoting healthy skin and bodies.

Cha Body Butter promotes in the speedy recovery of severely dry skin and blemishes.  It leaves flawless smooth skin without any heavy residue. 

 Part of the proceeds collected will be donated to "Light For Kids" Orphanage in Thailand. And you may check back on my website to see a receipt that I have donated to the orphanage in the month of July 2013.  Please also check them out and help if you can.

http://www.lightforkids.org/index.php/en/

This is Win - Win situation, You buy for your skin and help a orphan.

Check out the website at

http://chasmeticproducts.wix.com
