story:
Project Summary

Hi everyone. Some of you know me through my art sites, at conventions I attenend, some have probably never met me - either way hello! A short introduction about why you are all here!

My name is Coey and I've been living as a trans man for the last 5 years, taking testosterone for 2 and already completed top surgery 4 years ago. Since being on testosterone you run the risk of getting cysts because your ovaries shut down. Normally this happens - but typically not in the first 5 years. I happen to be one of the exceptions, developing them quickly and in quite the unfortunate cluster. 

I applied to have a hysterectomy and after getting the run around with insurance for a month and ultimately turned down because of a stupid loop hole they pulled. 

This doesn't stop my need for the procedure and now forced to pay out of pocket. 

That's where you all come in!

The surgery in combination with the hospital stay is going to be more than 25k, but I feel indebted enough to anyone willing to pitch in even a dollar that I'd want to raise the remaining amount through my freelance and commission work. I'm hoping that the combination of saving up myself, and this funding campaign I will achieve this goal sooner rather than the much-further-away later.

Either way the money will go towards my surgery but its just a matter of how long saving up on my end will take to compensate.

Rewards

I dont have much to give as far as rewards because of trying to pennypinch but we do have a lot of stock in our onilne shop. So most teirs are going to be vouchers for any item of your choice! SHIRTS. PRINTS. STICKERS. POSTERS. BOOKS. ETC.

http://www.etsy.com/shop/13crowns

http://www.etsy.com/shop/13crowns

http://www.etsy.com/shop/13crowns

http://www.etsy.com/shop/13crowns

!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

The Impact

Not only will you be helping me reach one of my large life goals as a transman but helping in fund future projects as I'm taken back by everyone's generosity and pledge to give each month to a new Indiegogo project or Kickstarter to try to give back to parts of the community that have helped me along.

Special thanks to Anika G., PaiHsin C., Molly+Clint+babyboo Hayden, Sam H., Jessica S. and Elizabeth N. for their early contributions and unbelievable support T A T <33333


Other Ways You Can Help

Cant help out now? That's fine! Try spreading the word via tumblr, facebook, twitter, friends etc! Anything to get this out there and reach who it needs to!

Too late for the Project end date? There's a donate button on the side of my tumblr that is always open for this project : http://coeykuhn.tumblr.com/

THANK YOU EVERYONE FOR VISITING! and hope you have a great day : )

-COEY!

Not only will you be helping me reach one of my large life goals as a transman but helping in fund future projects as I'm taken back by everyone's generosity and pledge to give each month to a new Indiegogo project or Kickstarter to try to give back to parts of the community that have helped me along.Special thanks to Anika G., PaiHsin C., Molly+Clint+babyboo Hayden, Sam H., Jessica S. and Elizabeth N. for their early contributions and unbelievable support T A T <33333






Other Ways You Can Help

Cant help out now? That's fine! Try spreading the word via tumblr, facebook, twitter, friends etc! Anything to get this out there and reach who it needs to!
Too late for the Project end date? There's a donate button on the side of my tumblr that is always open for this project : http://coeykuhn.tumblr.com/
THANK YOU EVERYONE FOR VISITING! and hope you have a great day : )
-COEY!

story:
My Story:

 My name is Edyn Blair, I am 25 and I have lived on my own since I was 18. That same year I began modeling. If you look through my photos you will very rarely ever see me smile. This is because if I do it takes editing to make it look adequate (like the photo attached)

Ever since I was little I have had soft teeth which has led to many fillings and the removal of 2 of my molars over the years. My teeth because of thier softness have even with bleaching been yellow and have now developed calcium deposits at the base and again have fillings that have fallen out and root canals that need to be done. Last week at the Dentist I was told that if I didn't start in process to have the calcium deposits removed, get new fillings, crowns and sealant that within 8 months time my body will start to reject the calcium deposits which, with it being attached to my teeth like cement, will push my teeth out with it and I could begin to lose some of my front teeth and continue from there. Essentially if I am unable to get these fixes I will be in dentures by the time I am 30.

I am a full time student and have a 2 day a week job. I am looking for another. Modeling while fun and while its going well for me doesn't pay unless a company hires you for a campaign. I shoot with show cars and do some promotional work that is paid. But still, I can't afford or get insurance and because I don't make enough money I can't get financing for the surgeries I need. I sold many of my antiques and am in the process of selling my car for money to pay for the surgeries.

I eat well, I work out, I take care of myself. This unfortunately, was inevitable.

I can't ask my family for help because those that are able are paying for my younger sisters pregnancy and medical costs. So I have no other options.

I don't like to ask for help, I pride myself on being able to do things on my own. But I am asking now. Anything helps.

What I Need & What You Get

My costs:

I am getting the work done at LaFevers Dental is Goldsboro, NC

It will be a 9 visit process that start with a full cleaning and examination of the depth of some of the holes of my teeth. This continues into root canals, scaling, and drilling out the calcium deposits at the root of many of my teeth. This is all finished up with crowns on the top 6 front teeth and sealing of the rest of my teeth to keep this from happening again.

The overall cost of the surgery is roughly $11,000.00 But I am just trying to pay for $5000 of it because I don't want to ask for more. The money donated here will give me time so save up my own money to pay for the rest of the work that needs to be done.

I am willing to trade photoshoots for photographers in NC, I also will send anyone that donates a signed poster and personal thank you card. And also a thank you via facebook. If you have a dog and Donate at least $30 visit my etsy store at caninecharm.etsy.com and order a custom collar for your dog. any size. Unfortunately that is all I can do, I wish there was more.

If I don't reach my goal of $5000 the funds that are raised will go towards the dental work regardless.

The Impact

Your donation helps me do something that on my own I would never be able to afford.It helps keep me out of dentures for hopefully a very very long time to come. I will be able to smile. To really smile. To actually bite into apples, corn on the cob and hard food without fear of cracking, loosening or chipping my teeth.
 
I will actually be able to smile without someone asking if I have something stuck in my teeth because they notice the black hole in the front of my mouth.
 
You literally will be saving my smile with your donation.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share my campaign on twitter, facebook, instagram or anywhere. Because even $5 helps even $1 helps.

story:
A Little Bit About Us

The Meus Productions is a Canadian company that began as a platform upon which to create films that are educational and have mainstream appeal while showcasing local talent. Over the last 10 years, The Meus Productions has expanded to become a successful producer of local theatre and film, concurrently discovering and training new and fresh local talent.

The Project

The Meus Productions, in conjunction with Rogers TV, are producing a new lifestyle television show about organic food. Its Organic Baby will focus primarily on mainstream food and its organic, easily prepared counterparts. The show is based upon the ever growing interest in the ramifications of eating food that is not organically grown and the methods open to families for the preparation of viable organic alternatives while showcasing and exposing their potential sources. We request the amount of five thousand dollars ($5000.00) to accomplish and complete the pilot project. The funds requested will be used for a variety of expenses such as equipment, costumes, dedicated crew, shoot location, website and actors.

The Impact

Help us support parents and early years groups by providing information to promote a balanced diet for children. A good diet is particularly important for young children as early food experiences will impact on eating patterns and habits in their adult life.

Other Ways You Can Help

We're accepting contributions in various amounts, from $5 to $1000.  However, we understand that times are hard, and parting with funds may not always be easy.  Please know that you can also support by helping us promote:

Word of mouth is the best kind of advertising, and things like Facebook, Twitter & Pinterest make it even easier.  Send e-mails sharing our links, and tell your friends and co-workers about all our hard work on this project! Please help spread the word about It's Organic Baby! Hoping to promote healthy lunches in schools worldwide starting with Ottawa. 

Indiegogo has great tools for sharing projects that are quick and simple....check those out!

Have a cooking blog? Please share our story and/or review our shades! Contact lisameuser@themeusproductions.ca for more info.

If you own a restaurtant or a farm or organic grocery store or are a distributor and want to partner with us, please contact lisameuser@themeusproductions.ca We would love to work with mom & pop stores, especially if you are willing to help with our charitable cause!!

Stay tuned to our video that we will add next week!

story:
Update

Thank you so much for the outpouring of help and support. We made it! 

Recovery Help

On September 3rd , my nephew a promising college student in the United States, was a passenger in a vehicle involved in a multi-car accident. His mother, my sister, Lori, immediately flew in from Canada to be at his side. She wants to stay and support him through his recovery, but she has to take time off from work while she is at his bedside. It's a real financial hardship for her. We are raising money so that Lori can stay near him and help him recover.
 

As I write this, my nephew is gearing up for his second surgery -- please help his mom stay by his side! 

What You Get

We've created a few unique rewards for friends and family to help. Lori will be creating all of these awesome gifts.

Lori can't work while she is helping her son and is hoping only for enough to cover expenses at home:

  • $100 allows Lori to safely miss work and stay by her son's bedside for a full day
  • $50 allows a half-day for Lori to stay local

We appreciate any level you are able to help! 

If we raise more money than Lori needs, we have selected a very deserving place for the excess funds to go.

 While in California, Lori is staying at Terry's House.

Terry's House has been amazing for families with loved ones at the hospital. When Lori was able to get a room, a lot of the stress and worry about the basics was lifted from her shoulders. She had snacks and access to a kitchen, she had the ability to wash her clothes - it was a huge relief. We would be thrilled to support the mission of Terry's House.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, we understand! Please spread the word, let friends and family know!

Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Friends, my name is Katya, and I received my 200 hour yoga instructor certification almost 4 years ago in New York City with an amazing teacher named Crissy Carter at YogaWorks. It was Chrissy who got me hooked on "intelligent instruction," an approach to teaching yoga that as I see it comes from deep reverence for the power available in this practice, respect for the teacher/student dynamic, keen awareness of keeping the student safe within the practice, and a dedication for dissolving the obstacles of the ego that can hinder a fluid experience of yoga. 

I teach yoga because it has saved my life more than once. Through dark nights of the soul, degenerating stress and, once, teetering physical health, the deep, ever-evolving practice of yoga has been the ladder that has presented itself an pulled me back into balance. And I see it do the same for my students, all of whom, like many people these days for so many reasons, are going through extreme times and seeing many of their safety structures crumbling. 

I've studied many modes of therapy, and this happens to be the one that I feel I have something to offer in. 

As a teacher, one of the most important practices for me is perpetually being a student. I can only teach as long as I am expanding in the knowledge myself, and at this point in my practice I am aware that there is still so, so much I don't know. I would like to help my students get out of chronic pain, and practice safely, and in order to truly keep them safe, I need more knowledge. 

I am lucky enough to have found a training that promises to build on the knowledge that I already have in the specific ways that I am looking for, and one that will launch me directly into the sphere of therapeutic yoga that I am interested in. In addition, it's local - which is huge for me as a single parent - and takes place on a schedule that I can work with (again, challenging as a single parent). 

While I don't have the funds to pay for it out of pocket, and there aren't any scholarships available, I want to believe that it's possible to attend the soonest training, coming up in January. Any help towards this goal will be so monumentally appreciated, much more than I can say. 

What We Need 

Specifically, I need to raise $1300 to cover the full cost of this training. The training itself is called "The Art of Teaching Yoga in the Iyengar Tradition" and is being offered through Blue Spruce Yoga in Lakewood, CO. If you are interested, you can find out all the details at bluespruceyoga.com. 

If I don't reach the entire funding goal, I will look for ways to fill any remaining gap. Whether or not I am able to make it to this year's training, any funding that's gleaned from this project will go toward making it to this training as soon as I can in the future! 

The Impact

So why should you contribute funds to grow yet another yoga instructor on this planet? Well, first, I won't tell you that you should. But I will say that with every highly trained, skillful yoga instructor that emerges in the field, the entire yoga culture gets lifted to a new level, a new standard is set, and the instruction that you can expect to get when you scout out a yoga class has a higher chance of being of excellent quality. 

Okay, I know the value of yoga has gotten watered down and diminished in the past decades, but consider that the ego tends to hijack everything - and the best things seem to experience the worst hijacking. It seems to be a law of the universe. 

SO with yoga, as with anything else that first becomes glamorized and then starts to feel superficial, the hijacking does not reflect the value of the thing itself. This is still a deeply profound practice with the potency to dramatically shift people's lives. 

It's also one of the simplest, most accessible ways to adjust imbalances of all kinds. And it truly is available and accessible to anyone, in some form. 

Risks & Challenges

My clearest and biggest challenge to achieving this is definitely the monetary aspect. I've already gotten the green light from the lead instructor that my experience level is appropriate for the training, and all other pieces are malleable enough. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing this campaign with anyone you think may be interested will be endlessly appreciated. Thanks so much.

story:
Yesterday afternoon, my best friends Kelly and MC arrived home to find a neighbour in the process of riffling through their belongings. They have spent the last few months in an already uncomfortable living situation, with their high-rise building in Toronto lacking proper heat, having frequent leaks, pest problems and neighbours that are unstable and, in some cases, dangerous. This situation has become increasingly scary for them, and with this recent break-in, has now become flat out terrifying. The police have become involved with the attempted robbery, and while they wait for a potential court date, MC and Kelly are left in the uncomfortable situation of living beside the individual (and the man she resides with) who broke into their apartment. On top of this, my friends are struggling to make ends meet due to Kelly's work situation that involves steadily decreasing hours, and sexist treatment from her employers. Unfortunately they have not been able to get back on their feet from their move from Ottawa to Toronto. Kelly is currently looking for work in social activism and advocacy, and volunteers her time between shifts, trying to gain the experience she needs.

Kelly and MC are looking for help covering last month's rent deposit on a new apartment and additional moving costs to put themselves in a home where they and their pets feel safe. They have maxed out available outlets for help and are turning to us, their friends, for a safe space. Many of you know how loving and open MC and Kelly are. They have always extended their help to any friend they thought needed it, whenever they have been able to. If you are at all able to help, any financial support would mean a tremendous amount to them. I know that the holidays are approaching, and that money is tight for everyone, but to help to get them in a safe home would be the greatest Christmas gift possible.

If you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask me!

xoxo,

Steph

story:
Carrey, Jesse and Baby Sophie Need a birth Doula!

Carrey and Jesse were married in 2008 and recently became pregnant with Baby Sophie.  As Carrey progressed in her pregnancy she searched alternatives to medicated childbirth. She found a midwife who will help her succeed at having Baby Sophie without any medication. 

Carrey has also decided she would like a birth Doula. The word "doula" comes from the ancient Greek meaning "a woman who serves" and is now used to refer to a trained and experienced professional who provides continuous physical, emotional and informational support to the mother before, during and just after birth. 

Studies have shown that when doulas attend birth, labors are shorter with fewer complications, babies are healthier and they breastfeed more easily.

The knowledge a doula pocesses can be invaluable to the delivery of baby Sophie! Please help Carrey and her growing family raise enough money to get the support they need. 

 

What We Need 

The doula services Carrey and Jesse seek are $800. These funds go directly to the doula herself, as well as placental encapsulation. 

If the fundraising goal is not met, the doula will be paid with whatever funds we can raise.

story:
Madalena

Madalena is a beautiful six year old child that lives in Mortagua, Portugal and has a rare disease. Madalena’s problem is so rare that her doctors can't even identify her condition. Madalena was born without any complications but after a few months she was not developing as she should. She is not able to do everyday functions, such as: eating on her own, using the restroom, walking, and more. Her mother cares for her ever single hour of the day because Madalena depends on someone at all times.

The wheelchair that Madalena needs will be suited for her specific day-to-day needs. This wheelchair costs over 8,000 Euros (which depending on the currency of the day can total over 10,000 Dollars). Her school has ordered her wheelchair and that is why we need to get the money to her soon!

Please take your time to donate money to my beautiful cousin Madalena. If we raise more than the cost of the wheelchair, exceeding proceedings will be donated to her parents for her physical therapy sessions (in Viseu - which is 45 minutes away from home), medical treatments, diapers, and etc.

Thank you for taking your time to donate. Our family appreciates every single penny!!

Rodrigo Santos & Family

 

If you have any questions please feel free to email me at rodrigosantos@verizon.net. 

NOTE: OUR GOAL IS MORE THAN $4000!

 

Português:

Madalena

 
A Madalena é uma bela menina de seis anos de idade que vive em Mortagua, Portugal e tem uma doença rara. O problema da Madalena é tão raro que os médicos não podem sequer identificar sua condição. A Madalena nasceu sem complicações, mas depois de alguns meses ela não estava se desenvolvendo como deveria. Ela não é capaz de fazer certa funções, tais como: comer por a mão própria, usar o banho, caminhar, e muito mais. A mãe da Madalena cuida dela toda a hora do dia porque a Madalena depende sempre de alguém em todos os momentos.
 
A cadeira de rodas será adequado para as suas necessidades específicas do dia-a-dia. Esta cadeira de rodas custa mais de 8.000 euros (o que, dependendo da moeda do dia podem totalizar mais de 10.000 dólares). A escolinha ja ordenou a cadeira de rodas e é por isso que precisamos conseguir o dinheiro em breve!
 
Por favor, tome o seu tempo para doar dinheiro para a minha linda prima Madalena. Se a gente ajuntar mais do que o custo da cadeira de rodas, o valor superior serão doados a seus pais para as sessões de fisioterapia (em Viseu - que leva 45 minutos de casa), tratamentos médicos, fraldas, e etc
 
Obrigado por dedicar seu tempo para doar. Nossa família agradece cada centavo!
 
Rodrigo Santos e Familia
 
 
Se você tiver alguma dúvida, pode mandar me um e-mail para rodrigosantos@verizon.net.
 
 
 
NOTA: NOSSO OBJECTIVO É MAIS DE $ 4000!
story_txt:
Madalena
Madalena is a beautiful six year old child that lives in Mortagua, Portugal and has a rare disease. Madalena’s problem is so rare that her doctors can't even identify her condition. Madalena was born without any complications but after a few months she was not developing as she should. She is not able to do everyday functions, such as: eating on her own, using the restroom, walking, and more. Her mother cares for her ever single hour of the day because Madalena depends on someone at all times.
The wheelchair that Madalena needs will be suited for her specific day-to-day needs. This wheelchair costs over 8,000 Euros (which depending on the currency of the day can total over 10,000 Dollars). Her school has ordered her wheelchair and that is why we need to get the money to her soon!
Please take your time to donate money to my beautiful cousin Madalena. If we raise more than the cost of the wheelchair, exceeding proceedings will be donated to her parents for her physical therapy sessions (in Viseu - which is 45 minutes away from home), medical treatments, diapers, and etc.Thank you for taking your time to donate. Our family appreciates every single penny!!
Rodrigo Santos & Family
 
If you have any questions please feel free to email me at rodrigosantos@verizon.net. 
NOTE: OUR GOAL IS MORE THAN $4000!

A Madalena é uma bela menina de seis anos de idade que vive em Mortagua, Portugal e tem uma doença rara. O problema da Madalena é tão raro que os médicos não podem sequer identificar sua condição. A Madalena nasceu sem complicações, mas depois de alguns meses ela não estava se desenvolvendo como deveria. Ela não é capaz de fazer certa funções, tais como: comer por a mão própria, usar o banho, caminhar, e muito mais. A mãe da Madalena cuida dela toda a hora do dia porque a Madalena depende sempre de alguém em todos os momentos.
 
A cadeira de rodas será adequado para as suas necessidades específicas do dia-a-dia. Esta cadeira de rodas custa mais de 8.000 euros (o que, dependendo da moeda do dia podem totalizar mais de 10.000 dólares). story:
Our young family member Celeste Chartrand was diagnosed with Cystic Fibrosis just three weeks after her birth on January 1, 2009. Cystic fibrosis (CF) is incurable, and is the most common fatal genetic condition for Canadian children and youth. Without proper treatment and management of their disease, children with CF can easily develop serious lung damage and eventually lose their lung function.   

We do not want this to happen to Celeste. Today, she is 5 years old and with the love and support of her family, is doing the best she can to manage her disease. She  has had 3 times as many hospital visits than the average child of her age. She must take 15-20 pills a day to make it possible for her small body to digest and absorb nutrients from food. One of the effects of CF is that it makes the mucus in Celeste's breathing passages dangerously thick and sticky, which leaves her at high risk for lung infections, the primary cause of death for people living with CF. To prevent this, Celeste does multiple breathing treatments each day, and spends an additional hour each day in physical therapy that is sometimes painful, but helps clear her lungs of the thick mucus. 

Celeste started junior kindergarten this year. In spite of all the hard work to keep her as well as possible, she was only able to attend 28 days of her first year of school. 

Vest For Celeste Fundraiser

We want Celeste to have the best life possible. Our dream is that next year, when Celeste heads off to school, she'll be able to stay for the day and stay for the year. As Celeste's extended family, we are trying to raise funds for Celeste and her family so that they will be able to buy medical equipment that will help make that possible: a Vest Airway Clearance System. 

We have set up this fundraiser because we know that this medical equipment will change Celeste's life. The vest system will improve airway clearance and lung function and, for Celeste, will mean less pain, fewer lung infections, less antibiotics and fewer hospital visits. With the vest, she will be able to attend school, lead a fuller and more fun life, and extend her life expectancy. 

We are trying to raise $15,200 to purchase the equipment. This will cover the actual cost of the vest system (CA$14,136) and the cost of running our campaign on Indiegogo (CA$1,064). 

Our family members and friends will contribute what they can, but we need everyone's help. Please help however you can - donate, get the word out and make some noise about our campaign, or just take a few minutes to offer a prayer for Celeste.  

Whatever you can contribute, we are grateful for your kindness, care, and generosity towards Celeste and her family!

story:
Short Summary

Meet Elsie.  Elsie has Cerebral Palsy, Optic Nerve Athrophy (severe visual impairment), and Epilepsy, along with other medical and physical issues such as Cerebral Folate Deficiency, Mid-Foot Breakdown, Contractures, and a host of behavioral issues.  Elsie is also non-verbal and struggles with communicating her needs and wants. 

Elsie is a determined, sweet, playful, and capable seven year old girl.  As a result of her disabilities and medications, she is also  frustrated, weak, impatient, and in many ways imprisoned inside her own body.  Her frustrations often manifest with anger, giggles, and silly or unsafe behaviors making daily care, activities, and theraputic rehabilitation very difficult.

Elsie recently underwent a significant surgical procedure on October 3, 2013, called a Selective Dorsal Rhizotomy.  This procedure has eliminated Elsie's muscle spacticity in her lower extremities, and should allow her to walk independently in a walker one day, but comes with a year of daily physical rehabiliation to regain strength, of which insurance only covers a small portion. We have already seen significant improvements in her leg movement patterns since the surgery.   Elsie will also undergo a second surgery in December to lengthen the tendons in her legs that were not able to keep up with her growth as the force of spacticity pulled on them each day.  

Elsie spent the first two months of her rehabiliation in St. Louis, a 9 hour drive from home, so that she could work with the team of doctors and therapist that specialize in this procedure.  While at rehab each day, the therapists struggled to motivate Elsie to participate in each activity that would help her to regain strength.  As a way to escape the difficult work ahead, Elsie would try to bite, hit, scream, and relax her body as she fell into a heap on the floor giggling hysterically. 

Enter THE BIKE! 

Elsie began arriving at therapy each day and would immediately ask for the bike with her word approximation of "Bi!"  Through the use of a hard-work-timer and a built in reward on the bike, Elsie began completing some really difficult exercises and made significant progress.  She began using her walker to walk with assistance up and down the hallways of the hospital, knowing when she reached her selected duration, she would get a ride on the bike.  As she progressed in her rehabilitation, the bike not only became a reward, but a theraputic tool.  Each day, the therapists could feel Elsie using more and more of her own strength to push the pedals.  Two days before heading back to her hometown, Elsie began to independently pedal the bike 3 to 4 cycles at a time (see video insert). 

Most of what Elsie does each day requires one on one support - dressing, toileting, teeth brushing, eating, sitting, taking a few steps in a walker.  Elsie has always been motivated by her independence, often physically pushing away helping hands and assistance, as if to say, "I'll do it myself!"  This bicycle has given Elsie an independence that she craves with the ability to move all on her own.  It also gives her the ability to participate in outdoor walks with her family, interact with other children on the street, and will continue to therapuetically strengthen her muscles at the same time.

The adaptive bicycle is a Freedom Concepts Discovery 16 Series.  This bike is adjustable and can be used by Elsie from now through the next 7 years.  http://www.freedomconcepts.com/fc_products/f3-b...

What We Need & What You Get

The Freedom Concepts Discovery 16 is the one of best adaptive bicycles on the market.  The unique control handle allows her parents or therapists to offer assistance to Elsie when she needs and to help her steer her when she gets off course.  The bike comes with many adjustable features so that as Elsie's skills improve, the bike can grow with Elsie.

The Freedom Concept 16" Discovery is listed at $4,950. 

The funds will go directly to purchasing Elsie's adaptive bike.  As a donor, you would have the knowledge that a bright and beautiful child who faces so many daily obstacles and challenges, will now have more independence that she so deeply desires.

The Impact

The independence that Elsie will gain, both physically and emotionally, will benefit her for years to come and work a stepping stone to aquiring additional skills that will help her reach more developmental milestones.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Spread the word!  Ask friends and family to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

story:
Hello friends and future friends!

In 2006, Lisa was admitted to the hospital as a very sick young woman.  It was found that Lisa was in Acute Kidney Failure but there were so many symptoms that were confusing that the doctors came to call her their "Mystery Patient".  Over the years Lisa has gone through a lot of testing and examining and many doctors have told her that her case is "soo intersting".  For future reference, being "soo interesting" to a doctor is definitely not a good thing.

As things stand right now Lisa has been diagnosed with Lupus, Chronic Kidney Failure, Autoimmune Hepatitis, Primary Biliary Cirrhosis, Fibromyalgia, anxiety and crippling depression. This past year Lisa had to be admitted to the hospital 3 times.  Twice she was in Acute Kidney Failure and once her liver levels were through the roof.  

The bills are piling up and there is no sign of that letting up any time soon.  Lisa's kidneys are functioning at around 20%, during her last hospital visit that went down to around 18% and the decision was made to start to prepare for dialysis but by the end of the hospital visit she had regained enough function to put dialysis off for a while longer.

Currently Lisa cannot work, mostly as a result of fatigue from the Lupus.  She has applied for Disability but has been waiting a year so far and now faces another long wait  to get a court date for her case.  The process has been long and exhaustive and Lisa's financial situation has gone from concerning to tragically dire over that time.  At this point Lisa and her husband Loren are facing losing their housing and everything that they have built as a family, never mind their credit scores taking a beating.

With that in mind Lisa and her Husband are reaching out to ask for help.  We understand that everyone faces their own challenges but any help that could come to us would be so amazing and we would be forever grateful.

If you could share this story with your social network it could help us immeasurably and we'd really appreciate it.

With much love and gratitude,

Lisa and Loren Land

story:
Cuidados Paliativos, A.C.

A nonprofit organization working in Tijuana Mexico since 2011. In our contry 2/3 parts of the population died for an terminal illness. And there are no public funds for these kind of patients in our City or state.

 

Palliative care services that we provide:

  • Medical care (relif of pain and symptoms) in their home.
  • Psychological attention in their home.
  • Loan of medical equipment at no cost for needy patients.
  • Diapers, meds.
  • We train caregivers in palliative care.
  • And we have a grief program.

 

 

With your help we can buy 2 hospital beds to share with our patients....Thank you for your support!

 

We only have a small clinic but our goal is to build a Hospice in Tijuana or Rosarito. Our Web Page is www.cuidadospaliativosac.org

story:
What's The Quantified Elf?

The Quantified Self movement has rapidly grown from just a few geeks filling out spreadsheets to everyday people using inexpensive technology like Fitbit and Mint to track how many calories they burn, how much they eat, how long they sleep, and how they spend their money. 

With the help of Mullen Advertising, the movement has taken a holiday turn with The Quantified Elf. In partnership with Freddie, one of Santa’s long time elves, we are building an integrated personal data acquisition and management solution custom-built to handle low temperatures, high speeds, and constant laughter.

We are building a system that tracks the daily activities of Freddie, one of Santa's long time elves. We will be able to see how music, syrup, sleep and time spent exercising the reindeer contribute to overall productivity. Finer details like accurately painted toys and how proximity to certain elves affects feelings of holiday cheer will also be tracked closely as the product rolls out to the first group of testers.

"Really it will be more than just a way to track what I'm up to" said Freddie in rare break from the holiday action, "it will also be a way to better understand and perhaps even revolutionize the way Santa Claus does business in the future.”

“It’s not every day you meet an elf so eager to be a change agent inside a huge organization that’s done the same thing the same way for hundreds of years.” Said Costa Boudouvas, senior creative technologist at Mullen, “Even limited funding will equip Freddie to go back to Santa and make a compelling argument for internal resources to build out the product. Freddie had a vision and we were able to provide design and technology solutions to give him a clear path to a fully quantified elf.”

Humans can visit thequantifiedelf.com to see what a day in Freddie's life looks like.

All funds raised through this campaign will be donated to Toys For Tots during this 2013 holiday season. (We'll cover the Indiegogo cut so 100% of your dough goes to the kids.)

If you are claiming the Twitter hug perk, please include your Twitter @username in your address for fulfillment. A holiday pun! It better be fulfilling!

story:
What's this for?

Dear everyone,

 A maternity clinic in Haiti is desperately seeking student midwife helpers for December as they anticipate caring for nearly twice as many birthing women as usual. So, I am going there to help in any way I can. I had been talking to an organisation that was working to get the flight funded, but it fell through. I originally thought I couldn't go if I didn't get the funding. As soon as they told me it wasn't to be I knew that I would just have to raise the money myself. I feel compelled to go answer the need and I trust that God will provide. I need your help!  If you want to send some Haitian mothers a pair of willing hands and an open heart, please send me. The money I raise will pay for my airfare, which will cost about $1200. Any donation is valuable and appreciated. I will be leaving December 15th and remain in Haiti until I have to come back for second term around January 1st. While there I will provide doula support, use the clinical skills I have learned so far, like taking vital signs and feeling for babies' positions, and generally do whatever is needed of me. Thank you in advance for responding to meet the needs of mothers and babies in Jacmel!
 Love,
Julia

P.S. Any money raised above what I need for airfare will be donated directly to Olive Tree Projects. :)

The Impact

Here is the link the Olive Tree Projects' website: http://www.olivetreeprojects.com/about/

And facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Olive-Tree-Projects/112792562105375?fref=ts

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this with anyone you know who has a passion for mamas and babies!

story:
Cancer affects everyone. 

Whether you have cancer or you're watching a loved one fight - the stress associated with cancer can be felt by all.

The Seats For Survivors program was created to give cancer patients/survivors and caregivers a brief - but much needed escape away from treatment to enjoy a movie at no cost to them and provide a beneficial experience of happiness with others who are also facing cancer. 


The Story:

How Seats for Survivors came to be


It all started when Ginger Johnson, a young mother and fitness instructor, was blindsided by a breast cancer diagnosis at the age of 31 years old when 5 months pregnant.  

Her journey took her through a mastectomy surgery at 6 months pregnant, delivering a healthy baby boy at full term and then having 3 additional surgeries before beginning chemo when her newborn was just weeks old. Her husband and two older children watched as she began down the path that most people dread:

Hours of chemotherapy; radiation; disfiguring surgeries; unfamiliar side effects, financial burdens and feelings of severe frustration – all wrapped together in one big mess of unexpected and undesired events that often leave people feeling alone and misunderstood.

To combat the negativity, she began gathering prizes for patients during her 'good days' in between treatments and then giving them to the patients in her infusion room with a wish of 'Happy Chemo!' She continued this service through her entire treatment and for years afterwards as her father was diagnosed with stage 4 esophageal cancer only a few months after she completed her treatments.  Today HappyChemo.com is the continuation of this endeavor.

Seeing the sheer frustration and desire for normalcy in the eyes of those she served and listening to their desperate need for some type of break, the Seats for Survivors program was created to give survivors and caregivers a night off from cancer.

A time where they could come together – not for treatment – but for a fun night out to sit back, relax and enjoy a show in a local movie theater at not cost to them; making memories with the ones they love. 

Making A Difference


To date, we have been able to provide seats for over 1,000 patients/survivors and caregivers to attend local movie, theatrical and sporting events and now we're ready to take Seats for Survivors across the nation! 

This is what people are saying:

“We can’t say ‘Thank You’ enough. This was the first break we’ve had in a long time since his treatment began and it was wonderful to see him laugh again. Thank you!” ~ Dianne H., caregiver

“Talk about an enjoyable evening. I can’t remember when we’ve had this much fun!” ~Daryl J., survivor

"I really needed this time away from it all. Thank you so much for inviting me to attend this event." - Cindy W., survivor

"[Our son] was able to take a break from treatment to come today and it brought tears to my eyes to see him doing something 'normal' that he loves. Thanks for letting him bring a friend to share this time with too. We'll cherish this memory." - Natalia M, caregiver

“We had a GREAT time! Really appreciate what you are doing!” ~ Nedra H., survivor

"YOU ROCK! This event was so much fun and I loved being able to make this memory with my mom. Thanks!" - Stephanie J., caregiver

Give Your Seat To A Survivor


Our goal in 2014 is to host 6 movie events in a variety of cities across America and you can help make that happen!

The average cost of a movie ticket is now over $10 for reserved events and the average cost for a medium popcorn and drink is around $12. Considering we may get a discount for bulk purchases, we estimate that we will need at least $50,000+ to cover all associated costs to travel and host 6 events.

The number of seats we can provide will ultimately depend on how much funding we can raise but we are hoping to seat at least 300+ people at each event. Here's what the approximate break down looks like for each event:


Your contribution will directly affect the life of a cancer patient/survivor or caregiver!


We all know it's important to find a cure - but since that seems to be a ways off - why not directly support those who are fighting the battle right now?

We have several fun and influential perks to say THANK YOU for everyone who  joins with us to make an impact. (Get more details in the right column)



Even if you're not able to contribute right now - you can still help!

  • Get the word out by sharing this campaign with friends, family, cancer patients, oncology centers, news reporters - anyone and everyone you can. Everyone knows someone facing cancer!
FACEBOOK: Click to Share this: 

Check out Seats For Survivors! Let's help them raise funds to make this happen for cancer patients. http://igg.me/at/seats-for-survivors

Check out Seats For Survivors! Let's help them raise funds to make this happen for cancer patients. http://igg.me/at/seats-for-survivors

TWITTER: Click to Tweet this: Check out Seats For Survivors! Let's help them raise funds to make this happen for cancer patients. http://igg.me/at/seats-for-survivors

LINKED IN: Click to post this: Check out this amazing program that supports cancer patients/survivors and caregivers by giving them a night off from cancer. Let's help them take this across the nation. http://igg.me/at/seats-for-survivors

GOOGLE +: Click to post this: Check out this amazing program that supports cancer patients/survivors and caregivers by giving them a night off from cancer. Let's help them take this across the nation. http://igg.me/at/seats-for-survivors

Q & A


How will you choose the cities you host events in?

Some cities will be determined by where the contribution dollars are coming from.  For example, if we receive a high amount of our funds from people living in Georgia because survivor groups there are sharing this campaign and helping us raise funds - you can bet we'll be making a trip to Atlanta to host an event there. Same goes for any of the other states as well so rally the troops! 

How do I sign up to get a ticket or be notified of an event in my city?

Visit SeatsForSurvivors.com and click on 'Get Tickets' to get on the request list. We notify those on our list about upcoming events and how to reserve tickets when available. 

How many people get to attend each event?

We would like to seat 300+ people at each event. The number will depend upon the total amount of funding raised. 

Can people currently in treatment attend this event?

Yes! Come as you are: bald, with chemo bags, in wheelchairs, whatever! We want everyone to be able to experience the happiness this program brings. As always, if you're in current treatment, it's best to check with your oncologist or care team to see if any precautions need to be taken (i.e.; masks, gloves, etc.) 


What movies will you be attending?

The goal for 2014 is to host 6 movie events and we have interest in attending the following: Captain America: Winter Soldier, The Amazing Spider-Man 2, Maleficent, Transformers 4: Age of Extinction, Dawn of the Planet of the Apes, The Book of Life, The Hunger Games: Mocking Jay Part 1, The Hobbit: There and Back Again.

What happens at the event before the show begins?

We have LOTS O' FUN with prize giveaways, gift bags, inspirational speakers and pre-show entertainment. The pre-show is where the magic happens. 

What if I'd like to contribute a different amount than the perks you have set up?

First, thank you for desiring to help others! Contributions other than the amounts associated with the outlined perks can be entered by clicking the red 'Contribute' button at the top right of this page and then entering the amount you'd like to give. You then click the 'Continue' button to complete the transaction. 

What if I have tickets to other events/venues that I'd like to donate?

We'll gladly accept any tickets to family friendly venues and happily arrange for a survivor to use them. Please use the contact for on SeatsForSurvivors.com to tell us the details about your donation.

What is Happy Chemo! and why is it called that? 

HappyChemo.com connects those facing cancer to freebies, discounts and resources. The oxymoron stuck when Ginger Johnson first wished patients 'Happy Chemo!' while delivering presents to them during chemotherapy. HappyChemo.com now serves thousands of survivors across the nation. Learn more here

What is the one thing you want me to always remember? 

You. Are. Awesome. (In case you forgot.)

A BIG THANK YOU to Dov Siporin for his willingness to record his thoughts for our video (and put on a happy face) even though he was riddled with pain from recent intense chemotherapy -  and thanks to all the survivors and caregivers who provided their thoughts about the Seats For Survivors program during our last event. We <3 You!

Cancer affects everyone. Whether you have cancer or you're watching a loved one fight - the stress associated with cancer can be felt by all.The Seats For Survivors program was created to give cancer patients/survivors and caregivers a brief - but much needed escape away from treatment to enjoy a movie at no cost to them and provide a beneficial experience of happiness with others who are also facing cancer. The Story:How Seats for Survivors came to beIt all started when Ginger Johnson, a young mother and fitness instructor, was blindsided by a breast cancer diagnosis at the age of 31 years old when 5 months pregnant.  Her journey took her through a mastectomy surgery at 6 months pregnant, delivering a healthy baby boy at full term and then having 3 additional surgeries before beginning chemo when her newborn was just weeks old. Her husband and two older children watched as she began down the path that most people dread:Hours of chemotherapy; radiation; disfiguring surgeries; unfamiliar side effects, financial burdens and feelings of severe frustration – all wrapped together in one big mess of unexpected and undesired events that often leave people feeling alone and misunderstood.To combat the negativity, she began gathering prizes for patients during her 'good days' in between treatments and then giving them to the patients in her infusion room with a wish of 'Happy Chemo!' She continued this service through her entire treatment and for years afterwards as her father was diagnosed with stage 4 esophageal cancer only a few months after she completed her treatments.  Today HappyChemo.com is the continuation of this endeavor.Seeing the sheer frustration and desire for normalcy in the eyes of those she served and listening to their desperate need for some type of break, the Seats for Survivors program was created to give survivors and caregivers a night off from cancer.A time where they could come together – not for treatment – but for a fun night out to sit back, relax and enjoy a show in a local movie theater at not cost to them; making memories with the ones they love. Making A DifferenceTo date, we have been able to provide seats for over 1,000 patients/survivors and caregivers to attend local movie, theatrical and sporting events and now we're ready to take Seats for Survivors across the nation! This is what people are saying:“We can’t say ‘Thank You’ enough. story:
Welcome everyone!! We have created the worlds first all-in-one organic, smart, mold and mosquito control system.

Vbreathe merges advanced engineering and our own pioneered organic gel technology. It removes 98% of airborne microbes from your indoor environment. 

VActive gel is a unique blend of natural organic Australian essential oils combined to produce an amazingly effective defense against mold and bacteria.

Eliminates up to .1 micron of harmful airborne microbes by combining Hepa filteration and our proprietary Organic VActive Gel.

 

 

 TESTIMONIES

 

 

 

 

 

 In the following video a live mosquito test was conducted with VActive Gel in liquid form. 40 mosquitoes were exterminated in less than 9 minutes

 Why is Organic VActive Gel is better than other products?

A short history as to why we developed the VActive Gel.

Working for many years in clean room quality control, and owning an air handling systems fitted with all technically advanced methods:- Carbon filtration on fresh air, followed by electrostatic precipitator, followed by UV-C lighting, followed by two banks of HEPA Filtration, and still mould formed on the registers of the air conditioning. From there, investigation uncovered a multitude of other solutions from evacuate and fumigate, to the outright dangerous (Ozone), and use of ineffective 10% Tea Tree Oil products.   

 Why NOT Tea Tree Oil?

Products based on 10 % Tea Tree Oil are in the market but have a low reputation for performance. We interviewed many users of these products and received comments indicating that the musty smells would return quickly and frequently within a day.   A number of Consumer Health organisations were developing concerns as early as 2001 on Tea Tree Oil use because of the many reports of sensitisation on people. Research over time by the European Union’s SCCP1 body, which prepares very thorough investigations on products and materials, shows that anything containing 2% Tea Tree Oil and above is a clear skin and respiratory sensitiser/irritant.   The SCCP document also states that safe levels of Tea Tree oil for humans does not work as an antimicrobial agent.   Why Organic VActive Gel is better?

 7 years of research and improvements created a product which:

Has many different actives, but uses a small amount of Tea Tree for odour recognition, is made to be stable in air, meaning it is long lasting in use, has actives that evaporate at such low rates, the product is completely safe to installers and consumers alike, has FoodSafe approval, works as bacteriostat and fungi stat, making it a very safe product to use, does not create other issues like bactericides do, over the years no reports received from customers on irritation or sensitivity. 100% Organic Deters Mosquitoes   1 References from SCCP/1155/08  “SCCP found that neat TTO and formulations containing 5% TTO can exhibit skin irritancy (SCCP/1155/08, pp. 18). Moreover, neat TTO is a sensitizer in humans (pp. 25).” The TTO monograph submitted by the Norwegian delegation in 2001, indicates that only products having a conc. of 2% or more seem to cause skin reactions ((Council of Europe, 2001: pp. 24).

News Article :Tea Tree Oil Banned In The EU from Hair 180, October 2, 2013

 

 

MOLD RELEASING DANDEROUS SPORES  

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  

 

 

 

RESEARCH ON THE HARMFUL EFFECTS OF MOLD

Mold overview

Mold is the general term for all types of species of mold and fungi found both indoor and outdoor.

Their colours range from pink to black with green and browns the predominate colours and some have a musty smell and a most unwelcoming odour. Mold and its invisible spores are literally everywhere on visible surfaces, behind wall cavities, in basements, attics, cupboards, wardrobes, under carpets, indoor mold grows when there is moisture. Along with mold in these indoor environments are bacteria, dust and mites. As mold spreads it releases spores and VOC’s (volatile organic compounds) and they are the cause of the bad odours and mustiness. Mold along with bacteria and dust mites have now been identified to have direct health effects in humans, including many types of allergies and infections and should raise alarms bells for those people that wish to maintain their health.

Is There A Difference Between Molds and Fungi?

Molds are fungi. Fungi reproduce by means of spores which are spread through the air but land and survive on surfaces. In the indoor environment there are a multitude of places for mold spores to grow, populate and spread. Air conditioners, window condensation, leaky plumbing, bathrooms, air filters, wet outside walls and indoor plants.1 Common indoor mold species include Aspergillus, Alternaria, Acremonium, Cladosporum, Dreschslera, Epicoccum, Penicillium, Stachybotrys, and Trichoderma.2

What Are the Health Effects with Exposure to Indoor Mold?

According to the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), the average American spends 93% of their life indoors. 87% of their life is indoors, then another 6% of their life in automobiles. It is no wonder that many people complain of respiratory effects, headaches, and other physical symptoms. The secondary flow on effect is when the surfaces that the mold has been growing on start to break-down this is when dust mites, bacteria, and chemicals, gasses, and particulate matter are released from the building materials and structures on which molds are growing.

The Institute of Medicine (IOM In 2004 report,) found that being in damp indoor spaces related to common respiratory illnesses: asthma symptoms, nose and throat symptoms, coughing and wheezing. They also found some evidence that these environments can be associated with shortness of breath, the development of asthma in people who did not previously suffer from it, and coughing, wheezing, chest tightness, and shortness of breath in healthy children. There was enough evidence of health effects overall, that IOM identified damp indoor spaces as a public health problem that needs to be addressed.3

Mold Publications

Indoor mold could be confirmed as a cause of ill health and respiratory illnesses. Researchers noted that controlling mold in indoor air spaces would make a substantial contribution to the general public’s health. Bush and colleagues have state definitively that mold exposure is capable of causing illness in humans. They summarize three mechanisms: harmful immune responses, e.g. allergies or the uncommon occurrence of hypersensitivity pneumonitis; infections; and irritation from mold by-products.10 The author Terr acknowledges four types of allergy caused by inhaling mold spores, including asthma and a type of sinusitis.4 In another paper by Fisk and colleagues where they reviewed thirty-three studies to assess the risk of health effects of people who spent time in mold environments. Subjects were adults and children. They found that upper respiratory tract symptoms, cough, wheeze, and asthma were more frequent in people who spent time in spaces with mold present.5

Mold and Children

The report by Antova which focused on studies children aged six to twelve from 10 found that mold in the household correlated with a variety of respiratory disorders, including wheezing, coughing at night, and allergic symptoms and hay fever.6 Where visible mold was in the primary living areas Karvonen showed that the first eighteen months of life, wheezing was more common in the homes and this study group involved 396 children.7 In 2011, Reponen and colleagues published a study of 176 children followed from birth through age seven. A research tool developed and being evaluated by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA)8 was used to assess the children's homes in a 2011 published study by Reponen from birth to age seven. 11 This study using the EPA guidelines demonstrated that these young children who lived in homes with higher levels of mold at age one were more likely than other children to have asthma by the age of seven. It does provide evidence that reducing the amount of mold in infants' homes is beneficial to health.

Allergies and Asthma

Though numerous studies established the presence of dampness and mold with respiratory allergies and asthma and now it is possible to assess and treat individuals who have symptoms of respiratory allergies and asthma. Khalili and colleagues emphasize that determining whether respiratory symptoms are related to mold exposure involves a process of elimination. Once other possible causes of respiratory symptoms have been ruled out, patients can be assessed for the possibility of mold-induced illness.9

References

1-Kim, JJ, Mazur LJ, American Academy of Pediatrics Committee on Environmental Health. Spectrum of noninfectious health effects from mold. Pediatrics. 2006;118:2582-2586. Reaffirmed January 2011. www.pediatrics.org/cgi/doi/10.1542/peds.2010-3671.

2-Institute of Medicine. Damp Indoor Spaces and Health. 2004. Washington DC: National Academy Press.

3-Storey E, Dangman KH, Schench P, DeBernardo RL, Yang CS, Bracher A, Hodgson MJ. Guidance for clinicians on the recognition and management of health effects related to mold exposure and moisture indoors. Farmington (CT): University of Connecticut Health Center, Division of Occupational and Environmental Medicine, Center for Indoor Environments and Health; 2004.

4-Terr AI. Are indoor molds causing a new disease? J Allergy Clin Immunol. 2004;113:221-6.

5- Fisk WJ, Lei-Gomez Q, Mendell MJ. Meta-analyses of the associations of respiratory health effects with dampness and mold in homes. Indoor Air. 2007:17:284-296.

6-Luttmann-Givson H, Grize L, Katsnelson B, Moshammer H, Nikiforov B, Slachtova H, Slotova K, Zlotkowska R, Fletcher T. Exposure to indoor mould and children’s respiratory health in the PATY study. J Epidemiol Community Health. 2008;62:708-714.

7-Karvonen AM, Hyvärinen A, Roponen M, Hoffmann M, Korppi M, Remes S, von Mutius E, Nevalainen A, Pekkanen J. Confirmed moisture damage at home, respiratory symptoms and atopy in early life: a birth-cohort study. Pediatrics. 2009;124;e329.

8-U.S. Environmental Protection Agency. Environmental Relative Moldiness Index (ERMI) Research Tool. Accessed April 3, 2014.

9-Khalili B, Montanaro MT, Bardana EJ. Indoor mold and your patient’s health: from suspicion to confirmation. J Resp Dis. 2005;26:520-525.

10-Bush RK, Portnoy JM, Saxon A, Terr AI, Wood RA. The medical effects of mold exposure. J Allergy Clin Imunol. 2006;117:326-33.

11-Reponen T, Vesper S, Levin L, Johansson E, Ryan P, Burkle J, Grinshpun SA, Zheng S, Bernstein DI, Lockey J, Villareal M, Hershey GKK, LeMasters G. High environmental relative moldiness index during infancy as a predictor of asthma at 7 years of age. Ann Allergy Asthma Immunol. 2011;107-120-126.

 

Our Journey:-

                   

Australian Aborigines used medicinal plants and essential oils for over 40,000 years and it inspired us to develop an organic product that would help mankind.

After 7 years of trials and extensive research in combining the various essential oil blends, we finally achieved the correct composition. VActive gel is the heart of the VBreathe mold and mosquito control system and all the ingredients are 100% organic Australian essential oils. The final part was the design of the premium hardware and the sophisticated metatronic elements such as the particle sensors, wifi and bluetooth.

Our journey has combined the knowledge of the ancients and merged it with the latest technology so we can all be protected from harmful indoor airborne microbes.

Join us in taking this natural technology to the world: VBreathe.

Thank you for pledging your support and bringing VBreathe to life.

They summarize three mechanisms: harmful immune responses, e.g. allergies or the uncommon occurrence of hypersensitivity pneumonitis; infections; and irritation from mold by-products.10 The author Terr acknowledges four types of allergy caused by inhaling mold spores, including asthma and a type of sinusitis.4 In another paper by Fisk and colleagues where they reviewed thirty-three studies to assess the risk of health effects of people who spent time in mold environments. Subjects were adults and children. They found that upper respiratory tract symptoms, cough, wheeze, and asthma were more frequent in people who spent time in spaces with mold present.5Mold and Children The report by Antova which focused on studies children aged six to twelve from 10 found that mold in the household correlated with a variety of respiratory disorders, including wheezing, coughing at night, and allergic symptoms and hay fever.6 Where visible mold was in the primary living areas Karvonen showed that the first eighteen months of life, wheezing was more common in the homes and this study group involved 396 children.7 In 2011, Reponen and colleagues published a study of 176 children followed from birth through age seven. A research tool developed and being evaluated by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA)8 was used to assess the children's homes in a 2011 published study by Reponen from birth to age seven. 11 This study using the EPA guidelines demonstrated that these young children who lived in homes with higher levels of mold at age one were more likely than other children to have asthma by the age of seven. It does provide evidence that reducing the amount of mold in infants' homes is beneficial to health.Allergies and Asthma Though numerous studies established the presence of dampness and mold with respiratory allergies and asthma and now it is possible to assess and treat individuals who have symptoms of respiratory allergies and asthma. Khalili and colleagues emphasize that determining whether respiratory symptoms are related to mold exposure involves a process of elimination. Once other possible causes of respiratory symptoms have been ruled out, patients can be assessed for the possibility of mold-induced illness.9References1-Kim, JJ, Mazur LJ, American Academy of Pediatrics Committee on Environmental Health. Spectrum of noninfectious health effects from mold. Pediatrics. 2006;118:2582-2586. Reaffirmed January 2011. www.pediatrics.org/cgi/doi/10.1542/peds.2010-3671.2-Institute of Medicine. Damp Indoor Spaces and Health. 2004. Washington DC: National Academy Press.3-Storey E, Dangman KH, Schench P, DeBernardo RL, Yang CS, Bracher A, Hodgson MJ. Guidance for clinicians on the recognition and management of health effects related to mold exposure and moisture indoors. Farmington (CT): University of Connecticut Health Center, Division of Occupational and Environmental Medicine, Center for Indoor Environments and Health; 2004.4-Terr AI. Are indoor molds causing a new disease? J Allergy Clin Immunol. 2004;113:221-6.5- Fisk WJ, Lei-Gomez Q, Mendell MJ. Meta-analyses of the associations of respiratory health effects with dampness and mold in homes. Indoor Air. 2007:17:284-296.6-Luttmann-Givson H, Grize L, Katsnelson B, Moshammer H, Nikiforov B, Slachtova H, Slotova K, Zlotkowska R, Fletcher T. Exposure to indoor mould and children’s respiratory health in the PATY study. J Epidemiol Community Health. 2008;62:708-714.7-Karvonen AM, Hyvärinen A, Roponen M, Hoffmann M, Korppi M, Remes S, von Mutius E, Nevalainen A, Pekkanen J. Confirmed moisture damage at home, respiratory symptoms and atopy in early life: a birth-cohort study. Pediatrics. 2009;124;e329.8-U.S. Environmental Protection Agency. Environmental Relative Moldiness Index (ERMI) Research Tool. Accessed April 3, 2014.9-Khalili B, Montanaro MT, Bardana EJ. Indoor mold and your patient’s health: from suspicion to confirmation. J Resp Dis. 2005;26:520-525.10-Bush RK, Portnoy JM, Saxon A, Terr AI, Wood RA. The medical effects of mold exposure. J Allergy Clin Imunol. 2006;117:326-33.11-Reponen T, Vesper S, Levin L, Johansson E, Ryan P, Burkle J, Grinshpun SA, Zheng S, Bernstein DI, Lockey J, Villareal M, Hershey GKK, LeMasters G. High environmental relative moldiness index during infancy as a predictor of asthma at 7 years of age. Ann Allergy Asthma Immunol. 2011;107-120-126. Our Journey:-                   Australian Aborigines used medicinal plants and essential oils for over 40,000 years and it inspired us to develop an organic product that would help mankind.After 7 years of trials and extensive research in combining the various essential oil blends, we finally achieved the correct composition. VActive gel is the heart of the VBreathe mold and mosquito control system and all the ingredients are 100% organic Australian essential oils. The final part was the design of the premium hardware and the sophisticated metatronic elements such as the particle sensors, wifi and bluetooth.Our journey has combined the knowledge of the ancients and merged it with the latest technology so we can all be protected from harmful indoor airborne microbes.Join us in taking this natural technology to the world: VBreathe.Thank you for pledging your support and bringing VBreathe to life.

story:
The reason why people are dying from such infections is simple- Because it is the often accepted Medical opinion that it is not necessary to clean ones' ears- that our ears are self-cleaning. It makes no sense and is the only body part we suggest such negligence.

         All eardrum photos from the private collection of Janine Daniell 2019

  2. S. D. (2018, April 16). Ear infections can lead to meningitis, brain abscess, other neurological complications. Retrieved from https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2018/04/1...
  3. WHO. (2019, July 8). Meningitis. Retrieved from https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/mening...
  4. Removal, E. W. (2018, November 27). Top 5 ear wax removal most impressive part 1   2018/11/28. Retrieved from https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qUfNEB3tyLU
  5.   Centre, H. H. (2018, August 8). Do Ear Candles Really Work? FACT OR FICTION!          Retrieved from https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P3nvF7RxUSw2k
  6. Ingleson, K. (n.d.). Dry ears: Causes, treatment, and prevention. Retrieved from https://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/31924...
  7. Australian Government Department of Health. (n.d.). Search the TGA website. Retrieved from http://tga-search.clients.funnelback.com/s/sear...

story:
Insanely easy to use, incredibly accurate, saves time, saves money. 

The EyeQue Insight™: 

  • Screens vision for 20/20 to 20/400 in under 3 minutes, providing exact measures of single and dual eye performance
  • Creates a digital vision history where a change indicates that a doctor’s visit would be advised 
  • Tests your current glasses or contacts to determine if an updated prescription may be required
  • Instantly records and securely stores results, making data available to track and share with others
  • One EyeQue Insight can be shared with many people, making it a value for families and suitable for testing large groups
  • Runs in two modes, simple straightforward "adult" mode, and gamified "kids" mode for children

The self-administered test is super EASY (just swipe in the direction of the “E”) and FAST(under 3 minutes for right eye, left eye, AND both eyes), the randomized and gamified experience ensures that everyone stays engaged. Test results are instantly stored in the EyeQue Cloud™ to help you keep track of vision changes over time.

Use the Insight to check your current glasses or contacts

Visual acuity is a fancy term used to describe clarity and sharpness of vision. If someone sees 20/20 that means he/she has normal vision as defined by optometrists. If, for example, someone has a 20/40 visual acuity, it means that "he/she must stand 20 feet from an object to see what someone with perfect vision can see from 40 feet away," hence less than perfect visual acuity.

We won the Indiegogo x HSN "American Dreams" Pitch Competition! Hundreds of start ups were considered, 10 were chosen to give the pitch, and we WON! This means we're in the process of getting ourselves some SHOW TIME on HSN! Here are some of our favorite moments and footages. Order now for the best price ($89 preorder vs $129.99 MSPR)!

 
A FULL DEMO by our team, posted by HSN: see it here!
 
Everyone who came by the booth received a demo on the Insight and were given instant results! Yes, we gave THOUSANDS of demos in a matter of days. The overall consensus: It's fast, easy to use, and accurate! 

Yes, INSTANT RESULTS!

"The numbers we got matched what we received at a recent eye exam, so we trust the system is accurate." - The Mac Observer

  

"this type of vision test that you can do as many times as you like, as opposed to once a year or every few years, empowers people to monitor their vision health and know when they might need to seek help." - ExtremeTech

 

"Checking your vision just got easier." - Mashable

"The older I get, the more I worry about my vision and the vision of my kids. EyeQue Insight looks to be a good tool to benchmark our vision levels today and make sure that we track any degradation over time." - Engineering.com

Interested in the press kit? Click here or reach out to us at pr@eyeque.com. 

What eye doctors are saying about the EyeQue Insight: 

We went to Santana Row in San Jose, California on a beautiful Saturday morning and chatted up random shoppers. The results and reactions are genuine, no one was paid/compensated for their comments. 

"It's easy to use"--Arianna, 12

"Finally a video game I can beat you at!" -- Brad, 50

"I had Lasik eye surgery... when they tested my eyes I definitely remembered the pattern...This I felt like really tested you." -- Rachel, 26

The EyeQue Insight functions as a digitized eye chart. To use it, simply attach the goggles to your smartphone (EyeQue Insight currently supports 800+ smartphones around the world), and swipe in the direct of the letter "E" on your smartphone screen. The sequence of the letter "E"s are randomized so there's no memorization at play, and you'll get the most accurate results every time.

Here's the tutorial! (PS It's only a 26 seconds long)

 

Everyone. Children with rapidly changing eyesight, adults who want to stay informed on their vision changes, and those in need of vision care in the developing world.

Children with rapidly changing eyesight can benefit tremendously from the EyeQue Insight. Myopia, also known as nearsightedness, can develop as early as 6 years old. Using the Insight for just 3 minutes a week will help parents keep track of vision changes, know when to see the eye doctor, and share the results during the eye exam. Have the peace of mind of knowing that your child sees clearly and is not disadvantaged with blurry vision, even if he/she already wears glasses.

Adults who want to stay informed about their vision will also benefit from the EyeQue Insight. A quick and efficient screening tool, the Insight is great for checking current glasses or contacts, following up on Lasik surgery results, and those experiencing fluctuations in their visual acuity (such as glaucoma and diabetes) to know and track changes.

A large proportion of the world population in developing countries lack access to vision care, affecting their quality of life and productivity. The American Ophthalmology Association estimates that by 2050, HALF of the world's population will be nearsighted. Given the magnitude of this global myopia epidemic, the EyeQue Insight is a powerful tool available to charity organizations to quickly screen large groups of people, with the ability and opportunity to improve lives that are deeply affected by uncorrected vision. 

The optical goggles represent a complex work of art and technology. Within each set of goggles exist several aspheric optical lenses that de-magnifies the screen, creating the perfect 20-feet distance of the “tumbling E” images in a dark room.

The sleek binocular design is lightweight (less than 8 ounces, not including smartphone), durable, safe, and easy to hold; comes fully assembled with no loose parts.

Patent-pending, one-size-fits-all design with PD (pupillary distance) adjustments, so one set of goggles can be used for everyone in the family.

Our animated host, Seymour (see-more, get it?), is a fun-loving blue blobby friend that will keep your child engaged in the "kids" mode. He has all kinds of tips to help you take the test.  Adults can use the more straightforward vision test mode. Meet Seymour!

Compare the traditional static eye chart and our"tumbling E" chart! Insight's eye chart is digitized so the letters are randomly generated. Since there's no memorization at play, the test results are more accurate than ever before.

Testing for each individual eye is just as important, if not more important, than testing how both eyes work together. The development of many vision conditions, such as strabismus (cross eye) and amblyopia (lazy eye), can be accelerated because one of the eyes have a significantly lower visual acuity than the other.

Not familiar with "20/20"? There are other international standards for describing visual acuity and "normal vision". EyeQue supports other international standards for visual acuity, such as 6/6 and logMAR. Customize your reading based on what is standard in your region.

Other than screening for visual acuity (seeing 20/20), the EyeQue Insight is a highly scalable platform that can incorporate many additional vision screening features, such as color vision deficiency (aka color blindness), muscle balance (precursor for conditions such as cross eye), and binocular vision. These functionalities are currently being developed and will be available to Insight users in 2018.

Smartphone Support

The EyeQue Insight supports all iOS and Android phones with more than 300ppi and screen size larger than 4.7" (11.93cm). Currently, over 800 smartphones around the world meet this minimum requirement. Does your phone qualify? Go to our webpage and scroll down to the bottom-- We are still expanding the list! 

EyeQue subscription: $4.99 per year per user account, that's less than 2 cents a day, gets you unlimited vision tests on ALL EyeQue products, lifetime access to your data, and exclusive access to new products and services. Make eye care a priority for you an your family!

Why EyeQue Insight?  

Simply because we're the most convenient, affordable, and efficient way to test your visual acuity at home. With upcoming functionalities that can screen for more vision conditions, EyeQue Insight is the world's first and most compact at-home vision screener. 

 

Our Mission:

EyeQue is dedicated to inspiring people to learn about and care for their eyes by delivering affordable, accurate vision tests directly into their hands. Based on revolutionary patented technologies, EyeQue is bringing self-administered eye tests to billions of people around the world, many of whom may not have had the opportunity to test their eyes and correct their vision without access to these low cost, convenient solution. Our first product, the award-winning Personal Vision Tracker, was funded on Kickstarter and delivered on time in February, 2017 to thousands of backers.

To give back to our community and share our vision, we have collaborated with worthy causes such as TwoBillionEyes, a non-profit organization who specializes in school missions in Kenya, and VOSH, a group of volunteer optometrists, who brought our products to use in El Salvador for community vision screening. We are actively seeking additional partnerships with other effective charity organizations to expand our footprint.

Company Timeline:

Our Team:

EyeQue is team of passionate individuals all with the same goal in mind: Making eye care easy, accessible, and affordable for everyone around the world. We come from all walks of life and backgrounds, atomic physics to restaurant management, making us an unique and well-rounded team of professionals. Armed with the best and the brightest, collectively possessing 9 masters degrees, 3 Ph.D.s, and decades of industry experiences, EyeQue is bringing the most innovative eye care products to consumers to make clear vision a right, and no longer a privilege.   

Interested in the press kit? Click here or reach out to us at pr@eyeque.com. 

 

WE ARE SHIPPING NOW! 

As of 3/21/2018, the EyeQue Insight is available for immediate purchase. Your Indiegogo order will be shipped as your order is placed! Check our our production units:

story:
No lump...still breast cancer!!  Normal mammogram...still breast cancer!! The Karen Oldham Foundation funds research and education for this under diagnosed form of breast cancer.  Inflammatory Breast Cancer is the most aggressive form of breast cancer and affects younger women.  The tragedy is that most women know nothing about it.  Our mission is to promote education and research to save lives.  Your contributions will go directly to focused research to determine early detection and treatment for this  form of breast cancer that is not funded by the large breast cancer research foundations.


About the campaign:
- Current project -$70,000 research project for early detection- currently most women are not diagnosed until late stage and have a high mortality rate from the cancer.
- We are an all volunteer organization so close to 100% of your contribution goes directly to the hands of world recognized physician/researcher in the disease-no middle man
-Education of women is paramount.  The mission of the Foundation is to educate women about the signs and symptoms of the disease in all our outreach.

The Impact of Your Partnership...

IBC often affects younger women.  Sometimes during pregnancy.  IBC is so very aggressive.  The impact of finding the key to early detection can save lives and save the mothers of children.  

    Challenges

     IBC is the "orphan breast cancer".  Both the medical community and all of us need educated in the disease.  What a challenge...to educate so many!

    WANT TO HELP... 

    -- Contribute!

    -- Educate yourself and those you love!

    -- Tell your friends - visit our website and share our Facebook page

    -- Use the indiegogo share tool to educate others!

    Thanks so much for your help - Peace and all Good to You!!!
