story:
Divinity Foundation is organising another medical camp starting in September.

"Divinity Foundation is a private Humanitarian Aid Organization founded by Osteopathic Practitioner, Nav Matharu. They empower and offer support to Orphaned, Abandoned and Impoverished children and mothers in selected global regions through our Healthcare, Education and Food Aid programs"

"Each year large teams of volunteer osteopaths, nurses, doctors, educators and students get together 3-4 times a year to run two weeks of free mobile medical camps which sees the team working in the slums, in city charity hospitals, orphanages and in rural bush lands under the shades of trees.  During the camps free checkups, treatment and basic medicines are supplied. A two week programme costs us £5000 / $8000 An estimated 4000 children and mothers are treated for FREE during each two week camp. 

Children are primarily treated by osteopathic treatment and first response medications are used to treat conditions such as: Ringworm, chest infections, dehydration, eye infections and malaria.

This project is named “Healing Angels” in honour of all the volunteers from Europe and USA that make the medical out-reach programme possible through volunteering their time and skills to help impoverished people."


We now urgently need:

some cash to be able to pay for the extra luggage filled with clothes donated in Switzerland, and are very much hoping to be able to deliver them all to the kids we are going to meet there.

The airline doesn't provide us with any extra luggage allowance and we have over 150kg to bring over to Kenya.

Along with the osteopathic and medical treatment the children will receive throughout the camp, we would be really happy to be able to give them some piece of clothing. As you can see on video, most of them are lacking proper clothing, which is even more important, considering that most of them are street kids / orpheans.

We did think until the very last minute that the airline would make a gesture and be accommodating for some extra kg, but we are now running out of time. That is why we are now asking for your help and contributions.


We have put a higher target

than the one needed to pay for the sending of the clothing, thinking that if there is any cash left, we would be happy to give it to Divinity Foundation's founder, Nav Matharu, in order to help the foundation with their new project, the Rescue Center for girls.

Please don't hesitate to visit "Divinity Foundation's" Facebook page, and spread the word around you.

There will be regular updates and pictures on the Facebook page during the camp.

story:
Please see details below about our first big event to raise funds. 

"Shaving our Beanies 4 Beanie"

Trina, a daughter, wife, mother of two beautiful teenagers, and my best friend since childhood came to me for a routine screening mammogram on December 20th, 2014. She presented with no symptoms however, from that day forward her life has been forever changed.

A further biopsy revealed she had breast cancer. In hopes of avoiding any future occurrence of cancer, and further invasive treatments, Trina powerfully chose to have a Bilateral Mastectomy which took place January 29th 2015. At that time samples were taken from the sentinel node and the results revealed the cancer had traveled to the lymph nodes, so her Stage 1 diagnosis had now become Stage 2, requiring further invasive treatments.

Her job did not provide medical benefits so we quickly learned that she would have to go on Medical EI as she would be unable to work for some time. Medical EI in Canada only covers an individual for 15 WEEKS whether you have a broken hand, a surgery, or breast cancer!

Trina's chemo regiment could not commence until Thursday April 30th due to complications with a Colitis flare up that had to be resolved prior to starting chemo. Based on Trina's health status, her treatments must be split into small doses that will occur on a weekly basis through phases ongoing for 9-12 months.

So, as Trina's Medical EI ran out at the end of April, she now has no income which her family relies on to help pay a mortgage, support a family of 4, groceries, bills, medical cost, and an extremely costly specialized diet that Trina is required to follow.

I invite each and every one of you to stand with me in supporting Trina's journey of health and healing. The last thing that Trina needs to worry about is if they'll be able to keep food on the table and the roof over their heads. As this year will have it's challenges, I invite you to donate as much or as little as you may feel inspired to give. Each and every cent is greatly appreciated to ensure that this family is taken care of while Trina regains her health over the following year.

OUR FIRST EVENT IS ONE NOT TO MISS!

SHAVING OUR BEANIES 4 BEANIE (Trina's childhood nickname).

WHO: Trina Arnold, Noal Arnold (Trina's husband), and yours truly,Tammy Eaton.

WHEN: Wednesday, May 13th,  7-10 pm.

WHERE: Lounge Burger, #270, 14th ave SE,

Macleod Trail South Calgary, AB (across from the saddle dome).

Directions: https://www.google.ca/maps/place/Loungeburger/@...

Website: http://www.loungeburger.com

Please join us for some shaving, laughs, and most of all connections!

Please RSVP for our first function via email at tameaton@hotmail.com.

Thank-You in advance,

Tammy Eaton, and the Arnold Family <3

story:
Short Summary

Lilo is a happy. fun-loving and energetic 5-year-old girl. She was born in 2007 in South Korea, when both her mother and father were teaching. After a year and a  half, it was apparent something was seriously wrong. While living in Istanbul, Turkey, Lilo was given a provisional diagnosis of Autism Spectrum Disorder. Her father left his job to come back to Canada to be with her as a full-time, single dad. 

In the course of 2 years, Lilo was diagnosed as "severely autistic". She could not speak, would not respond to verbal/physical prompts and the prognosis was not good. It appeared that the family would be working towards teaching basic life skills in order to one day, hopefully facilitate her living in a group home. 

Since that time, Lilo has astounded everyone. With the tireless effort from her father by her side, working through every imagineable form of behaviour and speech therapy, Lilo has flourished. She is just about to finish her junior year of kindergarten, with minimal in-class assistance.

What We Need & What You Get

Lilo has met nearly every socialization and behavioural goal set out for her last September. She is very social and happy and is now facing more difficulties, as she wants to play and interact with other children but is often teased, left out or ignored because of her limitations in speech and language. 

There is an expensive speech/language summer camp that would greatly benefit Lilo, going back into kindergarten. Her father is in receipt of social assitance and cannot afford the $3000 price tag associated with the therapy program.

The Impact

Lilo is destined for greatness. She has overcome so much so soon and the world is hers for the taking. We are all trying to help her get all of the assistance we can to give her the best chance and to maximize her potential.

story:
Over the past few months, I have been going to the University of the Pacific Dental School in order to correct long term dental issues. My first fundraising campaign was fairly successful, but still only raised a fraction of what I actually need. My chart at the school is, as of Friday, January 23, locked due to my having problems making the monthly payments.

I need this work done in order to move forward and improve my life in any meaningful way. Please help if you can. Even small donations add up.

story:
Here’s how the “father” part happened:

First, he and his wife Paige adopted a child from a foreign country.

  Then another.

  And another.

And then, of course, they got pregnant…

But his love for kids doesn’t stop there.

As a physical therapist, he is passionate about helping children who have complex developmental needs. He’s also passionate about the families of these kids. And he realizes that they too have some pretty profound needs. Emotionally, financially, relationally and even spiritually.

These are families who love their special needs’ child, devote their lives to the care and raising of them, but get pretty weary.

Understandably. So, he supports the families by offering his expertise, advice and compassion. However, it’s hard to treat an entire family once a week in a child’s therapy session.

Brett had an idea: Camp.  For the entire family.

Yep. Good ol’ summer camp. With cookouts and games and crafts and stories.

But more than just ‘camp’. Camp with a purpose. Camp with resources and therapy and ideas and hope. Camp that sets families on a path to success.


  And, amazingly, it happened.

Summer 2013…

One God made it possible – with 20 families impacted, 70 volunteers.over 11 churches and 10 business and community organizations participated.

Families’ lives were changed.

But now we need your help.

Brett and his team are dedicated to providing Victory Lane Camp each year to families who need it most. That means start-up costs, supplies, and the support needed to help these families. 100% of the donations go directly to the organization, which goes directly to the kids and their families.

  • Our goal is $46,250
  • With 1,850 people donating $25 each

But with your help, and the help of your friends, businesses, churches and connections, we can make it happen. And you can be a vital part of sending a great family to a great camp. Every little bit helps. No donation is too small.

Because Brett knows that even little steps means big victories for families in the 2014 camping season and beyond.

Thank you for being a part of Victory Lane Camp!

story:
MARINE JON FIT BOOTCAMP 2012 

Hello, World,

My name is Jonathan Mullins. I'm a 29 y/o personal trainer, professional actor and music producer. I come from a very healthy background in terms of fitness. I’ve pretty much been an athlete all my life. I've competed nationally in different areas of sports. I earned the title Marine in the summer of 2001. Hence the name Marine Jon Fitness (http://www.marinejonfit.com)

My campaign is to raise money for a fitness bootcamp in Central Park this summer! If you understand the importance of fitness like I do, and you have a passion for people, then this totally makes sense. Plus, a lot of people love to do bootcamp. 

I have gotten heavily involved in fitness, and after seeing the difference I have made in the lives of many, it just makes me want to do more on a bigger scale.  I want to continue being a difference-maker who motivates people and helps them understand eating right and daily exercise are critical to health and well-being.  My own mother is the reason I do what I do. If I knew years ago what I know now, my mother would be in better physical condition.  So, taking a lesson from my own life, I am compelled to not only put on a bootcamp, but to also take care of my mother and her health.

The magnitude of what you help me achieve will be the greatest gift anyone can ask for – just plain good health.  By also offering fitness in a fun-filled environment, the impact this bootcamp has on people will stick with the people participating in  the bootcamp and will have a ripple effect:  it will help build people on all different levels – physical, emotional, and mental. 

Different people need motivation in different ways.  This bootcamp is a great way to accomplish that.  Your small contribution will be one among that helps me provide an unforgettable experience, growth and change in the lives of many.

The bootcamp will be offered first-come, first-served.  There will be slots for 50 people per class. (2 SESSIONS!) MORNING AND AFTERNOON! This is what I need to make the vision a reality.

Supplies:

  • vera discs                               qty-2= $65.90
  • agility rings                             qty-1= $64.95
  • versa rings                              qty-3= $134.85
  • jump ropes (8ft/9ft) 10/piece    qty-20= $439
  • agility 9" cones                        qty-30= $60.00
  • natural rubber mats                 qty-10= $169.50

Sub total: $1483.95
shipping (freight) $200.05
tax: $149.45
total: $1,833.45

(All above items will be provided by Power Systems)

Manila Training ropes (from Art of Strength) 

  • manila ropes 2"x30' (qty-10) $899.50

shipping:  $150.00

Grand total: $1049.50

SUPPLIES (PLUS) SHIPPING: $2882.95

ULTIMATE GOAL (ROUNDED) $3000.00

Money earned and raised from budget will be used to provide water for all participants.  It will also pay my other trainers involved.  There will be t-shirts for bootcamp participants.

As a result of people’s contributions, I will be able to offer this bootcamp multiple times throughout the year, be able to campaign, and make a real impact on the community as Marine Jon Fitness.

IF you see the vision I am having to make noise about being fit and staying healthy and spreading the word, by all means I NEED YOUR SUPPORT! YOU WILL BE HELPING ME IMPACT THE LIVES OF MANY! I AM HOLDING THIS BOOTCAMP NOT ONLY IN THE MORNING, BUT ALSO FOR THE AFTERNOON CROWD AS WELL! 

That is DOUBLE the intensity, so please help me make noise about this campaign, and stress the importance of being in SHAPE! 

DON'T ENVY THOSE IN SHAPE! 

DARE TO BE ENVIED!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Steve Meyerink, I am married to the most wonderful girl in the world, Kari. We have been married for 7 wonderful years. Kari has an immune system disorder. This illness has destroyed parts of her immune system that fight off illnesses. At our last appointment with her immunologist he told us that her illness was getting worse and more parts were failing. The doctor looked me in the eye and said " you are going to lose your wife to this". They are the hardest words I have ever heard spoken to me.
Kari gets life saving medicine every two weeks that makes her very sick, very tired and she has debilitating pain in her joints and muscles. These symptoms last for 5 to 7 days after the infusion. During her recovery time she takes refuge in our home. Over the past 5 years Kari has spent hundreds of days in hospitals in Nebraska, Minnesota, and California. Sometimes her pain is so bad we have to go to the Emergency Room to get it all under control.
Kari and I bought 5 acres of her fathers pasture and put the home of our dreams on it. Kari and I put our hearts and our souls into the design and building of our home. The colors, the shapes and the layout were picked out by both of us.
Due to Kari losing her job we are now on the verge of losing our home due to our medical bills, and our monthly mortgage payment adjusting to a higher rate. Kari's infusions cost over $30,000 per month and although we have insurance that covers 70/30, and it doesn't cover the out of pocket expenses, copays, and any other costs. My paycheck doesn't cover all of our monthly expenses so we have had to turn to credit cards and loans just to stay ahead.
Our home is where our roots are, its where our hearts are, and it is where Kari can recover from the side effects of her medical condition in peace and quiet.

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $3000 as a goal in hopes of reaching it and passing it. Our home loan is nearly $210,000, we hope that the generosity of people will get us to that amount so we do not have to worry about losing our home.
Your generosity will help us to keep Kari in a place she calls home with her family and recovers from the debilitating side effects of medicine and waits for the time to say goodbye. We have many travel expences as some of Kari's doctors are hundreds of miles away in Nebraska and others are even further in California.

The Impact

Your generosity will help us to keep our home from falling into forclosure and give Kari a place to find sanctuary from the pain that her illness causes her both physically and emotionally. Kari lost her job and feels that she is not doing her part to help with the bills, but meeting our goal and actually paying off our home will help her feel better and not worry every month of how we are going to pay all our bills. Meeting our goal of paying our home off will allow Kari to focus more on staying as healthy as she can as her illness progresses.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to make a contribution please join our facebook page called "Friends and Family of Kari Blais Meyerink", there is more of our story there as well as other ways to contribute. Sometimes even a nice note to Kari helps brighten her day when she is feeling low. Remember that we are all in this together and we need to do for each other while we can. Because sometimes in life, there is no reset button. Since we can't change her life we are learning to deal with it. Please help us deal with it.

We have many travel expences as some of Kari's doctors are hundreds of miles away in Nebraska and others are even further in California.

The Impact
Your generosity will help us to keep our home from falling into forclosure and give Kari a place to find sanctuary from the pain that her illness causes her both physically and emotionally. Kari lost her job and feels that she is not doing her part to help with the bills, but meeting our goal and actually paying off our home will help her feel better and not worry every month of how we are going to pay all our bills. Meeting our goal of paying our home off will allow Kari to focus more on staying as healthy as she can as her illness progresses.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to make a contribution please join our facebook page called "Friends and Family of Kari Blais Meyerink", there is more of our story there as well as other ways to contribute. Sometimes even a nice note to Kari helps brighten her day when she is feeling low.  Remember that we are all in this together and we need to do for each other while we can. Because sometimes in life, there is no reset button. Since we can't change her life we are learning to deal with it. Please help us deal with it.

story:
Amazing Feedback! Scroll to the end.

What is Create Reel Change?

Create Reel Change in your life, in the lives of others and in the world around us.
We are an organization in the endeavor to offer creativity as a complimentary therapy in recovery and all areas of Mental Health.

  • I'm Brian Higgins and I'm a creative solutions and troubleshooting guy. 

    Like many people I have had my ups and downs, trials and tribulations and been round the block and few times. For a long time I let my mental health issues get the better of me. Of course when things started going wrong I sought out help in all the traditional ways but unfortunatelty i couldn't find a solution that resonated with me. So I came to the conclusion that living with these conditions was my lot in life.

    I basically gave up on my own wellness and continued doing what I was doing which was going nowhere fast. While on that road I began making short narrative films and entering festivals. To my surprise after some time had passed I began to realize that the films I had been making were actually interwoven with my own experience and that I was no longer experiencing such volatile symptoms of my conflict based PSTD.

    I thought to myself "I can't be the only one that this kind of creativity can be beneficial for"                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Myself along with industry professionals from the worlds of film, creativity and healthcare are waiting to offer hands on group and individual mentoring at every step of the way in order to encapsulate and produce peoples stories in the goal of visualizing a turning point.                                                                                              

  • I've been working on Create Reel Change for a few years now, developing the concepts to succeed and build a network around me to support the project. No matter what I have done in my life whether it is interior architecture, design, community outreach or even comedy, the core value that I have learnt is striving to help people and make things better.                                                                               
  • With your help we will be able to realize this opportunity to Create Reel Change and will be able to lease a physical space that can be dedicated to our wellness possibilities. We will also cover the costs of setting up and establishing the 501(c)(3) non profit organisation. Equipment will also be purchased in order to expand our services.                                                                                                                        

  • Create Reel Change is based on the emotion of a particular situation and creating a short film that emotional state rather than continuing to live in the memory. We work with people in need on a voluntary basis and cover every aspect of mental health and every aspect of creativity including thinking, writing, drawing and filming. A cooking section is also planned where we utilize ingredients as emotions.

We Need To Get An Official Space To Bring Our Wellness Programs To Those In Need. We Need Showcase Venues To Bring Awareness To The Public. We Need Your Help.

Although our services are free and voluntary, there are still costs associated with this endeavor. With the funding, our plan is to

  • be able to lease a physical space that can be dedicated to our wellness possibilities. We have The Hub in Salt Lake City as a possible venue at a cost of $4740. Marketing and other running costs $2500

  • cover the costs of setting up and establishing the 501(c)(3) non profit corporation. $750 approx. including lawyer fees.

  • purchase necessary equipment in order to expand our services. Such as AV cameras and other technology. $9000

  • theater rental costs to showcase content. $3000

  • Once established we will purchase a used food truck to refurbish. The truck will  not only serve healthy created food but also serve as a means to display all the work around while people enjoy their lunch. A means of employment for participants and a form of revenue. $30000                                                                                

    If we don't reach our target?

    • Create Reel Change will still put one foot in front of the other and continue to strive to promote creativity as a means of recovery. Whatever is raised will be plugged straight into making this a success. The goal is the same but the journey may be a bit longer.

The Impact

How will your contribution help?

  • Create Reel Change is not just aimed at the local market. The possibilities are endless and the amount of people that will be attracted to this are many.
  • As Create Reel Change expands there will be a genuine positive impact to communities.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Why me? Can I do it?
     
  • I have been successful in many other direct interaction industries over the past 10 years. People across Europe and America lives have been enhanced due directly to my creative workplace and collaborative concepts. I have created some of the most successful community outreach creative festivals in Salt Lake City with an amazing success rate. With all these qualities and experience including a profile in excellence in conflict resolution and desire to help everyone make things better, I am positioned to CREATE REEL CHANGE with your help. 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many possibilities to help other than donating.

  • Please share this campaign as much as you can to as many people as you can.
  • There are easy share tools right here that IndieGoGo provides.
  • You can volunteer to help. You don't have to have a talent or be creative. Just a desire to help.

Please contact me at createreelchange@gmail.com with any questions you may have. I'd like to thank you right here and right now for whatever you can do. Cheers.

Your vision is so clear, yet fluidly flexible. You will change the lives of many for the better. Our society (including myself) didn't know our hearts and souls so desperately need this. The inner wars that are silently utteredin our minds, shared over lost nights to friends, and danced over like a pretty crisis in society. Thank you for sharing your struggles with us, and helping us grow from ours. Crisis is sometimes a life, a day, or if your lucky - just a moment. But wherever we are in that spectrum, I know you are here to help us all see it for what it is, and isn't.

I think it is awesome.

It's a reassuring feeling to be able to recommend an organization whose main roots are solid towards a cause.

been watching with great interest,

I'm interested in your development stage as well as the production aspect of your endeavor.

I am so glad you are doing that. Good job.

I dug your heartfelt video.

Your program does mean a lot to me personally as I have suffered from mental illness for a good portion of my life, and have overcome so much through creativity in music, film, theatre, etc. You, whether you realize it, have personally helped me a lot as well, and I thank you for that!

Wow very cool!

This is fantastic!

Oh boy did you come to the right place my friend.... I love your story and ideas

your concept sounds great.

This sounds like a very worthwhile endeavor! I'm glad you are doing it!

this great cause.

I commend you on your efforts to get this project going and for your dedication to helping to understand mental health issues. With one of my immediate family members being deeply affected by depression, I've seen the affects first hand and I definitely support anyone working to make a change.

That's really awesome.

Good work! Thanks for making the world a better place!

Wow,man, thats awesome what you are trying to do here. Its fantastic what you are trying to achieve here.

Awesome!

You da man, Brian

I think this is a brilliant and wonderful idea.

Certainly a worthy cause and sounds like a great idea. Especially considering the number of artists and creative people who are plagued by mental health issues which can destroy their lives, potential and output. The industry history is full of addicts (a lot of addicts are self-medicating for a mental illness) and suicides. Great project

It's amazing what you are doing with your non profit organization for mental health it's so important to have that resource out there for people especially adults that maybe struggling with this and taking a different approach to it is awesome.

AWESOME!

It sounds very worthy.

What a brilliant project

I really love what you are doing

Sounds like a really noble effort.

Looks like a wonderful effort and a totally worthy cause.

Sounds like an awesome cause.

really great thing yer doing here,

I am very interested.

seems like a really good idea. Mental health seems to be something that gets forgotten about very easily.

Mental health is an important issue to me. It's awesome that you are doing something.

I am all for new and more realistic programs!

Think its awesome what you are wanting to do with it

a terribly worthy endeavor.

This really hits home for me.

That is amazing.

story:
Rest In Memory keeps alive the stories of a person even after his death.
Thanks to a RIM tile (with a QR Code and an embedded NFC tag) placed on the gravestone, you can browse photos and memories of a passed away person.

Website: http://www.restinmemory.com

Why

We are an Italian web company and we usually deal with music and digital entertainment. Death is a subject quite far from our business and thoughts.

Apparently.

The more you grow up, the more you find yourself visiting a cemetery and walking among tombostones with a grandfather telling stories about people passed away. Stories we would have never know without our grandparents. This is why we decided to start Rest in memory, a project to save memories of entire lives. No matter if the stories are about heroes or common people, because each family deserves its stories to be told and kept alive.

Rest in Memory is our contribution to save these memories, using mobile and web technologies to let each tombstone become "accessible" with a smartphone and able to show people's photos and tales. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need 5000 Euros to cover all start up costs:

  • first 250 marble RIM (Rest In Memory) tiles
  • print and NFC microchip tagging process
  • deluxe packaging
  • web design, software development and server
  • video
  • press

If we reach the target you will help up to go ahead the italian taboo of death :-) and you'll get an easy way to keep alive the tales of your family.

Because all stories even the simplest ones have something important to tell us like in the book of Edgar Lee Masters "Spoon River Anthology" and all together give us the sense of a community .

We trust a lot our project, so if we don't reach the target here we will go on and complete the fund by ourselves. Everyone who will trust us will receive its RIM tile.

"At first it seemed like something grim, but then I thought about my family's amazing history and it would be a pity not to preserve it" Paolo

"With Rest in Memory every grave can become a book, every cemetery a library" Fiz

"I've never thought I would have been here sitting with my grandson writing down our family memories... but it's important not to leave these stories behind" Gianni

"I've just uploaded my great-grandparents' pictures and some of my grandparents' anecdotes, and I was deeply moved. I hope one day someone will do it for me" Maria

"In this way, my future great-grandchildren will know something about me" Giulio

"I use it as to make sure that all these moments won't be lost like tears in the rain" Filippo

Website: http://www.restinmemory.com


How does it works 


    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute or if you don't like our project, help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Share this campaign everywhere!

    Talk with your parents and with your grandparents... maybe they are more wired than what you think! :-)

story:
What You Need to Know About This Project (the Short Story):

  • We want to offer our Medical & Motivation Account as a FREE iOS app for a better & more effective user experience.
  • We need to raise $12,000 in 30 days to pay for the app development to complete this goal - it's all about coding now!
  • The Medical & Motivation Account offers more than the traditional health apps acting only as electronic file cabinets. 
  • Yes, the Medical & Motivational Account can store the important, concrete details of your health. 
  • The Medical & Motivation Account also gives you the opportunity to contemplate questions and details about what’s going on  to help you create a foundation of knowledge (however strong you’re feeling to work towards). Giving more power back to the patient. (Did you know that even your fashion choice can affect how your appointment goes?)
  • The Medical & Motivation Account has been built recognizing that the user/patient has the potential of being the true expert on their health - the one who has to deal with any course of treatment decided on (the good, the bad and the ugly). Therefore, this person should have an opportunity to grow their voice in the decision-making process and on their own team. We want to help.
  • The Medical & Motivation Account has been created by Jenna, who has grown up in the healthcare system and knows what it takes to be a competent and confident patient (after making a lot of mistakes out of denial, resentment, and a yearning to be more than a patient in the eyes of society). She is now committed to using her experiences as a patient to become a better practitioner.
  • It comes with 9 sections: Symptoms (with a NEW Pain Tracker after project completion), Medication, Before My Appointment, My Appointment, Doctors, Surgery/Procedure, In Case of Emergency, Need to Know, Motivation.
  • The new Pain Tracker has been created with the guidance of those who deal with pain on a regular basis - Jenna wanted to go to the experts for that! 
  • We wanted to bring you a tool that accurately validates and communicates what it means to live with chronic pain, while working to maintain your quality of life. It is highly customizable, so that you can then see and show others who can offer the right support what pain looks like and feels to you, which gives you the best chance to find the right help. You'll be able to assign different pain types with a colour and use your finger or a stylus to show exactly where it hurts on the outline of a body provided. Ultimately, we want the app to take that data and turn it into a chart so you can see how pain affects your life, potentially seeing patterns and a new game strategy!
  • Our Medication section has become more comprehensive, giving you the opportunity to get notifications and reminders to take your meds and how much. It goes further to support those of you with more complex regimes that might come about during Cancer treatments, because the stress of keeping up with everything is that last thing you need!
  • We have also worked to make sure you can get reminders and notifications of upcoming appointments, so you can focus on getting ready - mind, body, and spirit - for those appointments and make the most out of them.

How This Professional Patient-Turned-Practitioner Was Inspired to Create the Medical & Motivation Account (the Longer Story):

Holed up in intensive care not too long ago, I came within a hair’s breadth of seeing “the light” from an out-of-control infection (stacked onto some other problems). While I’d been in the hospital many times before, this last visit easily crowned the stress chart. I’d had to be relentless in dealing with the medical staff, I felt mostly ignored as I voiced my concerns, and it was only a hysterical outburst on my part that finally got me the attention – and the emergency surgery right in my room – that I needed. It also left me with another little bonus - full-blown Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder. Ta da! I’d hit bottom.

Rock? Bottom has redeeming features, though! I realized clearly that it was my ability to advocate for myself (not easy when you don’t like bothering people) that had saved my life. I also realized how many lessons I’d learned over the years that could not only help me, if I crunched them into a system, but could help so many others (including parents of children with medical needs) who were just starting their medical odyssey or hadn’t been in the kiln quite as long.

These experiences as a patient trying and learning to navigate the healthcare system are enriched by my work as a registered social worker with a Master's of Social Work degree. I see how to effectively navigate the system and the support that can make the biggest impact. I have an understanding of what patients need from their practitioners, and what practitioners need from their patients. Therefore, you learn a variety of lessons: how to be assertive, not aggressive; how to better communicate your (the various items in a list need to have parallel structure) needs and ability; tips and tricks like how your outfit can impact your appointment and what you can do to keep calm and resilient as a patient; and how to continue growing and evolving into a competent and confident patient. Learn more about Phoenix Attitude's founder, Jenna 

Why We're Asking for Your Help:

Until now the Medical & Motivation Account has been offered through our mobile-friendly website. However, as so many of us rely on our phones to improve our quality of life with ease, using the website is most effective for computer use. In fact, the most frequent question we get is if there is a Medical & Motivation Account app. 

We're dedicated to providing a better solution that is easy to use, effective and empowering. We think this what healthcare tools should be, not ones that fuel resentment for having health challenges and ultimately leave us frozen in denial. We need to transition the Medical & Motivation Account from a mobile-friendly web tool to an app (iOS, hoping to offer an Android version in the future). In doing so, we expect more people - like you - will be willing to put in the work and become the expert on yourselves. 

Your health challenges don't define you - you're unique and have the potential to impact the world. The last thing you want is to be sidelined by your health challenges longer than necessary. (I know writing in active is better than passive, but “are” is incorrect because you’re talking about “the last thing” (which is singular) are your health challenges sidelining you longer than necessary.

What the App Would Include: 

The Medical & Motivation Account is made up of 9 sections coming together to give you the ability to engage with your health in a meaningful way: 

  • In Case of Emergency; 
  • Need to Know; 
  • Doctors; 
  • Medication; 
  • Symptoms featuring our new Pain Tracker; 
  • Surgeries/Procedures; 
  • Before My Appointment; 
  • My Appointment; 
  • MOTIVATION 

These sections don't just focus on your body, but your mind and spirit, too, as I see them so interrelated.

Each section helps you create a foundation of knowledge to build on (as much or as little as you want) to make the most of your healthcare experience. Using it helps you understand what works for you and what doesn't, making you more confident and assertive about how you're treated. You realize how valuable it is to have concrete information on how your body is working at your fingertips ready to be a part of recovering quicker! Finally, you're offered the potential to not only support your body, but fortify your mind and spirit, too. 

As before, you can share parts of your Medical & Motivation Account with your support network who also have an account. You always have the option of rescinding access, and their access is read-only so the information can't be altered.

Because we want this app to help you in every possible way, we even put significant thought into the colour scheme and decided that a bright, colourful design would be best. Even the colour scheme was a conscious choice for the Medical & Motivation Account! It's colourful! That's right, we didn't want (what I hope becomes) your new healthcare sidekick to make you feel like you're stuck in the often-sterile white walls of the hospital or the doctor's office - I wanted you to be reminded of the vibrant person you are! The Motivation section has been built so that you can have a laugh when you're having a bad day or need a distraction, to inspire you, to motivate you, to give you hope, and so that you can see how other people cope and thrive (you didn't think you were alone, did you?).

Our Goal:

To build this app for iOS and include our new pain tracker we need $12,000. We are hoping to achieve this goal in 30 days so that we can start development, which will take 12-16 weeks. We are working with developers in Toronto to bring this project to life, who have successfully delivered 1000+ projects from small websites to complex international portals, from online shops to mobile apps, from software solutions to digital marketing services. 

What's New & Exciting That Will be Available on the App: 

We are adding more in-depth functionality in the Medication section so users can have reminders emailed to you or have a notification pop up on your iOS device. We are also working to better support people with more complex medication regimes that require different dosages of a medication at different times of the day, as well as letting users know when it's time to stop a medication and begin a new one another one. 

We are also building a Pain Tracker in the Symptoms section so you can get a better understanding of your pain and more effectively communicate it. With this new tool you can assign your pain a colour then fill in the outline of a body provided in the corresponding area (no matter how many different kinds of pain you experience). This data will then be available to you in charts you can track over a day, week, month, and year. This is meant to track patterns and therefore help you better treat the pain more efficiently.

Finally, users will be offered the ability to get reminders emailed to them or as a notification on your iOS device for upcoming appointments!

Testimonials:

New Health Challenges - As an active, 30-year-old woman, I had been healthy my whole life. Very recently I was thrown a curve ball, and having no previous experience with serious health concerns, my new reality was very distressing and overwhelming. Phoenix Attitude proved vital in helping me navigate this unexpected and highly emotionally-charged situation by preparing me for appointments with my doctors, and providing the right tools for me to get all of my important information down during and after these appointments, to be able to draw upon it whenever I may need in the future. I only wish I had taken advantage of all this site has to offer sooner, rather than waiting for a crisis situation. I highly recommend Phoenix Attitude to anyone who wants to be proactive about their health. Thank you, Phoenix Attitude! 

Caregiver - Phoenix Attitude has changed my life for the better. As a professional caregiver it enables me to easily input my client’s important health information and share it with their family. I like being able to give my elderly clients’ children the opportunity to stay involved, even if they’ve moved away and are raising their own family. With the Medical & Motivation account, distance does not have to impede families taking care of each other.

Daughter - I am the daughter of a mother with an acquired brain injury. This sudden illness resulted in an extended hospital stay and a flurry of appointments with doctors whose specialties I had never even heard of. This was overwhelming and scary for me, as an 18 year old, and for my siblings. During that time, many questions were put to us that, as her children, we had never considered and couldn’t begin to answer. During those early years we were carried along in a flow of confusion, fear and barely understood medical terminology. We didn’t know what questions to ask or even how to understand the answers to the questions we were able to ask. 

Now, almost 14 years on I am still going to appointments with my mother, but today I attend those appointments as my mother’s advocate. My mother is a strong, intelligent and fiercely independent woman whose aphasia, all too often, causes doctors and service providers to attempt to talk over her or look to us for answers to their questions.  

Having the opportunity to explore the Medical & Motivation Account created by Phoenix Attitude was incredible. I felt relief. Relief that I would no longer have to be a ‘custodian’ of my mother’s medical history; relief that something ‘small’ wouldn’t be forgotten or overlooked in the face of ‘larger’ issues; relief that my mother could have some control over her own medical journey.  

The account is easy to use and to personalize. All too often when faced with a form I find myself wondering what to write, but the prompts and options provided offer the direction, while not limiting the user to a ‘form answer’. Having the ability to record a wide range of experience and information in a single place is reassuring for my mother, but also for her children. We know that the information is compiled and accessible if we need it.

As the daughter of a medically complex parent I highly recommend the Medical & Motivation Account created by Phoenix Attitude. It has given my mother control of her own medical journey and her children a sense of relief. Thank you Phoenix Attitude!

story:
The best potty for newborn babies. Now even better.

A new and improved version of the discontinued EC top hat potty?
Oh yes.
Let me explain.

First, quick back story.

When I first started EC with my first baby, I had to wait 8 weeks to get my top hat potty, or baby potty bowl, in the mail. It was terrible.

But once I got it, I ordered another immediately. Because who knew how long you could get these?

And that's exactly the current situation.

No one manufactures the top hat potty anymore, and if anyone still has them in their store, their availability is unpredictable at best.

I'm going to solve that with The Baby Potty.

But who am I, you might be asking?

I'm Andrea Olson from Go Diaper Free (where I teach new parents Elimination Communication aka EC, and potty training for older babies), Tiny Undies (where I sell undies and training pants from 6 months up), and DiaperFreeBaby (the international non-profit for EC awareness).

Besides my 2 best-selling books, I've brought 3 physical products to market: a popular board book called Tiny Potty, Tiny Undies, and Tiny Trainers.

You are in good hands, potential backers. I've been known to bring a great product to market. :)

What is a top hat potty?

Top hat potties are convenient, discreet, and small. They are for 0-12 month (or older) babies. Great for newborn EC, pottying on the go, and nighttime EC.

Here's a quick vid on how to use a top hat potty with a small baby:

So, what are we gonna do about this potty shortage?

Let's get 'em made, but let's do it even better.

Introducing The Baby Potty.

It is better than the old model because it is biodegradable, non-slip, and already comfortable.

  1. BIODEGRADABLE GOODNESS. I'm using biodegradable plant matter - aka bioplastic - so you can plant this baby potty in the garden when baby outgrows it. Think: becoPotty.
  2. NON-SLIP INGENUITY. I've added natural rubber strips (latex-free) to prevent slippage while holding the potty between your thighs...so no more spills of pee and poo onto your lap, the floor, the bed, your car, or your baby. (Ask me how I know.)
  3. A WARM AND COMFY SEAT. I'm including a potty cozy (liquid-repellant undyed fleece) to every potty. Because who likes a cold seat? Or extra cost? Not me, my dear. And not your baby, I assure you.

What we need to make this a reality

I've already sourced sweatshop-free suppliers for all aspects of the product and have submitted 2D and 3D renderings to build the first mold. Next steps are to make the mold (30 days), receive a test product, provide any revisions, then go into production and shipping (20-30 days plus 30 days to ship).

I estimate shipping out all final products to you on August 31, 2017.

Outstanding costs include:

  • making the mold $2000
  • first round of manufacturing $3000
  • manufacture of additional elements $1000
  • shipping and branding supplies $1000

But I need your help to make this a reality.

Please pre-order your Baby Potty today.

You can make sure everyone has long-term access to this ECing gem - which is integral to successfully potty a young baby - by backing this campaign and pre-ordering your Baby Potty today.

This potty helps the world by:

  • reducing plastic/potty waste (these potties are biodegradable)
  • reducing diaper waste (ECed babies typically use less than 1/2 the diapers of non-ECed babies)
  • helping parents stick with EC because they now have the right tools.

Here are some of the Perks I'm offering:

  • EC Stickers featuring the DiaperFreeBaby baby

  • The Baby Potty with rubber grip and undyed fleece potty cozy

  • 2-pack and 6-pack options

  • Book, Course, and all 3 Packages

  • A private 2-day in-person coach session with yours truly at your home, including all of the above.

 

Check out all the perks on this page and pre-order your potty - by purchasing a perk - today!

Other ways you can help

No matter what perk you choose, it would mean the world to me if you could please SHARE this campaign with your mama groups, your social networks, and your pals...it's only up for 10 days.

Thank you so much for your ongoing support and happy pottying!

xx

Go Diaper Free, Tiny Undies, and DiaperFreeBaby

Patent and trademark pending.

story:
Help this family in their time of need!

Above is my little nephew Ryan and his big sister. He has an identical twin brother, a big brother and a big sister. He loves to play almost any sport outside. A little over a week ago there was an accident where he was accidentally ran over by an ATV that lost control. The end result was an ambulance ride to UTMB in Galveston where they disovered he had a compound fracture in his right leg along with a gash on his back. He had surgery that night to clean up his cut and to close it up with 20 stiches. The following morning he had surgery to repair his broken femur which required 2 rods. He arrived on a Saturday evening and got to go home the following Tuesday evening meanwhile racking up a lot of money in hospital bills. His family does have insurance but with high deductible. His mom has to miss several weeks of work to care for him and take him to his doctor visits. I am hoping to get people to band together and help them through this. Lets help little Ryan to get healed so he can be back to playing football in the yard or whatever he wants to do. He has a long road ahead but he is one tough kid!

story:
Zac's Legacy Foundation is a small nonprofit that was founded by the family of Zac Carlson, who died of cancer at age 2 1/2 in 2000.  They help families that are fighting childhood cancer by providing financial assistance that allows the family to be there for their child as they undergo treatment.  Since 2000, they have raised and given away over $750,000.

I was asked to consult with Zac's to help them in two areas:  The first is to develop and implement services for survivors and their families as a growing number of kids beat cancer but are faced with many other problems as they reach their late teens and early adulthood.  No one is addressing these needs at present.  The second area of need is for an ongoing donor base.  The organization exists from fundraiser to fundraiser and doesn't have a group of donors that supports its ongoing work.

I am uniquely qualified to help them since I have over 30 years experience as Executive Director of nonprofit organizations, have survived cancer twice in the past six years, and my daughter died of cancer at age 9 in 1976.  Her mom and I are survivors of the era when you slept on couches in the hospital waiting room while you waited for news about your child.   Although she and I haven't spoken about this for many years, I am sure that she would support this campaign also.

Specifically, this campaign will allow me the time and resources to help Zac's move into the future.  All money they currently raise goes to helping families and they have nothing to use for building a much needed infrastructure.  They have no donor data base, recognition software, or fundraising plan.  In fact, I have to take my own laptop when I go to their office.  

My plan is to use the funds we raise to allow me to build the donor base through personal contact, mail, and media.  I need about $1,000 per month to allow me to quit my other part time job and devote the time to Zac's that it will take to get this going.  I will use the other money for subscriptions, software, other costs related to the infrastructure.  When we get the funding base going, I will shift gears and begin to work on new services.  The reason for putting the fundraising first is so that we don't start something we can't continue over time.

 Since Zac's is a 501(c)3 organization, all donations will be tax deductible.  If the goal is not reached, the money will still go to the organization and I will have to find somewhere else to find the additional funds needed to help meet these needs.  

I am having trouble coming up with perks -- In addition to the tax deduction, everyone who donates will receive Zac's newsletter (either email or snail mail).  However, my grown up kids tell me that they love the goodies I send them at Christmas, so if someone wants to make a large donation, I will send them some of the best caramel corn that they will ever taste.  I think I have to limit this to donors within the USA, because I don't know how legal it is to send candy across borders.

Bottom line is that families that battle childhood cancer need all the help we can give them.  Zac's Legacy provides that help to Colorado families, but has never built the infrastructure they need to sustain the organization over the long haul.  So that Zac's will be able to come along side of the families in need of help, we need to help strengthen the organization and make it sustainable.  I plan to devote my time, talent, and energy to help make this happen.  Please join me!

  • Please help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • There are Indiegogo share tools available for your use!

Thanks and Blessings,

John

John

story:
The Robertson's Story:

In December of 2012 Jaxson was diagnosed with stage 4 Hepatoblastoma, a rare form of liver cancer that usually hits children under 3 years of age.  Over the last 6 months Jaxson has undergone several treatments of chemotherapy at the Arkansas Children's Hospital.

Even though he has responded well to the chemotherapy the family recently found out a resection, a removal of part of his liver, will not be possible as they had hoped.  They have been told Jaxson will need a complete liver transplant as soon as possible.

Thankfully, due to the advanced stage of the cancer, Jaxson has been moved to the top of the list to receive a liver transplant at the St. Louis Children's Hospital as soon as one becomes available.

I am launching this campaign in the hopes that some of you will be willing to help this wonderful little boy and his family out.  While insurance is helping pick up the largest portion of their medical bills, it isn't covering everything.  On top of that, the family is struggling with the various travel expenses of making the 700 mile round trip.  (food, lodging, gasoline, etc)

Over the next few months they will have to make this 700 mile round trip several times, along with a two week stay in the St. Louis area when Jaxson receives his new liver.

 

Where does the money go?

100% of all donations go to the Robertson family.  The money will be used for medical and travel expenses as needed by the family to help them through these hard times.

 

(new) Perks Offered:

Middleton's, the people who set this campaign up, are offering several perks to those who donate.  They are giving away the following items as perks:


20 - 10% off any order coupons for those who donate $25+

20 - 20% off any order coupons for those who donate $50+

10 - Custom made 6x10in plaques for those who donate $100+

5 - Custom made 10x10in plaques for those who donate $250+

2 - 10in maple clocks for those who donate $500+

2 - Custom made birthday boards for those who donate $750+

Please visit www.middeng.com for examples of all items offered.


If you are unable to donate, please SHARE Jaxson's story!  Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Hello! Thanks for clicking on my campaign :)

Simply put, my name is Julia, and I am starting a breakfast cereal business.

It is a Wheat-free, Low-Glycemic, High-andioxidant, Superfood breakfast.

Very easy to make. Make it only once, save leftovers in the fridge for a convenient breakfast for mornings to come!

My background includes:

-Growing up in Whistler, therefore gaining a deep resepect for the environment and what it has to offer in the way of sports, organic food, and healthy living.

-The Whistler lifestyle inspired me to excell in skiing and fall in love with biking, and anything else to do with being outdoors. 

-Competing in the 2010 Olympic Winter Games in my hometown in Ski Cross (coming 12th, despite a badly injured knee). I created this as a dream as a positive thinking kid in 5th grade, and achieved my goal when the time came. This created a sense of great accomplishment,making me realize that it really is true that goals do become dreams come true. Now, I am fired up, confident, and extremely passionate about my next life goal: my very healthy cereal business that will fuel people to their personal excellence and positive, active lives.

Now, you can have a small part in making this cereal business a successful and inspiring story.

My cereal represents a healthy lifestyle, a deep respect for the environment, and the willingness to get up and do something great every day. 

After doing farmers markets, I know that this product is something people love. It makes them feel good about what they are putting into their body and it tastes delicious. It allows them to do anything they need to do that day with sustainable energy.

I'll be promoting the cereal myself in the multiple grocery stores across Whistler, then Whole Foods. Along with the promotion of the cereal, I will be promoting my Olympic story and the importance of healthy eating and active lifestyle to achieve a healthy and positive life. I will be getting the exciting point across that if you fuel your body the best way available, you will get the most out of who you are physically, emotionally and mentally... throughout the day.

Having my father (Crazy Canuck, Dave Murray) pass away from Melanoma, I will be partnering with the Melanoma Network of Canada to bring awareness to the importance of sun protection. My cereal is a great way to help extend the awareness across the continent eventually. 

Within the next year the goal is to have all the grocery stores in Whistler stocked with Jules Fuel, as well as the Whole Foods in Vancouver. I will be sharing my passion for the product, and for healthy living at these stores, in the community, and in the media consistently throughout the entire process, and onward!

 

What We Need & What You Get

The funding will go into the start up costs of the business. You name it! Any little bit that I recieve will be a great help.

I am working with designers, co-packagers, retailers and distributors to get my company 'fuelled' up and ready for the shelves. 

At the moment, the money will go towards:

-the artwork of my label and packaging

-co-packaging costs

-distribution costs

-trademarking and certifications.

The dream is to have Jules Fuel reach across North America. Along with the cereal comes the inspiration to live healthy.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

For more information on who I am go here:

www.juliamurray.ca

For the 'Jules Fuel' Facebook page head here (branding is still underway):

http://on.fb.me/12C0Fam

Feel free to share either of these sites! 

 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME!!

I appreciate your support in creating a healthy, happy future !

All it starts with is some fuel.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hello! Thanks for clicking on my campaign :)
Simply put, my name is Julia, and I am starting a breakfast cereal business.
It is a Wheat-free, Low-Glycemic, High-andioxidant, Superfood breakfast.
Very easy to make. Make it only once, save leftovers in the fridge for a convenient breakfast for mornings to come!
My background includes:
-Growing up in Whistler, therefore gaining a deep resepect for the environment and what it has to offer in the way of sports, organic food, and healthy living.
-The Whistler lifestyle inspired me to excell in skiing and fall in love with biking, and anything else to do with being outdoors. 
-Competing in the 2010 Olympic Winter Games in my hometown in Ski Cross (coming 12th, despite a badly injured knee). I created this as a dream as a positive thinking kid in 5th grade, and achieved my goal when the time came. This created a sense of great accomplishment,making me realize that it really is true that goals do become dreams come true. Now, I am fired up, confident, and extremely passionate about my next life goal: my very healthy cereal business that will fuel people to their personal excellence and positive, active lives.
Now, you can have a small part in making this cereal business a successful and inspiring story.
My cereal represents a healthy lifestyle, a deep respect for the environment, and the willingness to get up and do something great every day. 
After doing farmers markets, I know that this product is something people love. It makes them feel good about what they are putting into their body and it tastes delicious. It allows them to do anything they need to do that day with sustainable energy.
I'll be promoting the cereal myself in the multiple grocery stores across Whistler, then Whole Foods. Along with the promotion of the cereal, I will be promoting my Olympic story and the importance of healthy eating and active lifestyle to achieve a healthy and positive life. I will be getting the exciting point across that if you fuel your body the best way available, you will get the most out of who you are physically, emotionally and mentally... throughout the day.
Having my father (Crazy Canuck, Dave Murray) pass away from Melanoma, I will be partnering with the Melanoma Network of Canada to bring awareness to the importance of sun protection. My cereal is a great way to help extend the awareness across the continent eventually. 
Within the next year the goal is to have all the grocery stores in Whistler stocked with Jules Fuel, as well as the Whole Foods in Vancouver. I will be sharing my passion for the product, and for healthy living at these stores, in the community, and in the media consistently throughout the entire process, and onward!
 


What We Need & What You Get
The funding will go into the start up costs of the business. You name it! Any little bit that I recieve will be a great help.
I am working with designers, co-packagers, retailers and distributors to get my company 'fuelled' up and ready for the shelves. 
At the moment, the money will go towards:
-the artwork of my label and packaging
-co-packaging costs
-distribution costs
-trademarking and certifications.
The dream is to have Jules Fuel reach across North America. Along with the cereal comes the inspiration to live healthy.
 


Other Ways You Can Help
For more information on who I am go here:
www.juliamurray.ca
For the 'Jules Fuel' Facebook page head here (branding is still underway):
http://on.fb.me/12C0Fam
Feel free to share either of these sites! 
 
THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME!!
I appreciate your support in creating a healthy, happy future !
All it starts with is some fuel.

story:
My Story

Hello everyone and thank you for coming to my campaign. I am William Shkrob. When I was not yet 6 years old, my dad gave me a tennis racket, drew a tennis court on our driveway, and used the kiddy badminton net as tennis net. I remember kids from all over the neighborhood coming to play tennis on our “do it yourself” court and all the parents watching and having as much fun as we did. That’s how I started playing the game that I passionately love. Since that important day I have grown a lot. I am now a high school freshman and am 5 feet 11 inches tall. We moved to Florida from Michigan almost 3 years ago, so that I could play tennis 24/7/365, which I actually do. I am now getting ready to participate in my first international tournament and that is where I need your help, folks. This tournament is important, first, because I will be representing our country. And also, this is where I begin earning international points in order to participate in higher level tournaments leading to college or professional tennis.

What we need & What You Get

I need to raise $1,500 to cover my tournament costs and travelling expenses for a week in April.
 
I would appreciate every penny donated and every word spread to your families and friends that might want to help me.
 
 

Thank you

Thank you for visiting my campaign and thank you for your help. It is my great honor to represent the United States and American people at an international event.

story:
I’m establishing this fund raiser on behalf of my wife Kathryn McCabe.  She has always been a genuinely kind, sensitive and a generous person/wife/mother of four.  Unconditionally devoting her life to helping and serving others. 

On August 8, 2011 her life was completely turned upside down.  She suffered an unexpected massive intracranial bleed.  The injury left her paralyzed on the right (dominant) side of her body and unable to speak.  She spent 18 days hospitalized in the neurointensive care unit and then another 28 days in the intensive inpatient rehabilitation unit.

The ongoing recovery process has been painfully slow and physically/mentally exhausting.  Throughout this entire process Kathryn has kept a smile on her face and continues to have faith that there's a light at the end of the tunnel.  She works extremely hard each day to get the various therapies and treatments she needs to maximize her recovery.  The smallest improvements provide the encouragement and hope to keep pushing forward.

Unfortunately with the overwhelming medical and therapy bills, our expenses have dramatically increased while our income has dramatically decreased.   I have significantly reduced our monthly household expenses, but gradually our resources are becoming depleted.

I’m committed to helping Kathryn regain the life she once had.  All donations from this fund raiser will go directly to pay for the ongoing treatments and therapies she needs to accomplish this goal. 

To help Kathryn with her recovery effort, I am reaching out to anyone able to help.  Also, please consider sharing Kathryn’s story with others, who may be willing to contribute, it would be greatly appreciated.  Indiegogo has provided share tools for this purpose. 

Kathryn is truly blessed to surrounded by so many loving family and friends.  Thank you in advance for everyone’s support, prayers and help during this difficult time.

story:
Short Summary

Hi people!  Here's the story.  In October 2012, I injured my back lifting weights.  I was forced out of work in January with a bulged L5S1 disc in my spine.  I had terrible spasms that shot down my right leg as far down as my calf.  These spasms could last seconds up to 5-10 minutes.  My girlfriend had to help me roll over in bed, get off the couch, and most days, even get dressed in the mornings.  On 2/21/13, I had a procedure done that removed some bone, ligaments, and broken disc from my spine.  I felt great after it...for about a week.  I ended up having more of the remaining disc slip ou, and the spasms were even worse than before.  I had spinal fusion surgery on 4/2/13.  The procedure was scheduled to be a 2 hour procedure.  Due to the amount of scar tissue that was wrapped around my nerve, and the amount of damage, the surgery took about 4 1/2 hours.  When I woke up from that one, the pain was intense!  About a week after that surgery, the top of the incision became infected and I was in the ER for about 13 hours.  When the stitches came out, the top of the incision had not healed at all and was an open hole (just below the "Y" in my tattoo).  The hole was about an inch long, inch wide, and an inch and a half deep.  It had to be packed twice a day with saline soaked gauze for the next 2 1/2 months.  Needless to say, this set back my recovery 2 1/2 months.  I was finally cleared to begin light exercise in the end of June.  I had gone form being in the gym 3 hours a day, 6 days a week, to barely being able to handle 30 minutes of non impact cardio.  Work denied my return to work restrictions that my Doctors had put in place, and Long Term Disability is denying my claim for coverage.  I am out of work, and out of ways to cover the most basic of life expences.

What We Need & What You Get

I had medical insurance, which did cover a good majority of the expenses of the procedures.  The at home supplies for the packing of the open wound, co-pays, and out of pocket costs have run my $7500 out of pocket just for the medical costs impact.  Now with not being able to return to my regular job, I have no income due to the denial of the long term disability claim.  I am hoping to be back to work by the beginning of fall at the latest, unless I find a job that does not interfear with the restrictions my Doctors put in place.  I have never been one to ask for help in any situation, but this time, I have to step out of my comfort zone.  I don't expect to live like I did when I was working full time with no injury, I am just trying to cover the medical bills, insurance costs, eat, and keep my vehicle on the road so I can get to my Doctors appointments and the gym.  If I end up raising any funds that don't get used for these purposes, I will pay it forward to another charitable cause.  I spent the vast majority of my free time and funds in my adult life giving my body to entertain others and help them forget about their daily worries.  Now I am asking those of you that I may have entertained to help me out a little bit if you can.

If you can help, I greatly appreicate it.  Please share this on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, any social netowrk you can.  Any help is a great help right now.  Thank you so very much.  I will bounce back from this and be back to normal as soon as I can so I can get back to doing what I love.  ANd until then, I will Keep Calm and Chive On!

 

Thank you!

story:
Hi,

My name is Cristian Mihai. I'm a very young Romanian self-publisher and blogger. And, unfortunately, I need your help.

The last two weeks have been terrible. My right ear began to hurt. Then the right side of my jaw. And painkillers wouldn’t do much good. I struggled. Pain followed me everywhere, prevented me from sleeping, prevented me from properly hearing my own thoughts.

I went to see a doctor. He prescribed antibiotics and painkillers… it did the trick. Problem is, they’re kind of expensive. Also, apparently, to blame for all this is an infected tooth… well, the infections spread out or something like that, which is a really bad thing.

I went and had the x-ray taken. Of course, no one bother to explain stuff there, so I went to the dentist. I just couldn’t wait. I wanted to know what was going to happen. So, I asked him for a bit of his time, between appointments, just to look at my x-ray and tell me what was what.

I wish I hadn’t went there, because I didn’t really like his answer.

The situation is bad. Like really bad. He isn’t sure he can save my tooth, and an extraction would mean that there I’ve got no molars left on that side, so it would make eating kind of difficult. Also, I’ve got cavities underneath my teeth in the lower right side, which sucks even more.

The easiest way out is to recover the tooth, take care of the others, then cover them all. I’m not sure how to explain this in medical terms. Yeah, something like that. That’s the easiest, least expensive way. Because a single implant (which I would need in case of an extraction) would cost around 1,300 USD, which I can’t afford right now. And that’s without the additional costs of paying for the other teeth to be treated, and all the other treatments and stuff.

Simply put, my next appointment is this Thursday. He said that we needed to act as soon as possible, in an attempt to save everything before it’s too late, and the whole procedure would cost as much as an implant.

Basically, it would cost half. Oh, and I don’t run the risk of the infection spreading to the bone… because that’s the big risk; he can’t tell for sure (from the x-ray) if the root is affected or not.


I just want for things to be okay. I want to be able to sleep and eat, which is something we all take for granted. It’s not extraordinary or fascinating. Simple acts, things we do all our lives.

story:
At Skill Connect we like to say "it keeps the money in the circle, so at the end of the day more of your money is yours."

Co-founders

Nikoan Johnson
Founder

Dreamt up the idea that is Skill Connect and sought for a team to bring it to fruition. Has carriage for PR & Communications and Campaign Management. Overseas Development and Navigation flor and the day to day of Skill Connect.

Wellington Ferguson
COO

Littered with degrees in marketing and project management and assumes such responsibilities at Skill Connect 

How The Donations Will Be Used

As we are a startup, we truly do need the money. Your contributions will help us to continue to make inroads to this tool helping one to help another. It helps to further our ideas and convictions that friends will always charge you less; saving you untold amounts in unnecessary expenditure, expanding your residual income. 

The funds will be used to:

  • hire a developer to complete the first iteration of the application
  • server subscription and the other technologies needed to run the app
  • legal fees
  • marketing

Timeline To Release

Perks

Concerning our perks lineup - if you'd like to see more or other perks please lets us know and we'll do everything to accommodate the highest voted ones.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're enthused about this project we ask that you:

  • help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Check out the incredible share tools that Indiegogo makes available, they're positioned just under our video pitch atop the page. Thanks for your support in any form.

story: A little girl name chloe seal who many of you know lives local and this poor little mite has been in and out of hospital most of her little life, when she was born her parents were only told she was a flat baby she had septic shock and had a hole in her heart, now years on after numerous hospital appointments they have found that little chloe,s birth records had been lost, they never got told a good enough reason as to why there little girl could not stand - walk - crawl or even talk only when they moved to my area did things start to unfold and doctors have now told this distraught mum and dad that there 6 year old little girl has brain damage. the little brother joe jr who has also undergone a number of surgerys due to hearing problems- they have 3 other children to look after and are planning on getting married in may. this family have really been through the toughest time any parent could face, so i want us as a community to raise as much money as we can to help make things a bit easier for chloe and maybe if we raise enough a holiday for mum dad and the other children who have all been brilliant coping with little chloes illness xx so please please donate no matter how small or large for this family we as a community can do this if we all pull together so please please copy and paste this to everyone you know and lets help this family out xx tyvm in advance xx
