story:
To order yours now look to the right hand side of this screen to see the perks. Have a scroll through and click on the one you fancy to order now :)

                     

A quick note about our amaaaaazing foamy lather!

                    

Who we are...

 

We are a group of friends who care about our health and the environment around us.  A few years ago we began to realise just how many harmful chemicals were in the toiletries and cleaning products we were using on ourselves and homes on a daily basis.

                            

Just take a look at the label on one of your personal care or cleaning products and see how many ingredients you can't even pronounce! We discovered there were some serious health problems we were putting ourselves at risk of by using these commercial brands, without even realising it. So we made the decision to avoid these ingredients and switch to using natural, chemical-free products which wouldn't mess with our health.

                             

We soon discovered that even 'natural', 'organic' or 'chemical free' products were often not in fact free of extremely harmful and toxic ingredients or even 100% organic! (have a quick google about Sodium Laurel Sulphate which is in 90% of products that foam and you will see what we mean).

                            

On our travels in Asia we discovered someone making exactly what we were looking for: 100% natural, chemical-free products containing only natural, plant ingredients with no pesticides or other chemicals involved anywhere in the process. Immediately we knew that we had to make these available to people in the UK-and worldwide!

 

Why should you get involved?

We're looking to raise £5000 (although if we get more that would be brilliant), this will cover the initial order to bring the product into the UK and set up all the business operations. We have planned a large range of other products we'll be launching too which we are very excited to tell you about! So the more we raise the faster we'll be able to bring these to the market and build up the business. 

The perks we've put together ensure you'll be the first in the world to get scrubbing with the Natures Knowledge range of personal care products. We're building a community of like minded people who are passionate health and changing their environments.

                      

If we don't meet our goals we'll still be bringing in these amazing products, we'll just have to beg and borrow... that is how much we believe in them!!

 

The Impact


As you would expect, these personal care products are 100% natural, paraben-free, chemical-free, pesticide-free, naturally hypoallergenic, vegan and completely free from any animal testing. They smell great and are fantasic to use because they are made entirely from plants. Even the ingredient that makes the bubbles is a simple fruit - the soap nut!

 

                                

Not only that, these products are also probiotic and bio-positive which means using them actually improves the environment! This is all down to the Effective Microorganisms ('EM's') which are probiotic good bacteria that basically clean up the harmful bacteria (a bit like that well known yoghurt with added good bacteria). 

                   

Another good thing is that the place where our products are made use absolutely no machinery during the bottling process which means we leave practically no carbon footprint! 

                   

 

If you care about your health and your environment and want to avoid health problems from using harmful chemicals and help prevent their toxic build-up in the environment alongside like-minded people who want to protect and promote healthy people and a healthy ecosystem, Nature's Knowledge products are something we know you will love!

Other ways you can support

If you can't financially support us at this stage but would like to follow the journey here are our platforms you can follow us on...

  •  Facebook

  •  Twitter

  •  Our Blog

Please also share this page with everyone and anyone who you know will enjoy this project!

Thanks for reading

The Nature's Knowledge Team x

 

                           Smell Fresher, Look Better, Feel Revitalised...

                    

With our specially selected blend of exotic plants and herbs, not only will you have a safer wash but you will smell fresher, look better and feel revitalised having our probiotic force field wrapped lovingly around your body. 

 

If you'd like to know more about some of the ingredients...

 

                           Indian Gooseberry 

                          

                                                                                                                      

 This therapeutic herb possesses many medicinal qualities that are good for nourishing and rejuvenating the skin whilst also being soothing for the mind.

 

                              Soap Nut

                      

Not only is it naturally hypoallergenic and antifungal but its star quality is its bubble making... and lots of them too! Also as it’s not a nut it can be used by anyone whether you have any skin complaints or allergies.

 

                              Coconut Oil

                     

Regular washing with this amazing natural ingredient helps to make your skin incredibly silky whilst giving it a deep and refreshing clean all due to its brilliant antibacterial properties.
story_txt:
To order yours now look to the right hand side of this screen to see the perks. Have a scroll through and click on the one you fancy to order now :)

                     
A quick note about our amaaaaazing foamy lather!
                    
Who we are...
 
We are a group of friends who care about our health and the environment around us.  A few years ago we began to realise just how many harmful chemicals were in the toiletries and cleaning products we were using on ourselves and homes on a daily basis.
                            
Just take a look at the label on one of your personal care or cleaning products and see how many ingredients you can't even pronounce! We discovered there were some serious health problems we were putting ourselves at risk of by using these commercial brands, without even realising it. So we made the decision to avoid these ingredients and switch to using natural, chemical-free products which wouldn't mess with our health.
                             
We soon discovered that even 'natural', 'organic' or 'chemical free' products were often not in fact free of extremely harmful and toxic ingredients or even 100% organic! (have a quick google about Sodium Laurel Sulphate which is in 90% of products that foam and you will see what we mean).
                             
On our travels in Asia we discovered someone making exactly what we were looking for: 100% natural, chemical-free products containing only natural, plant ingredients with no pesticides or other chemicals involved anywhere in the process. Immediately we knew that we had to make these available to people in the UK-and worldwide!



 
Why should you get involved?
We're looking to raise £5000 (although if we get more that would be brilliant), this will cover the initial order to bring the product into the UK and set up all the business operations. We have planned a large range of other products we'll be launching too which we are very excited to tell you about! So the more we raise the faster we'll be able to bring these to the market and build up the business. 
The perks we've put together ensure you'll be the first in the world to get scrubbing with the Natures Knowledge range of personal care products. We're building a community of like minded people who are passionate health and changing their environments.
                      
If we don't meet our goals we'll still be bringing in these amazing products, we'll just have to beg and borrow... that is how much we believe in them!!
 


The Impact
As you would expect, these personal care products are 100% natural, paraben-free, chemical-free, pesticide-free, naturally hypoallergenic, vegan and completely free from any animal testing. They smell great and are fantasic to use because they are made entirely from plants. Even the ingredient that makes the bubbles is a simple fruit - the soap nut!
 
                                
Not only that, these products are also probiotic and bio-positive which means using them actually improves the environment! This is all down to the Effective Microorganisms ('EM's') which are probiotic good bacteria that basically clean up the harmful bacteria (a bit like that well known yoghurt with added good bacteria). 
                   
Another good thing is that the place where our products are made use absolutely no machinery during the bottling process which means we leave practically no carbon footprint! 
                   
 
If you care about your health and your environment and want to avoid health problems from using harmful chemicals and help prevent their toxic build-up in the environment alongside like-minded people who want to protect and promote healthy people and a healthy ecosystem, Nature's Knowledge products are something we know you will love!


Other ways you can support
If you can't financially support us at this stage but would like to follow the journey here are our platforms you can follow us on...

 Facebook


 Twitter

 Our Blog


Please also share this page with everyone and anyone who you know will enjoy this project!

Thanks for reading
The Nature's Knowledge Team x
 
                           Smell Fresher, Look Better, Feel Revitalised...
                    
With our specially selected blend of exotic plants and herbs, not only will you have a safer wash but you will smell fresher, look better and feel revitalised having our probiotic force field wrapped lovingly around your body. 
 
If you'd like to know more about some of the ingredients...
 
                           Indian Gooseberry 
                           
                                                                                                                      
 This therapeutic herb possesses many medicinal qualities that are good for nourishing and rejuvenating the skin whilst also being soothing for the mind.

Not only is it naturally hypoallergenic and antifungal but its star quality is its bubble making... and lots of them too! Also as it’s not a nut it can be used by anyone whether you have any skin complaints or allergies.

Regular washing with this amazing natural ingredient helps to make your skin incredibly silky whilst giving it a deep and refreshing clean all due to its brilliant antibacterial properties.

story:
Help us meet our stretch goal of $1000! All funds raised beyond our goal will go toward continuing to make our Centering Pregnancy Program a wonderful and positive experience for the many women in our community who participate.

Thanks to Peekabootique and CitiKids for donating to our event day raffle! Check out their products at the below locations:

Peekabootique
1306 Castro St, San Francisco, CA 94114
http://peekabootiquesf.com/

Citikids Baby News
152 Clement St San Francisco, CA 94118
http://www.citikids.com/

 

The Project

Hi! My name is Alicia and I am serving as an AmeriCorps member at Silver Avenue Family Health Center, a public clinic that provides primary care to a multicultural, multilingual, mostly uninsured population of children, adults, and elderly in the Portola neighborhood of San Francisco.

On May 10th we are hosting a Healthy Pregnancy Fair for women in the local community. The fair will provide participants with information about how to have a healthy pregnancy, offer services including pregnancy testing, prenatal vitamins, and blood pressure testing, and highlight the array of services available to pregnant women at Silver Ave Health Center.

Your campaign contribution will bring women the opportunity to have a healthy pregnancy. And healthy pregnancies mean healthy babies!

What We Need & What You Get

We need your contribution to meet our goal of $700. With this money, we will purchase:

  • Pre-natal Vitamins to distribute to attendees
  • Poster board to display educational information about topics such as “Nutrition and Exercise During Pregnancy” and  “The In’s and Out’s of Breastfeeding”
  • Food for attendees to enjoy at the event
  • A banner and copy paper to advertise the event

We really appreciate your contributions. Check out the awesome perks we have for you on the right side of the page!

The Greater Impact

Access to Prenatal care is a major issue in the United States and has been linked to the pervasive health disparities that exist between different racial, ethnic, and socioeconomic groups. According to the National Vital Statistics Reports of 2005, 29.8% of pregnant women in the United States that year did not begin care in their 1st trimester.

Julia Phillipi’s 2009 literature review of studies exploring access to prenatal care in the United States since 1990 reveals a variety of barriers preventing low-income women who are pregnant or plan to be pregnant from entering care. Some of the structural barriers identified include:

  • Transportation to and from the clinic
  • Wait time while at the clinic
  • Cost of services
  • Language capacity of medical providers
  • Cultural sensitivity of the staff

Silver Avenue is located right in the heart of Portola providing convenient access to doctors and nurses as well as prenatal social workers, prenatal nutritionists and an eligibility worker who helps patients to identify and apply for payment reduction opportunities.

Our multilingual staff is trained in Customer Service and provides friendly, thorough, culturally sensitive care to every patient who walks through the door. As a family health center, we offer continuity of care that our patients value. Once the baby arrives, both mother and newborn can continue to be seen by the same doctor and medical assistant at Silver Ave.

One of the highlights of prenatal care at Silver Ave is our Centering Program, a model of supportive group care for women before and after childbirth. Group care increases access for prenatal patients, cuts down on wait time, and provides a forum for parents to network with other parents in the community. Across the nation, Centering has been shown to increase the health and satisfaction of soon-to-be mothers.

In my year of service at Silver Ave, I have been lucky enough to sit-in on some of the Centering Groups. It was so much fun watching the new mothers compare notes about the challenges and joys of childbirth in their first meeting after delivery!

We believe it is never too early to plan a pregnancy. This event will provide people in our community the opportunity to ask questions about how to have a healthy pregnancy and learn the difference between fact and myth. 

With your help we can bring educational information and the valuable services provided at Silver Ave Family Health Center to the attention of more women throughout the community.  

References:

Phillipi, Julia C. (2009). Women’s Perceptions of Access to Prenatal Care in the United States: A Literature Review. Journal of Midwifery and Women’s Health, 54 (3), 219 – 225. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our link with your friends and family! Use the IndieGoGo Share Tools above to post to Twitter, Facebook, and other social networking sites.

We’d love to hear from you! Share your thoughts and suggestions under the comments tab at the top of the page.

Share our link with your friends and family! Use the IndieGoGo Share Tools above to post to Twitter, Facebook, and other social networking sites.
We’d love to hear from you! Share your thoughts and suggestions under the comments tab at the top of the page.

story:
I created this page to post updates, medical definitions, inspirational pictures and sayings. Most of all, I want all to see my amazing three year old who has suffered with something since her emergency C section up until now. All of her doctors are trying to put all of the puzzle pieces that are Kiran and put them together so that Kiran doesn't need to suffer anymore.

As of now she has severe GERD, severe gastroparesis, right eye ptosis (droopy eyelid), astigmatism, extreme fatigue, sweating, all over body soreness, possible neuropathy, lack of appetite, feeding tube, gagging and choking, and FTT.

Kiran's genetic and mitochondrial tests came back negative, so we still have no answers. Her G tube was recently changed to a G/J to bypass her failing stomach. But so far that isn't working and her J tube is backing up into her stomach and is causing her much gagging and nausea and we've had to lower the rate of her pump. Now she is 100% dependent on her tube and gags when food is placed in front of her.

We are now getting her records together to get her an appointment at Cincinnati Children's Hospital to see if they can help her. We just want her to have a fairly normal life. She is 3 years old and takes three hour naps and is still tired most days. She has been through more than an adult would ever understand, but she has made me STRONG! She is a miracle being born 10 weeks early at 2 pounds, 7 ounces and spending 130 days in the NICU.

Kiran right now has a G/J tube to bypass her nonworking stomach, but that isn't working and she is having back up into her stomach and is nauseous all day long and is on continuous pump feeds. We need to get her to Cincinnati as soon as possible with the holes that they can figure out why her gastroparesis is so severe and can figure out a better treatment plan, so that her GI in Miami will know how to treat her better. Right now no treatment or medications are working, except for reflux medications thank goodness.

The funds that you pledge will go directly into a fund for Kiran to cover all of her medical expenses that the insurance does not cover. 

Those expenses include driving back and forth to Miami for appointments and procedures-gas/food (over an hour formulas specialized elemental formula since her body cannot digest anything else, Duocal (calorie/fat powder), airfare to get Lisa and Kiran to Cincinnati, domperidone(motility med out of country), and co pays for office visits  and medications, and testing, for Kiran only.

If you cannot help us out, it is more than ok, these are tough times for everyone. What you can do to help, is to share this link on your Facebook page or in your emails to friends to help us get to our goal. 

Thank you.

story:
The holidays are a time for many of us to reflect and to give thanks for our many blessings.

In August 2012 my Uncle Tommy was diagnosed with Stage 4 Squamous Cancer. He is terminal.

His family needs your help. He has been unable to work during his illness and he has been unable to provide for my Aunt Doreen and my cousins, Angelo and Tommy Jr. My aunt and uncle are kind, responsible, loving parents who after having raised four children already— they adopted their young grandchildren in 2006 and have been raising them ever since. Tommy Jr. is 8 and Angelo is 5 years old and has asthma. My uncle sold his car for money, and because they live outside of the school zone, the school bus won’t pick up the boys. So my aunt walks them 2 miles there and 2 miles back.

They are set to be evicted from their home November 30thunless they pay BLAH in back rent. He has entered outpatient hospice and wants to spend every moment with his family. My uncle is in tremendous pain, he is bedridden, and beyond stressed about the family’s future. He owned his own business and was such a hard worker, but he never started a life insurance policy.

The money will help Uncle Tommy house his family and fund future uncertain illness related costs.

I realize that this is a lot to ask, however, the situation is quite desperate. I hope you will grasp the severity of my Uncle’s situation and show compassion through your generosity. Any amount will help.

Wishing you and your family all the best this holiday season.

story:
Untitled Document
WE BELIEVE people should be happy and fulfilled at work, where they spend so many waking hours.
WE BELIEVE that most organizations care about their employees and want them to thrive.
WE BELIEVE organizations function better when the people within them are flourishing.
WE BELIEVE our economy will improve and our lives will improve when more people and organizations are thriving.

--Cara Fairbanks, Founder & CEO of WhiteWater Wellness LLC


WHITEWATERWELLNESS

I am a Wellness and Human Resources Consultant in Anchorage, Alaska. My husband calls me a wellness nut. I’m also a mom, travel enthusiast, cyclist, aspiring triathlete, entrepreneur and self-described economics geek. I’ve been customizing and shopping wellness programs for businesses for the past 10 years and while there are some good programs out there, I have yet to find one that is comprehensive, affordable, effective, engaging, AND accessible to businesses or groups of any size (as well as accessible to any person, regardless of ability). So I thought: if I can’t find it, I’ll just build it. We need a comprehensive, affordable, effective, engaging, and accessible workplace wellness solution in Alaska (and everywhere else too!).

YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS WILL HELP MAKE THIS CONCEPT A REALITY.

As a life-long Alaskan, I am basing WhiteWater Wellness here in Alaska, the most beautiful place on earth. I initially want to build and perfect this program here, because very few wellness vendors even want to bother with our market and because Alaskan businesses and their employees have some unique challenges and opportunities when it comes to health and well-being. If we can make this successful here in AK, then we can expand anywhere.



What is wellness or well-being?

Let’s face it, “wellness” has become a buzz word and it has been defined many ways. I’m ignoring the buzz, and using the definition backed by hardcore research done by the Gallup Organization (outlined in the book “Well-Being: The Five Essential Elements” by Tom Rath and James Harter). They went all over the world to find the common elements of well-being regardless of ethnicity, socioeconomic status, gender, age, country of origin, religions, etc. This is what they found: Having high well-being is the difference between a life spent thriving and one spent suffering. It is having a balance between the following elements:

Why wellness at work?

2080 is a LOT of hours in a year: It’s where most people spend the majority of their time – if you are disengaged at work, the other areas of your life suffer too.


What will the program do?
How will I be able to use it?

  • Activity & Health Tracking - If you want to change something, you first need to measure it!
    • Track any health or activity data you want
    • Integrate data from apps or devices
    • Health fair biometrics automatically uploaded (through Alaska Health Fair)
    • Have a group competition or challenge individuals
    • Compete against another company
  • Goal Setting - Set goals that matter to YOU
    • Share with others and collaborate with others on shared or similar goals
  • Community Connector - Connects community resources with organizations & individuals
    • Search for active events in your local community
    • 5ks and other runs, charity walks, marathons, workshops, bike rides, etc.
    • Local speakers bureau (searchable by region/city)
    • Discounts with local wellness-related vendors
  • Well-Connected - Build more meaningful relationships within your organization
    • Learn new skills (i.e. cooking, skiing, accounting, etc)
    • Find a mentor or a coach within your "community" (company)
    • Teach or share skills (pay it forward)
    • Find support (i.e. disease management, shared goals, etc)
  • Get Motivated - Watch and join a shift in your organizational culture
    • Earn incentives for your activity and engagement in the program
    • Get feedback on what the “crowd” is doing – you’re not alone!
    • Connect with and learn from those you spend most of your time with!

Features

  • Integrated modules
  • Points earned in all areas of program
  • Customizable incentives
  • Robust reporting & minimal administration
  • Affordable - pricing will be between $3 and $12 PEPM (per employee per month)
  • Incorporates principals of behavioral economics
  • Incorporates social networking and gaming
  • Program molds to fit the user versus forcing the user to change to fit the program
  • Independent of insurance carrier
  • Portable – take your profile and data with you if you change employers

Support

The experts at WhiteWater Wellness will help clients customize incentives based on their needs, their culture, and current wellness-related regulations.
  • Workplace culture audits – actual measurement of your culture so you can create intentional change
  • Program implementation and ongoing support – in your time zone.
  • Partners like Alaska Health Fair will make it possible to integrate data from traditional onsite health fair services.


WHY THE NAME WHITEWATER?


Whitewater is unpredictable…it can be exciting and exhilarating to ride…or it can be daunting and scary…there are many paths through a body of whitewater and many ways to ride it…it’s constantly changing with new obstacles popping up or floating away…it’s a different experience for everyone…it’s a lot less scary, more fun, and safer when you have a guide, and when you’re with trusted companions. Some never attempt the ride…others keep at it, doing it again and again, enjoying the thrill of the ride, as well as the sense of accomplishment afterward. The same can be said of the path toward optimum health and well-being…our goal is to be your guide and help connect you with some trusted companions along the way.

WHO IS WHITEWATER WELLNESS?


WhiteWater Wellness LLC is the startup company we have established to create and sell this groundbreaking program to companies, groups, and communities.

CEO: Cara Fox Fairbanks, SPHR, CWPM (Senior Professional of Human Resources and Certified Wellness Program Manager)
Cara is a Human Resources and Worksite Wellness Consultant and has spent the past five years helping clients customize or shop wellness solutions for their businesses. Three and a half years of that time was spent with a local benefits broker, Northrim Benefits Group, and prior to that, Cara was the Director of HR and Administration for Hawaiian Vacations where she not only built much of her HR and business experience, but also where she began dabbling in worksite wellness initiatives. She is a lifelong, well-traveled Alaskan who has a passion for healthy, adventurous living and helping others.

Co-Founder & CTO: Shane Spencer
Shane R. Spencer is a Technology Developer based out of Eagle River, Alaska. He is a developer for and advocate of Free and Open Source Software (FOSS) solutions. Shane currently specializes in asynchronous web frameworks like Python/Tornado and Node.js and a myriad of HTML/CSS templating and Javascript front-end libraries. A wealth of research and development goes in to using and promoting high speed database solutions like MongoDB and Redis which complements and helps tune a long history of using traditional relational SQL solutions. He is a contributor to several open source solutions and often writes articles on database development techniques and I.T. security concerns.

WHAT WE NEED

Software development is expensive, but having Shane on board will help cut those costs. However, both Shane and Cara are self-employed consultants and so, without funding, we have to balance building this program with doing paid work for clients. Here’s a look at what we’ll use the money for:

✓ Software Development - Shane’s time spent on programming, content development, design, etc. This is where we’ll have to skimp if we don’t meet our goals and where we can make great strides if we surpass our goal.

✓ Contracting - with several individual software developers and designers as well as subject-matter experts to help with components and content where we need outside expertise.

✓ Legal fees - making sure the program is HIPAA compliant and that we have our bases covered in privacy, copyright, and any other legal hurdles that may arise.

✓ Marketing - This is a huge component because we have to have a way to tell people about this program and to bring it to brokers, employers and other groups who are interested.



WHAT YOU GET

NEW PERKS ADDED!!! - We are holding a seminar on Designing Wellness Incentives on Tuesday, November 5, 2013. For $35, reserve a spot at the live presentation to be held at the Loussac Library from 9:30 to 11:30....OR for $29, watch it via web streaming! (If we run into technical difficulties, the webinar version may be rescheduled).


Philips Innovation Competition – HELP US WIN!!!

We are competing in the Philips Next Big Thing Innovation Fellows competition (http://www.newscenter.philips.com/us_en/standar...) and we want to win! We need at least 100 supporters and to reach at least 50% of our fundraising goal to be considered for one of the 5 finalist slots. One winner will get an additional $60K contributed to their campaign by Philips and be brought to Philips headquarters to meet with their innovation experts to help bring the idea to life. Four runners-up will each receive $10K from Philips toward their campaign. Winning this competition (or even being one of the finalists) will help to make WhiteWater Wellness a reality even sooner and open the door to valuable resources we wouldn’t have access to otherwise.

What if we don’t reach our goal??

We are committed to making this program a reality and this company successful. If we don’t reach our goal, we will still make it happen; it will simply take longer and be more challenging. I’ve never been one to shy away from a challenge, but I also believe in working smarter and not harder, which is one of the primary reasons I want to build this program in the first place.

The Business Side of Things

I recently heard someone say that innovation will get us nowhere unless successful business models are put in place to bring those innovations to market. WhiteWater Wellness has both the innovative idea AND a great business model. Contact me if you want to know more about this.

Details and Expected Delivery of Perks
Site testers – March 2014 is a rough estimate of when we’ll start to need testers on board
Option to purchase discounted subscriptions and/or use vouchers – September 2014
Stickers, hats and t-shirts – January 2014. (Shipping of stickers, hats and t-shirts will be to US addresses only, unless you are willing to add on an additional amount for shipping.)
Site testers in all levels of perks get to keep their profiles indefinitely; however, access to full functionality of the site will only be available under a group or company subscription.
Discounts will be good for one year from the time of redemption, but will not have an expiration date; they are fully transferable prior to redemption. These discount certificates have no cash value.
Vouchers are fully transferable and have no expiration date, but have no cash value.

All services offered are not guaranteed and may be substituted with comparative consulting services if program development is not completed.
story_txt:
Untitled Document
WE BELIEVE people should be happy and fulfilled at work, where they spend so many waking hours.

WE BELIEVE that most organizations care about their employees and want them to thrive.

WE BELIEVE organizations function better when the people within them are flourishing.

WE BELIEVE our economy will improve and our lives will improve when more people and organizations are thriving.
--Cara Fairbanks, Founder & CEO of WhiteWater Wellness LLC



WHITEWATERWELLNESS

I am a Wellness and Human Resources Consultant in Anchorage, Alaska.  My husband calls me a wellness nut.  I’m also a mom, travel enthusiast, cyclist, aspiring triathlete, entrepreneur and self-described economics geek.  I’ve been customizing and shopping wellness programs for businesses for the past 10 years and while there are some good programs out there, I have yet to find one that is comprehensive, affordable, effective, engaging, AND accessible to businesses or groups of any size (as well as accessible to any person, regardless of ability).

So I thought: if I can’t find it, I’ll just build it.
We need a comprehensive, affordable, effective, engaging, and accessible workplace wellness solution in Alaska (and everywhere else too!).
YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS WILL HELP MAKE THIS CONCEPT A REALITY.

As a life-long Alaskan, I am basing WhiteWater Wellness here in Alaska, the most beautiful place on earth. I initially want to build and perfect this program here, because very few wellness vendors even want to bother with our market and because Alaskan businesses and their employees have some unique challenges and opportunities when it comes to health and well-being. If we can make this successful here in AK, then we can expand anywhere.
What is wellness or well-being?
Let’s face it, “wellness” has become a buzz word and it has been defined many ways. I’m ignoring the buzz, and using the definition backed by hardcore research done by the Gallup Organization (outlined in the book “Well-Being: The Five Essential Elements” by Tom Rath and James Harter). They went all over the world to find the common elements of well-being regardless of ethnicity, socioeconomic status, gender, age, country of origin, religions, etc. This is what they found:


Having high well-being is the difference between a life spent thriving and one spent suffering. It is having a balance between the following elements:

Why wellness at work?
2080 is a LOT of hours in a year: It’s where most people spend the majority of their time – if you are disengaged at work, the other areas of your life suffer too.

What will the program do? How will I be able to use it? 


Activity & Health Tracking - If you want to change something, you first need to measure it!

Track any health or activity data you want
Integrate data from apps or devices
Health fair biometrics automatically uploaded (through Alaska Health Fair)
Have a group competition or challenge individuals
Compete against another company


Goal Setting - Set goals that matter to YOU

Share with others and collaborate with others on shared or similar goals


Community Connector - Connects community resources with organizations & individuals

Search for active events in your local community
5ks and other runs, charity walks, marathons, workshops, bike rides, etc.
Local speakers bureau (searchable by region/city)
Discounts with local wellness-related vendors


Well-Connected - Build more meaningful relationships within your organization

Learn new skills (i.e. cooking, skiing, accounting, etc)
Find a mentor or a coach within your "community" (company)

Teach or share skills (pay it forward)
Find support (i.e. disease management, shared goals, etc)


Get Motivated - Watch and join a shift in your organizational culture

Earn incentives for your activity and engagement in the program
Get feedback on what the “crowd” is doing – you’re not alone!
Connect with and learn from those you spend most of your time with!


Features

Integrated modules
Points earned in all areas of program
Customizable incentives
Robust reporting & minimal administration

Affordable - pricing will be between $3 and $12 PEPM (per employee per month)
Incorporates principals of behavioral economics
Incorporates social networking and gaming
Program molds to fit the user versus forcing the user to change to fit the program
Independent of insurance carrier
Portable – take your profile and data with you if you change employers

Support
The experts at WhiteWater Wellness will help clients customize incentives based on their needs, their culture, and current wellness-related regulations.


Workplace culture audits – actual measurement of your culture so you can create intentional change

Program implementation and ongoing support – in your time zone.
Partners like Alaska Health Fair will make it possible to integrate data from traditional onsite health fair services.



WHY THE NAME WHITEWATER?
Whitewater is unpredictable…it can be exciting and exhilarating to ride…or it can be daunting and scary…there are many paths through a body of whitewater and many ways to ride it…it’s constantly changing with new obstacles popping up or floating away…it’s a different experience for everyone…it’s a lot less scary, more fun, and safer when you have a guide, and when you’re with trusted companions. Some never attempt the ride…others keep at it, doing it again and again, enjoying the thrill of the ride, as well as the sense of accomplishment afterward.
The same can be said of the path toward optimum health and well-being…our goal is to be your guide and help connect you with some trusted companions along the way.WHO IS WHITEWATER WELLNESS?
WhiteWater Wellness LLC is the startup company we have established to create and sell this groundbreaking program to companies, groups, and communities. 
CEO: Cara Fox Fairbanks, SPHR, CWPM (Senior Professional of Human Resources and Certified Wellness Program Manager)

Cara is a Human Resources and Worksite Wellness Consultant and has spent the past five years helping clients customize or shop wellness solutions for their businesses. Three and a half years of that time was spent with a local benefits broker, Northrim Benefits Group, and prior to that, Cara was the Director of HR and Administration for Hawaiian Vacations where she not only built much of her HR and business experience, but also where she began dabbling in worksite wellness initiatives. She is a lifelong, well-traveled Alaskan who has a passion for healthy, adventurous living and helping others. 
Co-Founder & CTO: Shane Spencer

Shane R. Spencer is a Technology Developer based out of Eagle River, Alaska.  He is a developer for and advocate of Free and Open Source Software (FOSS) solutions.  Shane currently specializes in asynchronous web frameworks like Python/Tornado and Node.js and a myriad of HTML/CSS templating and Javascript front-end libraries.  A wealth of research and development goes in to using and promoting high speed database solutions like MongoDB and Redis which complements and helps tune a long history of using traditional relational SQL solutions.  He is a contributor to several open source solutions and often writes articles on database development techniques and I.T. security concerns. 

WHAT WE NEED
Software development is expensive, but having Shane on board will help cut those costs. However, both Shane and Cara are self-employed consultants and so, without funding, we have to balance building this program with doing paid work for clients. Here’s a look at what we’ll use the money for:


✓ Software Development -  Shane’s time spent on programming, content development, design, etc. This is where we’ll have to skimp if we don’t meet our goals and where we can make great strides if we surpass our goal.

✓ Contracting -  with several individual software developers and designers as well as subject-matter experts to help with components and content where we need outside expertise.
  

✓ Legal fees - making sure the program is HIPAA compliant and that we have our bases covered in privacy, copyright, and any other legal hurdles that may arise.  
✓ Marketing -  This is a huge component because we have to have a way to tell people about this program and to bring it to brokers, employers and other groups who are interested.



WHAT YOU GET
NEW PERKS ADDED!!! - We are holding a seminar on Designing Wellness Incentives on Tuesday, November 5, 2013. For $35, reserve a spot at the live presentation to be held at the Loussac Library from 9:30 to 11:30....OR for $29, watch it via web streaming! (If we run into technical difficulties, the webinar version may be rescheduled).



Philips Innovation Competition – HELP US WIN!!!
We are competing in the Philips Next Big Thing Innovation Fellows competition (http://www.newscenter.philips.com/us_en/standar...) and we want to win! We need at least 100 supporters and to reach at least 50% of our fundraising goal to be considered for one of the 5 finalist slots. One winner will get an additional $60K contributed to their campaign by Philips and be brought to Philips headquarters to meet with their innovation experts to help bring the idea to life. Four runners-up will each receive $10K from Philips toward their campaign.

Winning this competition (or even being one of the finalists) will help to make WhiteWater Wellness a reality even sooner and open the door to valuable resources we wouldn’t have access to otherwise.

What if we don’t reach our goal??
We are committed to making this program a reality and this company successful. If we don’t reach our goal, we will still make it happen; it will simply take longer and be more challenging. I’ve never been one to shy away from a challenge, but I also believe in working smarter and not harder, which is one of the primary reasons I want to build this program in the first place.
The Business Side of Things
I recently heard someone say that innovation will get us nowhere unless successful business models are put in place to bring those innovations to market. WhiteWater Wellness has both the innovative idea AND a great business model. Contact me if you want to know more about this.



Details and Expected Delivery of Perks

Site testers – March 2014 is a rough estimate of when we’ll start to need testers on board 

Option to purchase discounted subscriptions and/or use vouchers  – September 2014

Stickers, hats and t-shirts – January 2014. (Shipping of stickers, hats and t-shirts will be to US addresses only, unless you are willing to add on an additional amount for shipping.)
Site testers in all levels of perks get to keep their profiles indefinitely; however, access to full functionality of the site will only be available under a group or company subscription.
Discounts will be good for one year from the time of redemption, but will not have an expiration date; they are fully transferable prior to redemption. These discount certificates have no cash value.
Vouchers are fully transferable and have no expiration date, but have no cash value.All services offered are not guaranteed and may be substituted with comparative consulting services if program development is not completed.

story:
As many of you know, my Mom, Colleen Marie Nugent, passed away January 13, 2013. She passed peacefully and comfortably while surrounded by myself, her sisters and her mom after a long and difficult battle against Leukemia. Now that she is no longer in pain and is resting comfortably with God, we are going to celebrate her life with a funeral and ceremony matching her beauty.

The costs associated with Leukemia have taken their toll emotionally and monetarily. My brother and I are reaching out to friends and family in the hopes of easing the financial costs as much as possible. Mom touched many people and we were all blessed to have her light in our lives. Please help us in sending her to her final resting place. 

Any contribution is greatly appreciated.

Thank you and god bless,

Andrea

story:
Good baklava is hard to find.  ***It is Authentic, Handmade, Natural and NO Preservatives!***  My business was founded out of a joy and a need to make and sell good baklava.  I began baking baklava over twelve years ago helping out at my Church's Annual Greek Food Festival.  Occassionally, I would make baklava myself to take to a potluck or at Christmas which was thoroughly enjoyed.  Family and friends began to expect it.  It was suggested by friends that I start a business.  After much contemplation, I decided to form a business and Baklava Unlimited was born in 2012.  There is one employee.  Along my journey of building my business, I have found that many who love good baklava can not have it due to different dietary restrictions such as gluten or dairy allergies.  Also, am looking at a "reduced sugar" or "no sugar added" for people who are diabetic, trying to loose weight or not gain weight.  So, I am doing Research and Development to meet those dietary restrictions which costs money so that they too can enjoy my good baklava.  In order to showcase my baklava to the masses, I need to be able to do large popular Events that can be expensive.  My ultimate goals are to get into big stores such as Vitamin Cottage, Whole Foods and Starbucks!

 

  • $1500 premium plan for Buyer's Best Friend which is a site you join that hooks you up with retailers such as Whole Foods and other big stores.  You produce the product and they hook you up with buyers.
  • There are some large events or trade shows throughout the year in Denver at the Denver Merchandise Mart which give Vendors huge exposure.  They run 2 and 3 days costing up to $1500.
  • A popular Event for Food Producers is Fancy Food Show in San Francisco.  It costs a few hundred to attend, flight and Hotel arrangements will cost a total of $1000+
  • Longmont which is a big attraction for Events because of it's fairgrounds which is one of the largest and oldest in the State of Colorado.  There are Events throughout the year, some running 2-3 days costing in the $100's.
  • As I come out with different varieties of baklava, I will need to spend money on packaging.

 

I would be greatly appreciative if you would please help me out and make a donation to my business.  In return, you can try my product.

 

Thank you so much,

Janet Heath

Owner/President

Baklava Unlimited LLC

story:
Short Summary

Simply said, we are a group of women trying to help our friend who is desperately trying to help her beloved sister.  

Cindy Danner, friend to many and sister of Barbara Warner, has had a rough time this past year.  Most significantly, she just spent 7 long weeks in the hospital, after many, many weeks of previous hospitalizations.  Cindy has brittle juvenile diabetes, complicated by a rare disorder, gastroparesis, that had been in remission for five years, but has come back with a vengeance.  She is suffering from malnutrition, associated pain, is weak, frail, and alarmingly thin (she weighs just 93 pounds).

Adding insult to injury... Cindy, a smart, educated, married 56 years old, (she holds a BA and an MSW degree), is unable to work, has gone through her savings, and is experiencing mounting medical debt.  She and her husband (who is also disabled) are facing the unthinkable…losing their home.   

What We Need & What You Get

We are supposed to tell you how much funding we need.  When you are down to nothing, seriously ill, and prospects looking bleak, ANYTHING will help.  Medications are dreadfully expensive, nourishment costly, and outside assistance simply out of the question.  

Our goal is simple.  We want to raise at least $5000 for Cindy, which will give her a significant leg-up.  

Here is where we are supposed to tell you "what you get" if you give.  Besides knowing that you are helping a woman through the toughest time of her life, you'll get a heartfelt thank you letter from Cindy herself, along with a picture.  

Oh, and if we don't actually reach our goal, we'll still give everything raised ~ all of it ~ to Cindy.  For which she will be ecstatic, releived, and grateful.

The Impact

If you can, imagine how it feels to never have had to ask for help. To always have paid your bills, your taxes, your dues.  To always have held a good, respected job fulfilling your ambitions.  And to have always enjoyed good health.  

Then imagine it all gone.  All of it.  

The impact of your donation won't move the earth.  But it will move your heart.  It will help a stranger who doesn't deserve the bad hand she's been dealt.  It will give her the mental boost to continue to push forward.  One foot in front of the other.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If this is just something you cannot contribute to at this time, please remember Cindy in your prayers.  And send us good vibrations as we move forward in our quest to help her.

story:
Short Summary

Hi- my name is Stu Douglass.  I am an inventor and the founder of Roller Clutch Tools. I put my self through college by rebuilding motors for friends and class mates.  My favorite tool was the ratchet wrench because it was easy to use and faster than a box wrench.  One day I mashed my knuckles into the engine block when the ratchet gear suddenly stripped.  I decided then and there that the ratchet design was in need of a serious overhaul.

My team at Roller Clutch has worked long and hard to design and patent a reversible roller clutch. This makes the perfect replacement for the old ratchet. Our tools use rollers rather than gears as rollers are stronger and safer. They are also more efficient and function with a zero back throw.  This is really important when working in tight spaces.

The NRG3 is the only roller clutch ratchet that can withstand off-axis loading.  Several inventors have tried to build a reversible roller clutch but all have failed until now.  Our local Snap-on dealer has said "this is the nicest gearless ratchet he has ever seen".

Our team is reaching out to the Indiegogo crowd to help launch the NRG3.  We have spent a considerable amount of money on the engineering, prototyping and testing of this unique tool.  Now we need your help to build and distribute this worldwide.  Your contributions will make launching this product possible.


What We Need & What You Get

A tool of this kind requires a different vendor or supplier for each of the components. Some of the parts such as the rollers and snap rings are readily available off the shelf. Others such as the cage and spindle are unique to the design and require special machining.  When that is the case, each part needs a mold or die made to allow mass production.  

The $35K funding will be used to pay for the tooling and assembly of the NRG3.  In the event we raise less than this amount we are prepared to sell equity in our company to ensure that we have adequate funds to complete our first orders.  

The perks we are offering include the 1/4" and the 3/8" socket wrenches.  The handles for the 3/8" model are 3D printed per our video. You will be the first worldwide to feel the benefits of this unique tool.


The Impact

Our team has been involved with the design and distribution of several commercial products. We understand the process and the amount of hard work required to launch the NRG3. We have collaborated together for over 5 years in order to design and test the perfect roller clutch ratchet.  

The members on our team include:

Stu Douglass- inventor and company founder

Steve Adelman- inventor and engineer

Dan Adams- inventor and engineer

Andrew Butler- inventor and engineer

Brook Drumm- 3D printing specialist 

Scott McGowan- marketing specialist for AM

John Maxey- attorney and CPA

The NRG3 will enable our contributors to assemble all types of projects such as engines, RC planes, 3D printer kits, robots, bicycles etc; in a manner which is safer and more efficient.  This is the first major improvement for socket wrenches and will have a beneficial impact on all of us that use tools worldwide.

As Steve Jobs once said "Humans are basically tool builders".  Our team believes the time has come to take tools to the next level.



Join Our Referral Contest:

Refer 2 Friends-get a free Tee

Refer 5 Friends-get a free 1/4" Ratchet

Refer 7 Friends-get a free 3/8" Ratchet

Winner-gets a free Combo Kit


Other Ways You Can Help

Now is the time to get the word out about the NRG3.  This product is a perfect blend of hand tool and 3D printer technologies.  Whether you are a gear head or a maker we want all of you to have one of these.

And be sure to spread the word with the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
After suffering for months with a severe headache and blurred vision an MRI revealed that Charlie had a large brain tumor in a very dangerous location in his head. He was rushed to Ottawa and December 13, 1 week after the birth of his son, Charlie had his first surgery to remove part of a rare tumor called Chondrosarcoma. This is an extremely rare bone tumor. It is at the base of the skull and in his cavernous sinus. January 13th he had his 2nd surgery to remove any remaining tumor that may grow back. There is only one treatment to arrest the growth of the tumor and we do not have it in Canada. OHIP has denied funding for it. May 13th Charlie went through a very dangerous 18 hour brain surgery to remove the boney part of the tumor at the base of his skull. He has a long recovery. Due to the complex location of the tumor it has affected his speech and his movement on his right side of his body. He will require physiotherapy and it is unsure whether these basic functions will ever be the same. Charlie needs to travel to Boston and receive Proton Beam Radiation Therapy at Francis Burr Proton Therapy Center. The cost of this treatment is upwards of $300,000 and we have started trying to raise these funds so he can have this treatment.

I have know Charlie for several years. We met through mutual friends through organized sports. He and his wife are very nice people. This has come as a shock to everyone and we are all grasping at straws to try and raise these funds. Charlie has always prided himself on his athletic ability. He once competed at the Canadian Olympic trials in long jump and he is very involved in competitive baseball. His wife is a very strong woman but having Charlie by her side makes her stronger. They have a beautiful baby boy who has not had the opportunity to learn what his daddy is all about.
Please, let's do what we can to send Charlie to Boston!

Thank you from the bottom of my heart.

The cost of this treatment is upwards of $300,000 and we have started trying to raise these funds so he can have this treatment.I have know Charlie for several years. We met through mutual friends through organized sports. He and his wife are very nice people. This has come as a shock to everyone and we are all grasping at straws to try and raise these funds. Charlie has always prided himself on his athletic ability. He once competed at the Canadian Olympic trials in long jump and he is very involved in competitive baseball. His wife is a very strong woman but having Charlie by her side makes her stronger. They have a beautiful baby boy who has not had the opportunity to learn what his daddy is all about.Please, let's do what we can to send Charlie to Boston!Thank you from the bottom of my heart.

story:
What is “The Yoganda Project”? Yoga + Uganda = Yoganda

Hi! I'm Theresa (Taozi/桃子) a yoga teacher, world explorer, and founder of Taozi Tree Yoga. This summer I am taking a professional tailor (secretly an angel) named Kathy Pitzer to spend 4 weeks teaching a group of 5-10 currently un-employed widowed women the skills to sew the world’s best yoga mat bag… the "Yoganda" bag, as well as other yoga related products.  

About the "Yoganda" bag: 

Why is this bag so special? It is big, and colorful and QUALITY. I have been practicing yoga for nearly a decade and have gone through dozens of bags for my mat. This design is brilliant. It can hold a computer, a water bottle, a cell phone, car keys, a block, whatever! In fact, it is not exclusive to yogis. I think the bag is so functional that everyone will want one! And what makes them even better is the hands that will make them and the impact its purchase will have. 

After "The Yoganda Project" is over Taozi Tree Yoga will permanently employ them all, changing their lives forever. The women and their children will no longer need to live off the scraps of others, but instead they will be able to support themselves with dignity while working in a healthy, growing community. After the bags are made, significant proceeds from each sale will go back to similar widowed women's projects (under the ongoing supervision and direction of the Musana Community Development Organization), teaching more un-employed widowed women wholesome skills to sustain themselves.

This project is destined to have huge impacts in the lives of the widowed women participating, future women in the area, as well as all the yogis abroad who become a part of the project by utilizing on a daily basis one of the amazing bags.

How you can help “The Yoganda Project”?

 $15,000 USD!!! This is how much we will need to raise to support the trip. Any amount you are able to contribute will go a long way in helping us.  Here is a breakdown of what we will be purchasing:

 -5-10 quality electric sewing machines (purchased in Uganda to support the local economy)

- materials like fabric, needles, and scissors

- flights for the team members going

3 EASY THINGS THAT YOU CAN DO TO SUPPORT US!

1) DONATE to the project financially here on Indiegogo and receive perks (gifts) in return for your donation.

Alternatively, if you would like to make a large donation that is tax deductible you can do it on Musana's website www.musana.org (see "Special Instructions" on its website and confirm that your donation is for "The Yoganda Project"). Please note that as you will benefit from Musana's 501-(c)(3) charitable tax status you will not be eligible for any of the perks offered through Indiegogo, but we will still send you a special "thank you card" (every dollar helps).

PERKS! 

By donating on Indiegogo we are able to offer you some truly remarkable perks:

$15 = a beautiful photo thank you card

$30 = a hand made beaded necklace (from a similar widowed womens project) +a beautiful photo thank you card

$100 = The "Yoganda" bag + a hand made beaded necklace (from a similar widowed omens project) + a beautiful photo thank you card

$500 = You become an official "The Yoganda Project" sponsor and will receive a certificate + the "Yoganda" bag + a hand made beaded necklace (made by widowed women from another 'crafts' project run by Musana) + a beautiful photo thank you card

$1,000 = Credit in a documentary being filmed on site by Gyangiri, a Chinese yogi and movie maker +  you become an official "The Yoganda Project" sponsor and will receive a certificate + the "Yoganda" bag + a hand made beaded necklace (made by widowed women from another 'crafts' project run by Musana) + a beautiful photo thank you card

The Yoganda Impact

This project will literally change the lives of the small group of widowed women who participate. Having been overlooked and neglected, this project will give them dignity by providing them skills and future employment. At the same time, they will be providing a service to yogis around the world by making a an awesome yoga mat bag. The project is special and the bag is special. You have to be a part of it!  

Other Ways You Can Help

We know you may not be able to donate right now, and that's ok! There are 2 other things you can do that would really help us out! 

2) SHARE the project with your friends and family via e-mail or social media sites; Facebook, Twitter, Instagram… etc. Use the share tools Indiegogo provides! Get the word out there!!

3) GET CREATIVE - for example as a yoga teacher you could hold a donation based yoga class, or if you like to bake, hold a good old fashioned bake sale. 

The options are endless…

We hope you can support this worthy project!!

story:
The picture above is his cancer growth from when he had to stop taking the oils.   (Start is top left and continues counter clockwise)


My name is Shane Koopmans and I am creating this fundraiser to help out a very ill Iowan.  His name is Benton Mackenzie and he has Angisarcoma Cancer.  It is rare and aggressive.  Iowa government will not allow him to treat himself.  If they are unwilling to help then I think the citizens of Iowa and the U.S.A. should stand up and help someone in need and that is what I am doing.  Below is a copy and pasted description of himself and his story from another site.  I want to use it because only he truly knows whats going on and what he has to go through. 

 

(Benton Mackenzies own words below)

My name is Benton Mackenzie. I have angiosarcoma cancer. People with this cancer that don't get treatment can apparently expect to die within two years. The average for those that do get treatment is three years, according to the head of oncology at University of Iowa Hospital. I have a synthetic aortic valve and cardiovascular disease that complicate any traditional treatments for a blood vessel cancer to the point that they would be fatal, much sooner than two years. I've been living with angiosarcoma for over six years. I have already found that a cannabis oil with a 1:1 ratio of THC to CBD has shown it can shrink and remove my tumors. The first one that appeared got the size of a golf ball and cut off my sciatic nerve to the point I could not push on the gas or brake pedal to drive and after a week of cannabis oil application I could drive again. Within two months it was just a pink spot! Many other strains of cannabis oil can slow and stop the growth and spread of my angiosarcoma tumors as well, thus, extending my life and vastly improving the quality of what life I have left. 
I've seen dramatic improvements in my overall health, my heart and lungs through juicing fresh cannabis plants. This brings many benficial and medicinal properties that are not achievable through drying and smoking including, if not heated, live enzymes and no psychoactive properties. Even in concentrated forms of oil if not heated possess no psychoactive effects which can be beneficial for a range of ages and conditions. This requires from thirty to fifty plants that will only flower for a fraction of the time for traditional harvesting of buds for oil and inhaling. 
I'm currently fighting Scott County, Iowa with the Neccessity Defense clause, since myself, my wife, my son and my best friend were arrested in June of this year because I grew my medicine. Even my parents were charged and all of us are awaiting trial. These sheriff's deputies knew I had cancer because we went through this three years ago with them. They keep on taking my family to jail because they won't abandon me in my time of need.
I have a right given to me by my Creator and recognized by the Constitution of these United States to the right to my life, my liberty and my pursuit of happiness/ownership of property. As things stand now, I need to get moved to California, as it's the only state currently offering a realistic alternative to death for me, and a doctor there confirms and will prescribe what I have found to be effective already. I am on Social Security Disability for about a thousand dollars a month, so paying for medicine is going to be a very difficult as well. Some of the legal expenses include finding a good attorney to help me seek damages.
I would appreciate that if you give, do so only if divinely inspired and don't even let the left hand know that the right hand is giving. If you're in a situation that the left hand may come looking for it, then it's not appropriate for the right hand to give. For God provides to those who give, enough to give and enough left over for themselves. If the giver is left with nothing themselves, then it wasn't given by God to give. 

Thank you for taking the time to listen to my story. 

-Benton Mackenzie


Below is a link to a facebook group started by others who are trying to help.  Please visit and like this page for support and to find out more about the story.  
https://www.facebook.com/FreeBenton

Articles about his case and health below:
http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2014/07/08/benton-mackenzie-testimony_n_5568275.html
http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2014/07/09/benton-mackenzie-guilty_n_5572445.html
http://www.desmoinesregister.com/story/news/crime-and-courts/2014/07/09/dying-iowan-facing-prison-after-drug-conviction/12416687/

ALL DONATIONS GO THE BENTON MACKENZIE AND HIS FAMILY EVEN IF WE DO NOT REACH OUR GOAL!!  ALL MONEY WILL BE WIRE TRANSFERRED PER AGREEMENT WITH THE MACKENZIES!  

If you can not help at this time then that is OK.  I just ask that you share this with your friends and family and share it on all of your social networks so we can get as much money as possible to someone trying to save his own life.  

Please if you have any questions or concerns please contact me at freebentonmackenziefundraiser@gmail.com

story:
Who We Are

Meet Finton and Charity Loveless. They are a nontraditional family. Charity is Finton’s aunt and legal guardian. She is an elementary librarian at Shenandoah Elementary and has been raising Finton since December 2012. Finton is a 4 year old boy who was born with a chromosomal deletion known as Cri du Chat. It is French for “cry of the cat”. When children with this rare syndrome are born, their cry actually sounds like a cat crying. Finton faced many serious health obstacles in his first three years of life. Some, but not all were related to his syndrome. He had two heart surgeries and a cleft lip repaired. He has also been labeled as failure to thrive and was in stage 3 malnutrition when he went to live with his aunt. Finton is no longer in any stages of malnutrition and has thrived during the last year and a half. He continues to be g-tube fed, but is very slowly accepting some soft foods. He has severe cognitive and developmental delays, but has made much progress with regular therapies and attending a preschool for those with delays. Fin can walk with assistance and is in the process of receiving a speech communication device, as he is also nonverbal. He loves the water, music, to be read to, and is a huge fan of Kipper the Dog and Thomas the Train. The Loveless family would love to attend camp this year. They would greatly appreciate any donations and would like to thank everyone in advance!

What We Need

The cost for a family to attend Victory Lane Camp is $2000. To help families experience this opportunity, Victory Lane Camp establishes campaigns for each family to reach this goal. The Loveless family has already received donations from other outside sources, so they only need to raise $900.

About Victory Lane Camp

Victory Lane Camp empowers and equips families with special needs to heal through their disability so that their future together builds healthy communities. For more information about Victory Lane Camp, please visit our website.

Other Ways You Can Help

Victory Lane Camp families need more than just financial assistance to go to camp this summer. We need your help to get the word out to your communities!

  • Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and Pinterest and share our message with your friends and family! We want to get the word out about how Victory Lane Camp empowers and equips families!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help the Upchurch family meet their goal!

Thank you for empowering and equipping this family to attend an experience that would have otherwise been out of reach.

*Special thanks to the Henry County Community Foundation for their generous donation of $1,000 to help the Loveless family come to camp*

story:
Forest fires in Indonesia are causing severe haze conditions in Sumatra, Kalimantan, and Papua. El Nino forecasts suggest that these conditions may continue until the end of December.

Yayasan Auriga's partners in these areas have indicated that there is little to no availability of N95 masks that fit children. Young lungs are the most susceptible to the harmful impacts of the particulates in the haze. Effectiveness of the N95 masks (the 95 refers to the percentage of the particulates the mask filters out) depends on proper fit, so adult masks do not offer kids full protection.

N95 masks for children, it turns out, are hard to find. But a company in Singapore called Innosparks earlier this year introduced  an N95 mask appropriate for children, and specifically designed for the facial contours of Asian children. http://www.airplus.sg/products.html#Smart-Mask

http://www.straitstimes.com/singapore/health/new-n95-mask-to-provide-better-fit-and-comfort-for-asians-especially-children

We have been in touch with Innosparks, and they have kindly offered a bulk rate of around US$ 0.75 per mask (Rp. 10,000 or SG$ 1), inclusive of tax. 

Yayasan Auriga local partners in Riau (Jikalahari), Jambi (Walhi Jambi), South Sumatra (Walhi Sumsel), and Central Kalimantan (Gerakan Anti Asap) are ready to distribute these masks. Depending on the amount of contributions received, Yayasan Auriga partners in West Kalimantan and Papua will also receive and distribute masks. 

Even as the government prepares evacuation plans in some of these areas, these masks will still be necessary to protect kids in transit and those who are not evacuated.

An initial distribution of around 20,000 of these masks will be underway by early next week (October 27 or 28).

The full amount of donations received on Indiegogo will be used to purchase the masks and transport them from Singapore to the local areas. Donations from other sources will be used to help with distribution costs and to buy other equipment and medicines. 

Questions regarding the details of the mask purchases and distribution plans can be directed at Grahat Nagara (grahat@auriga.or.id), Brian Orland (brianorland@gmail.com), and Timer Manurung (timer@auriga.or.id).

Yayasan Auriga is a Jakarta-based NGO that works on environmental issues across Indonesia. https://auriga.or.id
